Title: Software Engineer Full-stack Developer (f/m/d)
Description: To support our development team, we are looking for a Software Engineer or Full-stack Developer(f/m/d) with a focus on Java.     What you will do with us   You work as a valuable part of our agile international team on exciting software projects. You keep your skills, abilities, and knowledge up to date – with regular innovation time and training or conference attendance. You can actively contribute your ideas to our own products. You will develop in full-stack, though you will be able to set your own focus, plus you will have colleagues who will gladly support you in case you are stuck.     What we use  Viaboxx Technology Stack: https://stackshare.io/companies/viaboxx-gmbh     What you can show us   You have a degree in Computer Science or a comparable field of study. You have good English skills – speaking and writing. German is a plus. Along with your specialist expertise as a developer, you bring along a healthy portion of innovative spirit and drive to realize solutions. You are interested in project and product development and you do not shy away from assuming responsibility. You wish to improve your knowledge and you love to be part of a team – after all, only together we will reach our goals.     What you can expect from us   The drive of innovation is our top priority: We always strive to extend our knowledge and deliver success for our team and our customers. Our ideas are implemented by the whole team: We work with cutting-edge technologies, flat hierarchies, and agile methods including company-wide retrospectives. We trust each other: Instead of a time clock, we have flexible, trust-based working hours, and possibilities for home office. Develop and evolve: In our international team, you can learn from your colleagues, actively help to shape our work environment, and pick up responsibilities quickly. Dev, Ops and beyond: We love thinking outside the box, in new ways to broaden our possibilities. Team spirit is important to us: We value open and effective communication between all team members and get together whenever possible for various group activities and events.    All this in a stylish, classical villa, where our working climate feels like home.    Does this sound like your kind of thing? Then apply now!  Applications in German are also welcome.

Title: Data Engineer
Description: Impact  You will lead the evolution of our next-gen Data Platform, which will enable our data analysts and data scientists to develop insights and models that actively drive our business, and that of our international clients, to improve every single day. You will be handling the back-end operations of our Data platform and support in new implementations.   The job  You are the Data Engineer: your growing experience in the fields of data engineering, data warehouse design, or a similar field, will help you to ensure that 5CA can effectively continue to feed data into our data platform. Furthermore, you will be responsible for ensuring smooth optimized services with business requirements so that we can continue to generate state-of-the-art data reporting & data analytics on crucial aspects of our business. You are someone who is not only flexible but who actively thrives in such a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. You perform regular maintenance activities and ensure SLAs and KPIs are met along with your team. You are proactive, solution orientated, and excellent at stakeholder management and being a team player when your team needs your expertise.   Responsibilities   Ensure that our data landscape can keep up with the rapid growth of our business; Set up the data model and data pipeline (Big Data and Cloud); Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality; Building up tailored solutions to meet business needs, executing the solutions; Responsible for integration services SSIS, SSAS, DWH, ETL; Collaborate with fellow Data Scientists and Data Analysts to ensure the data will be effective and efficiently consumed.    Requirements   Minimum of 5 years hands-on experience in Data Engineering or Data Warehousing or similar; Must have at least 2 years minimum experience working in Microsoft Azure ecosystems; Data Bricks and Data Factory, Data lake store Gen2, Azure SQL, PowerBI Must have prior knowledge and hands-on experience with SSIS, SSAS tabular, and Dimensional Data Modelling; Must have scripting/coding experience in T-SQL, C#, Python, (Bonus points for Scala) Bonus points if you have, Microsoft Certification “DP-200 & DP-201” OR DP-203 Communicate fluently in English, allowing you to operate comfortably in a highly international and fast pace organization.    We offer   A salary matching market standards including secondary benefits and vacation days A fast-growing organization (double-digit growth!) and an international, inclusive company culture An inspiring environment with young, brilliant, and creative professionals with which you will have lots of fun at the office Office in a great location in Utrecht: two minutes from the central train station Continuous learning and plenty of opportunities for growth within your field of expertise    About Us  5CA a remote-first CX company working with passionate agents from all around the world. Founded in 1998, we represent some of the biggest names in gaming and tech and level up their customer and player experience.   Our community is full of digital natives and gamers that troubleshoot with care for the brands they love, from home, in their languages. We work with people from all cultures and backgrounds, and champion diversity and inclusion in all that we do.   As part of this recruitment process, 5CA may conduct a screening activity on your publicly available social media accounts registered on Twitter, Linked-In, Facebook and/or Instagram. For further details, please refer to our privacy policy.

Title: Software Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Would creating future energy products excite you?  Do you love collaborating with teams to solve complex problems and deliver solutions?  Join our Software Development Team  Our Oilfield-Services-Digital-Team works with our business to provide intelligent, connected technologies. We develop and maintain applications and tools for our internal and external customers for data acquisition, data processing and visualization. We collaborate with development teams in science, mechanical and electrical engineering, physics, and geoscience, to develop innovative firmware and application software.   Partner with the best  As a Software Developer, you'll take ownership of the development process, ensuring the continuous improvement of our code. Part of a Scrum Team, you'll collaborate with Product Owners and Domain Experts to create features for our applications. You will engineer and develop versatile products and services for the energy industry.   As a Software Developer, you will be responsible for:    Supporting the technical lead with managing a diverse team of software developers, conceptualizing future products and features for a commercial drilling automation system Collaborating with users, stakeholders, and development teams to plan development of features for new and existing applications Understanding the business needs, value, and scope Hands on sustaining of existing components of a drilling automation system including OPC UA infrastructure     Fuel your passion    To be successful in this role you will:    Be a graduate in Computer Science, IT or similar or demonstrate equivalent professional work experience Have in-depth knowledge of .NET technology stack in C# using modern software development principles Demonstrate practical experience with developing web applications using web socket connections as well as RESTful interfaces Have experience with developing web applications using web socket connections as well as RESTful interfaces Have knowledge on Java-/Typescript and Angular framework Show knowledge on the concepts of TCP communication protocols, such as WCF, OPC UA Demonstrate experience in requirements documentation, verification, and validation Show the ability to be a self-starter and a good team player Have experience in WPF / WCF / PRISM / Visual Studio and TFS/Azure DevOps Be fluent in English (oral and written) and excellent all-round communication skills    Work in a way that works for you  We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:    Working flexible hours - flexing the times you work in the day Working 4 or 5 days a week    Working with us  Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.   Working for you  Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:    Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities Comprehensive private medical care options Safety net of life insurance and disability programs Tailored financial programs Additional elected or voluntary benefits    About Us:  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.   Join Us:  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.   Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.   R36752

Title: Data Engineer (all genders)
Description: Tasks  As a Data Engineer you will join our fast growing Data Engineering team. We are result oriented and passionate about implementing modern data stack (Python, BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Airflow, Dbt). You are always motivated to develop yourself personally and professionally. Now become part of the fastest growing PropTech company in Germany.   You will…   design and implement data models for our data products & services monitor and troubleshoot performance issues on the data pipelines feeding our Machine Learning models collaborate with data scientists, engineers, product teams and other key stakeholders to drive ML projects from conception to completion verify data quality, and/or ensure it via data quality monitoring & alerting solutions do research and implement best practices to improve the existing data & machine learning infrastructure discuss your ideas and share your knowledge with the team    Requirements    You have…   successfully completed a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or other related fields at least 3 years of hands-on experience in the data engineering or backend engineering or machine learning engineering field. at least two years of relevant experience with data languages: SQL, Python experience working with SQL & dataops tools such as dbt very good knowledge of databases (pref. PostgreSQL), data modelling and data warehousing experience in building, testing and deploying batch & real time ML prediction services good OS knowledge, like Shell (e.g. Bash), SSH, etc. experience with data integration tools (ELT/ETL) and/or frameworks (pref. Airflow) advanced experience working with big and complex data sets within large organizations and an analytical mindset experience in modern development processes such as agile methodologies, CI/CD, and Code review processes. experience with Machine Learning Frameworks like MLflow, TensorFlow or PyTorch (nice to have!) strong communication skills in English and teamwork spirit   Our current Tech Stack:   Python, Shell scripting PostgreSQL Apache Airflow Cloud composer GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, dbt BigQuery Gitlab Tableau    Benefits    Responsibility and the opportunity to work independently from day one and shape the setup of one of the fastest growing companies in Germany All the technical equipment you need as well as feel good gimmicks like fresh fruit and snacks, ginger shots, soft drinks, hot drinks, delicious smoothies An onboarding through our McAcademy A modern office, directly in Berlin Spree Tower with a 360 degree view over Berlin Team and company events as well as regular get-togethers both digitally and in our Berlin office   McMakler is the leading hybrid broker in Germany and one of the largest real estate brokers. With our in-house technology platform, we are pioneers in the digitalisation of the real estate industry. We currently employ more than 400 full time real estate brokers at over 100 locations in Germany, Austria and France, who have excellent knowledge of the regional conditions. Our agents are supported by almost 600 employees at our headquarters in Berlin, where, among other business functions, McMakler's analysis and marketing technology is developed. With more than 350,000 valued properties, we have developed into a leading PropTech. Become part of our McMakler family and actively contribute to new success stories!   McMakler is an equal opportunity employer: We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates. We welcome employees regardless of their ethnic origin, gender, religion or belief, disability, age or sexual identity.

Title: Data Engineer Autonomous Driving (m/w/d)
Description: Aufgabe   Als Data Engineer hast Du Spaß daran datengetriebene Software-Lösungen zu entwickeln und in die Praxis umzusetzen. Du interessierst Dich für moderne Web- und Cloud-Technologien zur Applikationsentwicklung für das autonome Fahren? Dann erwartet Dich folgendes bei uns   Entwicklung von Cloud-Anwendungen zur Analyse von Daten für autonomes Fahren Mitarbeit bei der Konzeption und Spezifikation von Architekturen und deren Realisierung Erstellung von data driven Software in Java oder Scala Zusammenarbeit in einem agilen DevOps Team      Profil    Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation Du hast bereits in Java oder Scala programmiert und interessierst Dich für neueste Cloud-Technologien wie AWS oder Microsoft Azure Die agile Softwareentwicklung ist Dir vertraut. Du besitzt gute Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse.

Title: Node.js Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: As Node.js Software Engineer (m/f/d)  you will be joining a team responsible for providing technical solutions and support to the Marketing Department in order to improve Westwing customer acquisition and relationship. Our team is associated with our Warsaw Hub but our team members work from all across Poland and Germany. We’re currently growing the team and we’re looking for experienced engineers that will help us build and expand our applications. The position is unlimited.   WHAT YOU’LL DO   work on the full software development life cycle: from the analysis, design up to implementing and deploying the final solution provide value to the business with the code you produce take full ownership of the software the team produces ensure maintainability of the solution as well as blazing fast performance    YOU COME WITH   several years of experience in NodeJS backend development passion for shipping. CI/CD is a must. Putting code live every day is a given experience working in TDD strong problem-solving skills and proactive attitude in suggesting solutions and improvements good communication skills, fluent English    WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT   working in an international, diverse team of experts in a dynamic and fast-paced e-commerce environment countless opportunities to grow your career and shape your professional future centrally located and dog-friendly offices with free beverages and fruits, cafeteria with different lunch options, diverse sports and health offerings and regular team and afterwork events up to 40% employee discount, volunteering day off, company pension scheme, discounted mobility options (e.g. public transport, JobRad, Swapfiets) and company daycare “Westwing Wichtel” state-of-the-art tech infrastructure running on AWS and Kubernetes (check out our Techradar), professionally equipped workstation (Mac, screens, peripherals, etc) of your personal choice and yearly training budget for every tech team member remote working model with designated in-office tribe weeks, read more on our Tech Blog    What are you waiting for? Apply via our online form. We are looking forward to your application including your possible starting date. If you have any questions regarding the job, please contact Andrea Galantucci   Please note that we don’t accept Email-Applications!  Diversity is deeply rooted in the Westwing culture. Our mission doesn’t stop to inspire only your design choices, it continues to embrace an inclusive lifestyle filled with respect to everyone’s uniqueness, cultural differences and equal opportunity.   ABOUT WESTWING  Being part of Westwing  means working in an inspiring and diverse environment that enables you to grow. Our more than 2,300 international team members connect creativity and style with state-of-the-art technology and strong business fundamentals. Westwing is the European leader in inspiration-based Home and Living eCommerce with EUR 522m of revenue in 2021 across 11 countries. Our mission is: To inspire and make every home a beautiful home. Through our 'shoppable magazine', we inspire our loyal Home Enthusiast customers with a curated product selection and combine it with gorgeous content. The company was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in Munich.

Title: Data Engineer - Data Platform (d/f/m)
Description: Our story:  Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.   Spread across Berlin and Madrid, Team Taxfix is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with 500+ professionals from 45+ different nationalities, we're rich in ideas and voices. In five years, we've raised over 300 million euros in funding and helped people reclaim more than one billion euros.   Your challenge:  We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to help build the tools and pipelines to provide a self-served and efficient data environment at Taxfix. Together with the rest of the team you will design, build and maintain a secure and scalable platform that will help Taxfix to keep growing a data-driven culture.   You will work on different projects focusing on our three mission enablers, scalable data infrastructure, self serve data tooling and secure data governance, that will support the rest of the company to work with the best data. The team goal is to provide an easy way to access other teams in the organization to the data generated by our apps and other sources so they can be enabled to bring value.   The data engineer role we are looking for is one with strong software engineer skills but at the same time knowledge of the most recent data technologies. Snowflake, Airflow, Segment.io, AVO, and dbt are part of our core tech stack but we are looking to explore new technologies and new tools that will help us achieve the goal of building a self-served and efficient data environment, so you with the team will play an important role introducing these new technologies.   Your team:  You will be working within a focus mission team of Data Engineers and the support of a Product Manager. Your team is part of the Data Organization, which enables everyone in the company to make data-driven decisions and drive business growth. We’re committed to data democratization, scalability, and actionable insights. With a team of Data Analysts ranging from Growth Analytics to Operations, Finance and Product Analytics, Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers, and Machine Learning Engineers, we’re building tools and methodologies for data discoverability, accessibility, and reliability. Due to the Data Platform mission, we are working close with different teams and cross-functional team projects are common, so you can expect to work with other team members and be part of new project teams. Our team members have different data engineering backgrounds, some of them coming from backend development and some other from other data positions, so the combination of these skills makes it easy to connect with other teams. We can rely on each other to deliver our best and are committed to personal development via knowledge sharing, through mentoring and innovation days   Responsibilities:   You create the platform that makes ingestion of data in a fast-paced environment a breeze You will be responsible for the data infrastructure and data security in Taxfix Data Organization You will be responsible to research new technologies that will help the team to achieve the mission goals You will participate in the data architecture design and decision making process You will be integral in establishing team-wide standards: excellent documentation, monitoring & alerting, code quality, unit testing, CI + CD    Requirements    2+ years experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar position Strong SQL skills Proven track record of working with Python for Data Engineering around Data Ingestion and Data Quality. Knowledge about the current data engineering tools on the market Experience working in cloud infrastructure (Google Cloud, AWS or Azure) Excitement to work cross-functionally with different specialisms A team player and don’t mind “getting your hands dirty“ to support others Solid communication: We constantly work close to different teams in different domains(business, analytics, engineering) so you need to be ready to interact with them   Plus points for:   Airflow, Docker, Kubernetes Knowledge and experience of Data quality and monitoring best practices Knowledge of Data Science processes   Why Taxfix?   A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals. Holistic wellbeing with mental health coaching sessions, a discounted membership to Urban Sports Club, and supplemental child care support. Employee stock options for all employees—because everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create. Dedicated relocation and visa support for those that need it. Choose to work from home or our modern office when needed—plus healthy drinks and snacks when you do come in. 30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours. Full trust to take ownership of your work in a flat hierarchy where feedback is encouraged and expected. A generous learning budget to support your personal and professional development and guidance from our internal L&D experts Plenty of opportunities to socialise as a team. In addition to internal tech meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethers—virtually and in person when possible. Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix app—and internal support for all personal tax-related questions. Have a four-legged friend in your life? We’re happy to have dogs join us in the office.   Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture below:   At Taxfix, we don't just accept diversity—we celebrate it. We're proudly committed to equal employment opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. We cherish each person's individual contribution to our overall identity, purpose, and goals. Join us!

Title: Data Engineer - EMEA - Mainland Europe - Germany - Berlin
Description: InterWorks is an award-winning, best-in-class global consultancy. We believe in hiring the best people to do the best work for the best clients. Our commitment to quality solutions and to our people sets us apart. Our secret is building a great team supported by an inclusive, fun culture to produce amazing results for our clients.  InterWorks was named a Forbes Small Giant, and we are routinely named one of the best places to work, with stellar reviews from our employees. We have numerous benefits that come with the joining team, including health benefits, exciting perks and professional development.  Are you aching to jump into a fast-paced work environment that will keep you on your toes? If you have an unquenchable passion for data and problem solving, we want you on our team. The heart of this position is creation and maintenance of analytics infrastructure, building systems that make data accessible.  We need someone whose overall data and programming savvy outweighs niche experience with a certain database platform. Whether you’ve worked primarily with cloud or on-prem data platforms, using Snowflake, SQL, Server, Postgres, or something else, all we really care about is that you have a strong understanding of building data pipelines and are ready to hit the ground running.   What You’ll Do  · Tackle diverse projects that range in duration from a few days to several months for clients ranging from local businesses to the Fortune 500.  · Work with different data sources (relational databases, flat files, Big Data systems, high-performance analytical databases, etc.) to unify client data.  · Collaborate closely with users to understand their unique needs and support them with the best solutions.  · Solve data acquisition, integration, and management problems.  · Create ELT processes based on client needs while managing client expectations.   What You’ll Need   Must-Haves  · Excellent SQL fluency  · Strong ETL proficiency using GUI-based tools or code-based patterns  · Understanding of data-modelling principles  · Programming (Python, Java, C#, PHP, etc.)  · Essential knowledge and experience of Cloud technologies (AWS, Microsoft, Azure)  · Excellent verbal and written communication skills  · Strong problem-solving skills  · Adaptability and flexibility in changing situations  · Passion for delivering compelling solutions that exceed client expectations  · Fluent German (C1) and English   What We’d Like You to Have  · Experience with software engineering practices  · Experience with modern data-engineering practices and frameworks  · Snowflake, Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, Azure Synapse  · Matillion, Fivetran, Airflow, DBT or other ELT tools  · Experience with integration from API sources   What We Offer  · Work from wherever you want in the region. Choose your work location when not on client site. We are a remote-first company, so we can accommodate almost any home office location  · You want to keep your carbon footprint small? So do we! That's why every employee in Germany gets a Bahncard 50  · We want you to stay healthy, which is why our employees can get a membership at “Urban Sports Club”  · Everyone has a tough time every now and then. As an employee you get access to Evermood, a digital platform for mental health support  · Windows or Mac? 13 inch or 15 inch? Lightweight or heavy-duty? You know what works best for you. Therefore our employees have a wide choice of equipment for their home office, as well as a contribution towards standing desk equipment  · We InterWorkers like to use our powers for good. As well as undertaking pro bono consulting work, we support our colleagues’ individual charitable passions with dedicated time off for volunteering  · Competitive salaries with room for advancement. Expected Salary range: €60,000 - €80,000   Why InterWorks  Please don't talk yourself out of applying if our list of requirements doesn’t describe you exactly. Whether you think you don’t meet the requirements precisely, or you feel that you have something to offer over and above what we’ve listed, at InterWorks we value unique contributions - we know that our people are the glue that holds our business together. We’re always looking for the right people, and we could be your perfect fit.

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d) Bahntechnik- und Signaltechnik
Description: Bei ALTEN entwickeln Sie die Technologien von morgen und vor allem sich selbst! Wir sind strategischer Partner für Unternehmen aus dem Umfeld des Bahn- und Schienenverkehrswesens. Dabei entwickeln wir für Projekte der   „Digitalen Schiene Deutschland“ Technologien wie ETCS, TMS, OBU, LockTrac, ARAMIS, Stellwerke, Streckensysteme, bzw. vieles mehr im Zug und auf der Strecke. Sind Sie bereit für agile und innovative Projekte bei denen Sie durch Ihr technisches Know-how punkten können? Dann verstärken Sie unser Team!   Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir ab sofort Mitarbeiter/innen in Festanstellung oder freiberuflicher Tätigkeit als   Ihre Aufgaben   Als Data Engineer (m/w/d) übertragen Sie Daten auf Basis von kundenspezifischen Informationsquellen für verschiedene Bahnstrecken Hierbei importieren Sie Daten sowohl automatisch als auch manuell aus Rohdatendokumenten und Planungszeichnungen Zudem erweitern Sie Engineering-Leitfäden aus den grundlegenden Erkenntnissen Ihrer Arbeit Des Weiteren überprüfen Sie die konstruierten Daten und stellen das richtige Qualitätsniveau sicher Darüber hinaus sind Sie für die Ideenfindung, Optimierung und Umsetzung der Prozesse verantwortlich   Ihr Profil   Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Elektrotechnik, Nachrichtentechnik, Informatik, Berufserfahrung als ausgebildeter Techniker oder Vergleichbares Berufserfahrung in der Bahntechnik, speziell mit Planungsdaten, Dokumenten und Zeichnungen, bringen Sie mit Weiterhin besitzen Sie Kenntnisse im Eisenbahnverkehrsmanagementsystem zur Überprüfung der erstellten Daten Zudem kennen Sie sich in RailML/XML sowie der Datenspeicherung (Nexus) im Konfigurationsmanagement-Repository aus Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab    Unsere Benefits    Flache Hierarchien und Duz-Kultur Modernes IT-Equipment und Büroausstattung Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten durch die digitale Lernplattform „ALTEN Trainings Center“ Betriebliche Altersvorsorge sowie Krankenzusatzversicherung Fahrtkosten- und Steuerberatungszuschuss Sonderurlaub bei außergewöhnlichen Ereignissen Exklusive Mitarbeiterrabatte Kostenfreie Getränke an unseren Standorten Corporate Events wie Sommerfest und Weihnachtsfeier   Sie sind auf der Suche nach spannenden Aufgaben und einem unbefristeten Arbeitsverhältnis? Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt über unser Online-Bewerbungsformular.

Title: Junior Cloud Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Unternehmensbeschreibung  ADFERENECE ist ein schnell wachsendes und innovatives Technologie-Unternehmen für Online Marketing-Optimierung. Seit 2019 ist ADFERENCE ein Tochter-Unternehmen des Fashion-Tech-Anbieters ABOUT YOU. Unsere Werbe-Technologien für Amazon und Google Ads unterstützen Werbetreibende dabei, automatisiert Kampagnen zu erstellen sowie die richtige Budgetverteilung für Millionen von Werbeanzeigen zu setzen. Zu unseren Kunden zählen E-Commerce Unternehmen wie Snocks  , Spreadshirt  und Lampenwelt  sowie große Marketingagenturen.   Stellenbeschreibung  Du bringst Begeisterung fürs Data Engineering im Cloud-Umfeld mit? Du willst neue Technologien kennenlernen und als Teil eines tollen Teams frühzeitig Verantwortung übernehmen? Dann bieten wir dir hier genau die richtige Herausforderung, um gemeinsam mit uns zu wachsen!   DAS ERWARTET DICH BEI UNS   Du entwickelst und betreibst Data Processing Pipelines unter Verwendung passender AWS-Services Du implementierst Data Provisioning Solutions zur Versorgung unserer internen Services (z. B. UI, BI, Analytics) mit Fokus auf Skalierbarkeit, Geschwindigkeit und Zuverlässigkeit Du konzipierst und erstellst neue bzw. überarbeitest unsere bestehenden Data Analytics Plattformen / Data Warehouses Du optimierst unsere aktuellen Data Solutions im Hinblick auf Kosten, Latenz, Laufzeit und Stabilität Du optimierst die Anwendungs- und Query-Performances   Qualifikationen  DAS BRINGST DU MIT   Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in den Bereichen Data Engineering, Informatik, BI-Systeme oder eine passende Weiterbildung Du hast erste praktische Erfahrungen in der Arbeit mit Datenbanken sowie im Data Engineering (idealerweise in Cloud-Umgebungen) Du hast Interesse am Design und Aufbau automatisierter Data-Pipelines und Data-Lakes sowie an der Arbeit mit Data Warehouses Du verfügst über grundlegende Kenntnisse des AWS-Stacks bezüglich Datenservices (z. B. S3, RDS, Athena, Redshift, Glue etc.) Du hast Kenntnisse in der Entwicklung SQL-Queries und REST APIs Du hast Programmierkenntnisse in Python Du verfügst über sehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift   Zusätzliche Informationen  DAS BIETEN WIR DIR   Ein spannendes Arbeitsumfeld in einer dynamischen und zukunftssicheren Branche Fairer, kollegialer und offener Umgang im gesamten Team Freiheit um zu wachsen, aber auch wertschätzende Führung Eigenverantwortlichkeit in der Arbeit, flache Hierarchien und eine offene Feedbackkultur Moderne Arbeitszeitgestaltung, wie etwa Home-Office (bis zu 100%, mit Bereitschaft für einige Präsenztage pro Jahr) und flexible Arbeitszeiten    Benefits    Nutze jährlich ein Entwicklungsbudget in der Höhe von 750€ Euro, das Du einsetzen kannst um Dich weiterzubilden 40% Rabatt im ABOUT YOU Online Shop Angebot der betrieblichen Altersvorsorge Kostenlose Parkplätze und gute Erreichbarkeit im ÖPNV Die Möglichkeit, ein Fahrrad über das Unternehmen zu leasen Kostenlose Getränke & frisches Obst Regelmäßige Academies, gemeinsame Events und Get-Togethers   Das klingt nach einer spannenden Herausforderung? Dann freuen wir uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe des frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins, deiner Gehaltsvorstellung und ggf. Einblicken in deine bisherige Arbeit.

Title: (Junior) Software Developer / Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Lucht Probst Associates has provided expert knowledge to banks and financial institutions for their client business for over 20 years. Our software solutions have been a key component in our success. We build cutting-edge applications that are used in the most important Global banks.     Your responsibilities  As a (Junior) Software Developer / Engineer (m/f/d), you will join our team of experts in Leipzig to work on the development of new software solutions and the further development of existing ones. Our software solutions are used in the financial industry across the world and are based on a highly advanced technology stack.    Using the agile development model SCRUM, you will analyse requirements in refinement meetings and carry out cost estimates. You will discuss the implementation of requirements with colleagues in the context of sprint planning sessions, with the goal of finding sustainable solutions. In the sprint itself, you will then develop the planned features, review the code of your colleagues in pull requests and test the resulting software on the CI/CD server. In the sprint review, you will present your work and successes to our stakeholders. At the end of each sprint, you will meet up with your colleagues for a retrospective session where you will take a look back at the last sprint with the aim of optimising your collaboration.    As well as this product-centred work, your team will also be responsible for ensuring the continuous improvement and automation of the development and deployment processes.    Your individual professional development is important to us. For this reason, we will give you the opportunity to develop your skills and knowledge on a continuous basis within the context of specialist team sessions.     Your ticket   A successfully completed degree in (Business) Information Technology, Mathematics, Physics or another science-based or engineering-based degree, or a comparable qualification Some initial experience in software development Knowledge of .Net, C#, HTML, Angular, JavaScript/TypeScript A current StackOverflow and/or GitHub profile would be an advantage Well-developed capacity for abstraction and good analytical and conceptual intellectual abilities Talent and the ability to get things done when it comes to the implementation of complex projects Very good English skills and at least intermediate German A love of innovation and an eye for quality Team spirit and an interest in agile development methods And not forgetting… a good sense of humour     Our features   FinTech meets consulting: an established international company with start-up flair Team-oriented, fun working environment with exciting tasks every day Team spirit is important for us and it is reflected in our everyday interactions. We hold regular employee events to actively promote this Flat hierarchies all the way to the executive floor A modern office in the heart of Frankfurt and good public transport connections An array of internal and external training opportunities     Your contact  If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact Sandra Futter via phone at +49 69 9714850. We look forward to receiving your application! We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion/belief, disability, age or sexual orientation and identity.

Title: Intelligence Data Engineer (d/f/m)
Description: Job Description    We are looking for a brilliant and dynamic Data Engineer (d/f/m)  to join our Image & Media Mining Analytics and Data Management team in Friedrichshafen. He/ she will be integrated in a group gathering data scientists, artificial intelligence experts and software development engineers who daily bridge the gap between R&T and R&D in the domain of Intelligence information systems for external customers as well as internal Airbus products.   Your activities will be contributing to the development of our Massive Intelligence platform: this system integrates and synchronizes multi-source processing, exploitation and dissemination of all collective assets and own Intelligence data bases of a customer. With functions including the processing, exploitation and fusion of huge volumes of heterogeneous data, supported by automated processing and smart dissemination, it directly supports decision makers at all levels of command.    Missions    The Intelligence Data Engineer (d/f/m) will be part of a SAFe Train and belong to an agile team building common assets for our solutions for further delivery to our program lines and/ or proof of concept.    His/ Her Main Missions Will Encompass     Contribution to the development of the backend / services platform Design and development of data workflows, data processing chains in a big data/ massive analysis context Integration at component level in cloud environments (internally developed components as well as partners’) Deployment of the backend platform according to customer needs and selected infrastructure Active participation to engineering reviews and SCRUM ceremonies and support to risk and opportunities analysis Permanently track new technology streams in the field of big data engineering and feed the team with this knowledge     Key Skills And Competencies    The Intelligence Data Engineer (d/f/m) will master key backend development as well as DEVOPS technologies in a big data context (data lake, data engineering as well as need to know, of utmost importance for our defense and security customers:    Java (with fastAPI, SpringBoot, Swagger) Docker (and possibly Kubernetes, Helm, Ansible, Rook Ceph) Bash, JSON, Curl Git MongoDB, PostgreSQL Linux and Windows platforms Team development experience in an Agile environment     Moreover You Will Be Working With     Intelligence experts: we are looking for candidates with basic knowledge on Intelligence information systems in order to tackle IMINT, HUMINT, COMINT and SIGINT challenges Analytics experts: at least awareness skills on artificial intelligence frameworks and mindsets matter to us (deep learning and Tensorflow for example)    We are looking for a team worker, flexible and adaptable to new challenges.Our team is located on several sites and several countries: daily communication will be done in English.   Please apply for this vacancy at our careers site (www.airbus.com)   This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.    Company    Airbus Defence and Space GmbH    Contract Type    Permanent Contract / CDI / Unbefristet / Contrato indefinido    Experience Level    Entry Level / Débutant / Anfänger / Recién titulado    Job Family    Software Engineering   By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.   Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.   Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.   At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: ConsenSys - Data Engineer - Direct Hire [Remote]
Description: ABOUT US  :   Braintrust is the only network that gives in-demand talent all the freedom of freelance with all the benefits, community and stability of a full-time role. As the first decentralized talent network, our revolutionary Web3 model ensures the community that relies on Braintrust to find work are the same people who own and build it through the blockchain token, BTRST. So unlike other marketplaces that take 20% to 50% of talent earnings, Braintrust allows talent to keep 100% of earnings and to vote on key changes to improve the network. Braintrust is working to change the way freelance works – for good.   JOB TYPE: Direct Hire Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below) LOCATION: Europe only - Remote (Time Zone: CET/WAT | Partial overlap) SALARY $50,000 – $150,000/yr ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - long-term    THE OPPORTUNITY  Compensation includes salary, bonus, and equity. Compensation based on experience and location.  ConsenSys is a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally  . We deliver products, solutions and platforms built using blockchain technology to transform how business is done in a complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers.   Infura’s development suite provides instant, scalable API access to the Ethereum and IPFS networks. Our world-class infrastructure ensures that developers can reliably scale their decentralized application to meet user demand. It’s powered by a cutting-edge microservice-driven architecture that dynamically scales to support our APIs.   Thousands of developers are actively using Infura every day and we process billions of events per day! The strength, reliability and stability of Infura’s infrastructure service makes the brand an essential pillar of the Ethereum ecosystem and the leading blockchain infrastructure provider.   Job Responsibilities: A day in the life of a Data Engineer  Infura is building a data platform to serve the needs of data scientists, business analysts, and end users. You will be collaborating with the product organization, data scientists, and business analysts to build both the underlying platform as well as data pipelines. Data pipelines will encompass both large-scale batch processing as well as real-time / stream data pipelines. You will design, develop, and operate data integration pipelines to provide high quality datasets for end user, analytical, and machine learning use-cases.   You will bring a deep understanding of software engineering best practices, such as proper use of source control, end to end testing process, and automated deployment mechanism to build a high quality data platform. While we have existing systems that require support and maintenance, you will also provide expertise to multiple teams at Infura by acting as a subject matter expert on best practices, tooling, and data engineering practices.   Required Skills  First and foremost, we want our data engineers to be great software engineers with a passion for writing high quality code. You appreciate agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and responsible experimentation. The ability to be pragmatic and articulate tradeoffs between a perfect solution and a working solution will make you successful in this role. The ideal candidate will have strong experience with various OLTP and OLAP databases, row and columnar oriented storage formats, ELT vs ETL processing, data lakes, and data warehousing.   Using strong programming skills in a language such as Python , Scala, Java, or Go, you have built production quality ETL pipelines at scale using Spark, Hadoop or similar framework. Ideally, you will have worked with modern data stores: AWS S3 based data lakes, AWS Redshift, or Snowflake. We are looking for a senior level candidate that can understand requirements, work autonomously, and communicate effectively. If taking ownership of scoping problems and delivering pragmatic solutions sounds interesting, this is the role for you   Bonus points for:  We use Druid, so any practical experience with this would be a bonus. Deep experience with data engineering in the AWS ecosystem, experience with orchestration tools (such as Airflow) or experience with infrastructure management tools such as terraform is beneficial. If you don’t check these boxes, don’t sweat it. We’d love to hear from you.   Apply Now!  #PL-BT   ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:  Qualified candidates will be invited to do a screening interview with the Braintrust staff. We will answer your questions about the project, and our platform. If we determine it is the right fit for both parties, we'll invite you to join the platform and create a profile to apply directly for this project.   C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.   Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Esprit isn’t just an Employer. It is more than a fashion brand, staying true to our core values of sustainability and diversity.   We are looking for real personalities. Smart characters with attitude, corners and edges. We love what we do. And so should you.   You are a team-player loving to take challenges together with your colleagues?   You would like to work in a company whose products are well-known and support such company in its success?   Then apply now as   Data Engineer (m/f/d)  to support our Team. (ID 16921)   Your responsibilities   You are actively consulting, analysing and documenting functional requirements and develop solutions based on an SQL environment You are supporting datasets based on all business processes in a retail and wholesale company ideally with Fashion background Keeping our tools and solutions up to date is key for our success. You are supporting this in an Azure environment in the cloud with on premise solutions combined You are building end to end processes in analytics from data source to report datasets Communication with and support or training of key users in Analytics and Reporting topics is part of the day to day job, ideally with experience in Power BI or similar visualisation tools Ensuring stable daily processes in the system is key for you including testing activity   Your skills   You have a degree in IT, business information technology or natural sciences or qualification and practical experience in data engineer area You have good experience with SQL architecture, ideally with Microsoft SQL server including SSIS or Azure environment You have experience with Databricks or at least extensive experience with Apache Spark Ability to write efficient SQL statements is key Additional skills like VBA, Python or R are beneficial You have experience with visualisation frontend tools, ideally with Power BI You have strong communication skills and you are a team player You have a solution oriented, independent way of working with excellent communication skills You have a good command of written and spoken German and English   Our Benefits   We have a flexible mobile office arrangement that allows you to choose your work location at least two days a week, plus we have flexible working hours We are a team that places a lot of value on collegial and open cooperation, open feedback is always appreciated With us you get 40% staff discount on our entire product range We don't have a dresscode, you can wear whatever you feel comfortable in We offer you of course a subsidy for public transport or you ca park on one of our free parking spaces We have an award-winning canteen that provides you with really tasty and healthy food every day   Are you a good match for this Job?   Then please submit an application with your salary expectations and an indication of your earliest starting date. Please feel free to contact Sabine Lang if you have any questions.

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/x)
Description: FINN makes mobility fun and sustainable. With a flexible car subscription, we bring a true e-commerce experience to car ownership and offset all CO2 emissions along the way. Join our fast-growing startup to build the most popular auto e-commerce platform. We work with the best car brands in the world and are backed by leading global investors.   Your Role  As a Data Engineer, you design, implement and maintain a state-of-the-art data architecture for our teams to facilitate our choice making with easily available data.   Why FINN?   The role is based in Munich, Germany. For candidates relocating to Munich, we provide full visa support. With massive growth potential, FINN allows you to quickly develop and succeed in a highly motivating startup environment with exciting projects in cross-functional teams. Excellent fixed salary, significant virtual equity share of the company, along with a yearly personal development budget of 1.500€. Our team is known for loads of fun and we have and frequent team events to strengthen our connection. At FINN you have complete freedom over your choice of equipment, accessories, editors, tools, and technology. Do you want to drive your own car with FINN? Get one with our employee discount program.    Your Responsibilities   Fuel FINN: Oversee architecture, development and maintenance of the data pipeline, providing the best information about its cars, customers and operations. Ensure FINN’s long-term strategic edge by automating key elements of the value chain. Strive for excellence: Strive to deliver the best possible user experience and to follow engineering best practices. Connect our teams: Partner and engage with software engineers, data analysts and members of the senior management team to provide insights and recommendations in their respective business areas. Build it, run it: Build features with a ‘build it, run it’ mindset and be responsible for testing, deploying, and monitoring your code. We believe in Serverless!    Your Profile   3+ years of data engineering experience in larger projects. 5+ years of experience with Python and SQL. Development, deployment and monitoring of ETL/ELT setup and practical experience with Google BigQuery, dbt, Fivetran, Looker. Production experience in designing, implementing and deploying ELT pipelines or data warehouse architectures. Previous experience in an agile development team is a plus. Strong growth mindset and the motivation to continuously improve self and team performance. Fluency in English.    Interested in Joining Our Fast-Growing Startup?  Please upload your CV and transcripts online. Anna Kaiser is looking forward to your application!   Equal Opportunities for Everyone  FINN is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and safe environment for all employees. Experience comes in many forms and we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team. We encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn't perfectly align with what we have listed. We'd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Engineer
Description: Do you want to become a part of an experienced and highly motivated team? Do you want to have a meaningful impact in the financial services industry? If so, then we have a great opportunity for you.  We're looking for a Data Engineer  to join our RegTech company.   You're a strong team player, proactive with an entrepreneurial mindset. You solve problems with a positive, "can-do" attitude and you're used to analyzing multiple scenarios and selecting the most suitable path. If you're also a fast learner and passionate about technology, you're the perfect candidate for our RegTech company.   Tasks  What you will be tasked to do:   Apply state-of-the-art AI and Deep Learning technology to new product features Define and adapt our Natural Language Processing (NLP) architecture Build robust, industrial scale data processing pipelines Implement technology between latest AI research and product development Validate and test models in downstream tasks    Requirements    Requirements:   Background in engineering, data science or linguistics Experience with data pipelines, model validation and downstream testing Experience in Natural Language Processing and working with language data Understanding and experience in Python and computational/NLP libraries like Numpy, Tensorflow, PyTorch, NLTK, Spacy and Jupyter Basic understanding of deep learning, knowledge representation and reasoning Experience in industrial data processing and machine learning architecture is a strong plus (Spark, Airflow, UIMA) Experience with graph databases, knowledge graphs, ontologies or logic programming is a strong plus (Neo4j, Stardog, Grakn, OWL, Prolog) Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a good command of written and spoken English. German would also be an advantage.    Benefits    What we offer you:   Develop state-of-the-art machine learning and AI solutions for products Plenty of room to advance and learn and apply new technologies Great office in the heart of Frankfurt Flexible work arrangements, especially in COVID-19 times Budget for your own device Family-friendly workplace Inclusive work environment Passionate people around an exciting global product A team with an entrepreneurial mindset, hunger for speed, and immediate results   Join Apiax and be a part of something big.  We’re looking forward to meeting you.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d) at Webgears Group
Description: The Webgears Group successfully operates international Smart-Shopping Portals that reach more than ten million users each month. Our goal is to give our users access to vouchers and deals to provide them with inspiration during their shopping process. This is achieved using an intelligent system to pair an extensive list of e-commerce brands on the sites of popular media companies. In addition to the deal communities mydealz and hotukdeals, digital US media brands such as CNET, The Daily Beast and boston .com, Glamour and The Sun in the UK or Welt, Bild and Computerbild in Germany rank amongst our partners.   As Data Engineer (m/f/d)  you will support our team with bringing order into our data sets. In this position you will be responsible for finding trends in our data sets, optimizing data retrieval and developing dashboards and reports for stakeholders.   This position can be located in Berlin (GER), Götzis (AUT) or fully remote  within the EU.   Tasks   Development and maintenance of our data warehouse including responsibility for data preparation and assurance of data quality from different sources (e.g. clicks, costs, turnover) Development of automated and aggregated reports, dashboards and both specialized and ad hoc analyses Regular reassessment of data sets and optimization of data in collaboration with all departments    Requirements    Completed university degree in Economics, Mathematics or Controlling and previous relevant work experience. We are also open to receiving applications by motivated career starters. Very good knowledge in digital data visualization, Python and experience with data warehouses Very good SQL knowledge, preferably AWS Redshift/PostgreSQL Affinity for big unstructured data sets and numbers Experience in working with Tableau will be an advantage Entrepreneurial mindset and hands-on mentality Very good knowledge in MS-Office, especially Excel Very good English language skills    Benefits    An internationally successful company Diverse, motivated team with flat hierarchies and company-wide open-door policy Possibility to bring your own ideas to life and participate in key decision-making processes Annual budget for attending personal development courses, conferences and/or other external trainings Flexible working times and option for working remotely   We are looking forward to your application!

Title: Data Engineer* für Data Spaces
Description: Mit unserer Abteilung Enterprise Information Systems sind wir Hauptpartner und Technologieprovider des International Data Space, einem zentralen Pfeiler für das deutsch-europäische Flaggschiff-Projekt GAIA-X. Wir modellieren, verknüpfen und analysieren Daten in Unternehmen und über Unternehmensgrenzen hinweg, mit Anwendungen von Industrie 4.0 bis Medizin.       Was Sie bei uns tun   Erforschung, Konzeption, Aufbau und Betrieb von zentralen und dezentralen Data Spaces im Sinne der Konzepte des International Data Spaces und von GAIA-X Erforschung, Konzeption und Implementierung von Kubernetes-basierten Data Pipelines für skalierbare KI-Anwendungen Scouting und Wissensvermittlung bezüglich Tools und Methoden in den Bereichen DevOps, Data Engineering und Data Spaces innerhalb von Schulungen und Workshops mit unseren Kund*innen Konzeption von größeren Softwaresystemen und Mitgestaltung von Technologieentscheidungen, insbesondere im Bereich Cloud Infrastructure und Big Data Frameworks Konzeption und Betrieb von containerisierten KI Entwicklungs-, Test- und Produktionsumgebungen Weiterentwicklung unserer Development-Infrastruktur und der CI/CD Prozesse       Was Sie mitbringen   Abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Master, Diplom) in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung Praktische Erfahrung im Bereich DevOps und Software-Engineering Erfahrung im Bereich der Containervirtualisierung, insbesondere mit dem Betrieb von Container-basierten Anwendungen mit Docker und Kubernetes Fundierte Kenntnisse in Java, Skriptsprachen sowie Linux Administration Routine im Umgang mit Tools wie Git (z.B. gitlab, bitbucket) sowie mit Continuous Integration Technologie (z.B. gitlab-ci, bamboo) Vorteilhaft sind Erfahrungen mit mindestens einem Cloud-Anbieter (z.B. Azure oder AWS) und Grundkenntnisse in den Bereichen Software-Entwicklung sowie GPU Computing Professionelles Auftreten sowie verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und Englisch (beides C1)       Was Sie erwarten können   Sie arbeiten an unserem Institut an der Spitze der angewandten Forschung in Data Spaces, Data Engineering, Big Data Analytics und Infrastruktur, KI sowie Machine Learning und verbinden aktuelle Forschungsarbeiten mit wirtschaftlicher Relevanz in einmaliger Weise. Wir setzen auf innovative Lösungen und konzipieren völlig neuartige Produkte. Sie können dabei sein und aktiv die Zukunft mitgestalten. Sie erhalten maßgeschneiderte Soft-Skills- und fachliche Weiterbildungen. Sie arbeiten in einem offenen, kollegialen und internationalen Arbeitsumfeld mit dynamischer und kreativer Arbeitsatmosphäre. Wir bieten Ihnen ein Umfeld, in dem Sie eigenständig Ihre wissenschaftlichen Ideen in die Anwendung bringen können. In unserem Institut ist Diversity ein wichtiges, strategisches Ziel: Wir setzen uns aktiv für Chancengleichheit und Vielfalt ein. Wir unterstützen eine gute Work-Life-Balance durch flexible Arbeitszeiten und Teilzeitmodelle. Wir leben eine familienfreundliche Kultur: Manchmal geht die Familie vor – wir wissen das.      Wir wertschätzen und fördern die Vielfalt der Kompetenzen unserer Mitarbeitenden und begrüßen daher alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von Alter, Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität. Schwerbehinderte Menschen werden bei gleicher Eignung und Qualifikation bevorzugt eingestellt.      Die wöchentliche Arbeitszeit beträgt 39 Stunden. Die Stelle kann auch in Teilzeit besetzt werden. Anstellung, Vergütung und Sozialleistungen basieren auf dem Tarifvertrag für den öffentlichen Dienst (TVöD). Zusätzlich kann Fraunhofer leistungs- und erfolgsabhängige variable Vergütungsbestandteile gewähren. Die Stelle ist zunächst auf 2 Jahre befristet, mit der Möglichkeit der Verlängerung.       Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt online mit Ihren aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen. Wir freuen uns darauf, Sie kennenzulernen!       Fragen zu dieser Ausschreibung beantwortet Ihnen gern:  Frau Jasmin Kröhling  Tel 02241 14-2636    www.iais.fraunhofer.de

Title: Data Engineer (w/m/d)
Description: Data Engineer (w/m/d)  gesucht  - Für unseren Kunden, ein Unternehmen mit Sitz in Hamburg, suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Data Engineer (w/m/d)  .   Bei der Position handelt es sich um eine direkte Festanstellung bei unserem Kunden. Die Betreuung und Vermittlung sowie alle unsere weiteren Serviceleistungen sind für Sie als Bewerber kostenfrei.   Unser Kunde bietet   Spannende Projekte, die stets in Abstimmung mit dem Team selektiert werden Vertrauensarbeitszeit, flexible Einteilung von Home-Office 12 Kollegen, familiäres und respektvolles Arbeitsklima Flexibler Gehaltsanteil, der entweder ausgezahlt oder in Freizeitausgleich umgewandelt werden kann Urlaubstage: 28 (in den ersten 2 Jahren); dann 30    Ihre Aufgaben als Data Engineer (w/m/d)   Anforderungsmanagement bei Datenintegration, -modellierung und ETL-Strecken Beratung bei der Einführung von Datawarehouse/BI Projekten und Tools Übernahme von Projektleitungsaufgaben    Ihr Profil   2-3 Jahre Berufserfahrung Tech-Stack: Cloud: AWS, Azure, oder GoogleCloud BI-Tools: Tableau oder Qlick DMBS: Oracle oder MSSQL Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Architektur (ETL, Reporting-Lösungen..) Reisebereitschaft in Abstimmung mit den Kollegen und den Kunden    Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?  Dann bewerben Sie sich online als Data Engineer (w/m/d) unter Angabe der Referenznummer  06780-0012282193  - Ihr Lebenslauf genügt. Bei Fragen steht Ihnen Frau Sina Stephan von Robert Half gerne zur Verfügung. Bitte beachten Sie, dass die aktuelle Covid-19 Situation keine Auswirkungen auf unseren Bewerbungsprozess hat. Als Alternative zu persönlichen Gesprächen bieten wir aktuell Telefon- oder Video-Interviews an.  Die Robert Half Deutschland GmbH & Co. KG verarbeitet die Daten von Bewerbern, die zur Durchführung des Bewerbungsverfahrens erforderlich sind. Weitere Informationen zum Datenschutz, insbesondere zu Ihren Rechten, finden Sie unter

Title: (Junior) PHP Engineer (f/m/d)
Location: Cologne Bonn Region, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany
Description: Anstellungsdetails  Permanent contract, full-time or part-time, Cologne / Düsseldorf / Darmstadt / Remote (in Germany)   Info   Who We Are    We operate Kaufland.de: Several thousand sellers and millions of products make us one of the fastest growing online marketplaces. Our work is characterised by a dynamic corporate culture, with a start-up mentality and the power of a big corporate group. We combine knowledge and many years of experience in e-commerce with flat hierarchies and a highly motivated team. Whether it's from an intern: We take every idea seriously, because we want to work together in shaping the future of e-commerce!   We love flexibility!  We offer you the best environment to work in a flexible and focused way: You decide whether you want to work in our office in Cologne // Darmstadt while at the same time having the opportunity to work remotely. We want to offer you the most attractive workplace in e-commerce and a maximum of flexibility for your personal work-life balance.   Day-by-day, our development team of over 250 experts pursues the goal of creating the best-possible customer shopping experience for the Kaufland marketplace. We are here to inspire millions of customers, to help them find, purchase and get the things they love. To enrich the lives of our customers, we collaborate in cross-functional teams, in which product owners, product designers, frontend and backend engineers, data scientists and lean managers join forces. Details regarding the challenges of the respective product areas can be found here: https://kaufland-ecommerce.com/team/tech/.   Detail  Your tasks – this is what awaits you in detail   As a Junior PHP Engineer (f/m/d) you proactively develop the Kaufland Marketplace and internal services further In our cross-functional teams, independent teams, you regularly work with colleagues from other disciplines to develop products that make our customers happy You learn about cutting edge technologies and innovative processes and stay up-to-date on current trends in the engineering world In pair-programming sessions, you have the opportunity to gain and share knowledge with your team and continuously learn new things You actively contribute in planning & building scalable and reliable software solutions    Your Profile – This Is What We Expect From You    You have an educational level that corresponds to completed university studies in (business) information technology, (business) engineering, mathematics or physics, or you finished an IT relevant apprenticeship, or you have equivalent professional experience Ideally, you have gained previous experience in object-oriented programming, preferably with PHP, modern frameworks (Symfony, Laravel or similar), and knowledge of relational databases (MySQL or similar) You understand clean coding principles and best practices to ensure sustainable, reliable and extendable code You have the drive to continuously develop both yourself and your team further in order to become a little bit better every day You are passionate about what you do and have a strong interest in current e-commerce trends and developments You have excellent communication skills, are willing to embrace our company culture and values and enjoy working in an international, english-speaking team    What We Offer    Create your own work-life! We offer you the best possible flexibility in terms of working hours and location A highly-motivated and qualified team from different fields and numerous nations The future is digital - Develop the e-commerce of the future with us and work on a product with millions of users with a broadly-based technology stack Power meets dynamic - flat hierarchies and start-up mentality meet and the power of a big corporate group and offers you an agile and secure working environment at the same time Free choice of hardware – we provide you with the development environment of your choice Personal & team growth: We love to have flexibility in terms of working location, but we also believe that personal interactions are important. That’s why we organize company events, and cover the costs to bring you there and to other (approved) get togethers with your peers. The same applies to conferences and other learning opportunities. We want everybody to grow personally and professionally, as a team and as a company. Top conditions at the Urban Sports Club for fitness, team sports, yoga and more   Check out our Principles & our blog for even more insights into our company culture!   Refer an Engineer Program  You want to work for us, but not without your dearest colleague? Join us as a team and earn money by referring your buddy for one of our open Tech positions! Depending on the level we offer a bonus up to 1.300,- € per referral, which will be paid after successful recruitment (the first part with your first salary, the second part after your buddy passes the trial period).   Bewerben  Why are you the perfect fit for this position? Don't bother with cover letters - we're interested in facts and figures!   Ansprechpartner  _ _Your contact person: Alina Asmus  Kaufland e-ecommerce   Kaufland e-commerce Services GmbH   Postal address:   Habsburgerring 2   50674 Köln   We're looking forward to your application!__

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Company Name: Segment of One (SO1) - Sold to Schwarz Group. Europe’s Largest Retailer.
Description: How can we change the world to make marketing both relevant and impactful? With your help! At Schwarz Media Platform  , we are on a mission to build Europe's largest and most advanced ad network for retail - a real-life AdTech application with a big impact on consumers, stores, and advertisers. It is based on Europe's largest retail data pool from Europe's No. 1 retailer, Schwarz Group, and cutting-edge technology that understands individual consumer behaviour at scale. If you are interested in this vision and are excited about how data and machine learning can help us get there, you will love Schwarz Media Platform  .   Tasks  Responsibilities:   Help to scale our data stores, data pipelines and ETLs handling terabytes of one of the largest retail companies Design and implement efficient data processing workflows Extend our reporting platform for external customers and internal stakeholders Continue to develop our custom data processing pipeline and continuously search for ways to improve our technology stack along our increasing scale Measure, analyze and optimize the performance of our data processing pipelines Work with data scientists and software engineers, to build and integrate fully automated and scalable machine learning & reporting solutions    Requirements    Fluency with Python and good knowledge of SQL Experience with developing scalable data pipelines with Apache Spark Good understanding of efficient algorithms and know-how to analyze them Curiosity about how databases and other data processing tools work internally Familiarity with Linux ecosystem and working with command-line tools Familiarity with git Ability to write testable and maintainable code that scales Excellent communication skills and a team-player attitude   Great if you also have experience with:   Practical experience in developing services Experience with Kubernetes Experience with Google Cloud Platform or Amazon Web Services Knowledge of columnar databases and file formats like Apache Parquet or Avro Knowledge of "Big Data" technologies like Apache Hive, Apache Hudi or Delta Lake Experience with workflow management solutions like Apache Airflow, Argo Workflow or Google Dataflow / Apache Beam    Benefits    Our main office is in Berlin, but you will find our team members working remotely. But despite being geographically spread, we are strategically united in changing the advertising game for good. We work in small teams with fast feedback loops, which enables us to “get stuff done” and work on challenging problems. Because our team comes from all over the world, our company language is English, (but you might hear the odd German, Russian or Spanish conversation).   At Schwarz Media Platform, we keep the personal togetherness and office environment alive despite remote locations by meeting for virtual coffees, cocktail or game nights every now and then, and also meeting in person at exciting offsite locations across Europe every six weeks.   We offer our employees unique learning opportunities and the chance to take on important projects from day one together with:   A highly energetic environment and smart colleagues who will help you accelerate your professional growth Autonomy to shape your role and significantly impact the company’s direction and future Above market salary and 30 vacation days Work as a member of a cross-functional, fully remote product team Utilize a modern tech-stack: incl. Python, Terraform, ArgoCD, Google Cloud Platform

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Are you looking for your next big adventure? Are you eager to work in a highly motivated team of experts in machine learning and deep neural networks? Do you enjoy the challenge of completing projects to a high standard? Then join our team! As a Data Engineer, you will develop cutting-edge computer-vision software for driver-monitoring and vehicle-interior monitoring that are deployed by international automotive manufacturers.  Tasks   You will have a central role in developing and operating our machine learning infrastructure. Data acquisition, cleaning, and processing. Development of tools for data collection. Automating our data processes with tools like Gitlab CI, Jenkins, and docker. Distributed storage and processing of our data using Hadoop. Data analysis, monitoring, and reporting. You will have responsibilities throughout our machine learning development pipeline. You will participate in designing our data architecture. You will work in a cross functional team in a rapid development environment.    Requirements    2 years or more of work experience with Python and a masters degree in Computer Science or similar. Very good knowledge of Python and Linux. You write clean, reliable code. Experience with data processing. Experience with cloud computing is a plus. Experience with databases is a plus. Independent working mentality, proactive attitude and an entrepreneurial mindset. Good communication skills in English, both verbal and written.    Benefits    Flexible working hours for a good work-life balance. Exciting and responsible tasks. Open corporate culture, flat hierarchies in a young and international team. Modern office at S Tiergarten (Charlottenburg).   Interested? Then send us your CV including salary expectations and possible starting date to the given Email address.

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d) Bahntechnik- und Signaltechnik
Description: Bei ALTEN entwickeln Sie die Technologien von morgen und vor allem sich selbst! Wir sind strategischer Partner für Unternehmen aus dem Umfeld des Bahn- und Schienenverkehrswesens. Dabei entwickeln wir für Projekte der   „Digitalen Schiene Deutschland“ Technologien wie ETCS, TMS, OBU, LockTrac, ARAMIS, Stellwerke, Streckensysteme, bzw. vieles mehr im Zug und auf der Strecke. Sind Sie bereit für agile und innovative Projekte bei denen Sie durch Ihr technisches Know-how punkten können? Dann verstärken Sie unser Team!
