Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Bei Bayer sind wir Visionäre und entschlossen, die größten Herausforderungen unseres Planeten zu überwinden und zu einer Welt beizutragen, in der genug Nahrung und ausreichende medizinische Versorgung für alle Menschen keine unerreichbaren Ziele mehr darstellen. Wir tun dies mit Energie, Neugier und purer Hingabe, lernen stets von den Menschen um uns herum, erweitern unsere Denkweise, verbessern unsere Fähigkeiten und definieren das „Unmögliche“ neu. Es gibt viele Gründe, sich uns anzuschließen: Wenn Sie nach einer abwechslungsreichen und bedeutungsvollen beruflichen Zukunft streben, in der Sie gemeinsam mit anderen brillanten Köpfen wirklich etwas bewegen können, möchten wir Sie in unserem Team haben.  Data Engineer (m/w/d)  Die Vision und Mission unserer Enabling Function „Global Data Assets Organization“ besteht darin, die Bayer-Unternehmensfunktionen wie Finanzen, Supply Chain und Logistik, HR, Beschaffung, Recht, Nachhaltigkeit usw. zu transformieren und stärker erkenntnis- und datengesteuert zu gestalten. Um dieses Ziel zu erreichen, ist die Aufgabe des Teams, die erforderliche Datengrundlage und FAIR-Datenbestände (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) bereitzustellen, die es den Unternehmen ermöglichen, ihre Entscheidungsfähigkeit zu verbessern. Sie werden Teil des Data-Engineering-Teams, unterstützen dieses bei der Bereitstellung von Datenbeständen und stellen sicher, dass unsere Kunden diese Datenbestände mithilfe einer hochmodernen Datenplattform, die auf der Microsoft-Azure-Cloud basiert, effizient verarbeiten können. Zu den Verantwortlichkeiten des Teams gehört die Bereitstellung von Lösungen, die die Entwicklung von Datenpipelines, Datenmodellierung, Systemkonfiguration, Datenspeicherung, -verarbeitung und -transformation umfassen, wie sie für den Aufbau und Betrieb eines Data Warehouse, eines Data Mart und einer Datenanalyseplattform typisch sind.   IHRE AUFGABEN UND VERANTWORTLICHKEITEN   Sie unterstützen die Data Asset Leads bei der Erstellung von Datenbeständen sowohl für unser Geschäft als auch für unsere IT-Community Sie erstellen und pflegen eine optimale Datenpipeline-Architektur und treiben die Automatisierung voran. Dabei sorgen Sie, wo immer möglich und machbar, aktiv für die Einrichtung der Automatisierung, um die Effizienz und Qualität zu steigern (Umsetzung, Überwachung und Sanierung usw.) Sie stellen große, komplexe Datensätze zusammen, die funktionalen/nicht-funktionalen Geschäftsanforderungen entsprechen, identifizieren, entwerfen und implementieren interne Prozessverbesserungen und optimieren gleichzeitig die Datenbereitstellung und gestalten bei Bedarf die Infrastruktur für eine bessere Skalierbarkeit neu Sie sorgen für eine optimale Extraktion, Transformation und das Laden von Daten aus einer Vielzahl von Datenquellen, darunter SAP- und Nicht-SAP-Systeme Sie arbeiten mit Stakeholdern wie Data Asset Leads sowie Daten- und Designteams zusammen, helfen diesen bei datenbezogenen technischen Problemen und unterstützen ihre Anforderungen an die Infrastruktur für Daten Sie arbeiten mit Daten- und Analyseexperten zusammen und bemühen sich um mehr Funktionalität in unserer Datenplattform Sie bewerten als Entscheidungshelfer (m/w/d) die besten Lösungsmöglichkeiten sowie Vor- und Nachteile und geben Empfehlungen auf Basis Ihrer Erfahrungen ab Sie stellen sicher, dass die Bayer-Architekturprinzipien sowie die Kodierungs- und Compliance-Richtlinien befolgt und eingehalten werden Sie arbeiten nach dem Prinzip des agilen Projekts – Sie kommunizieren regelmäßig Status, Blocker, Chancen und gestalten die Zukunft – und beeinflussen unsere Gesamtdatenstrategie mit Ihrem technischen und Tool-Know-how   WAS SIE MITBRINGEN   Hochschulabschluss im Bereich Informatik oder eine ähnliche Ausbildung bzw. entsprechende Berufserfahrung Sie haben bereits Erfahrung mit der Arbeit in der Azure-Cloud und verfügen über Kenntnis der Services, einschließlich Infrastrukturals Code, Einrichtung von Vnet usw. Sie verfügen über nachweisliche Erfahrung mit Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Snowflake und Azure Data Factory Sie haben bereits Erfahrung mit dem Aufbau von Data Warehouses, Data Marts, RDBMS und SQL Sie haben Erfahrung mit der Erstellung von Datenmodellen und kennen sich mit Data Engineering und Datenarchitekturprinzipienaus Sie verfügen über Fachwissen in Bezug auf die Programmierung in Python oder ähnlichen Programmiersprachen und zugehörigeProgrammierarbeiten; Repositorys wie GitHub, CI/CD-Pipelines usw. Sie haben ein gutes Verständnis der SAP-ERP- und SAP-BW-Systeme Sie verfügen über ausgeprägte mündliche, schriftliche sowie gute zwischenmenschliche Kompetenzen Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift   IHRE BEWERBUNG  Dies ist Ihre Chance, sich mit uns gemeinsam den größten globalen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit zu stellen: die Gesundheit der Menschen zu erhalten, die wachsende Weltbevölkerung zu ernähren und den Klimawandel zu verlangsamen. Sie haben eine Stimme, Ideen und Perspektiven, die wir hören möchten. Denn unser Erfolg beginnt mit Ihnen. Seien Sie dabei!   Bayer begrüßt Bewerbungen aller Menschen ungeachtet von ethnischer Herkunft, nationaler Herkunft, Geschlecht, Alter, körperlichen Merkmalen, sozialer Herkunft, Behinderung, Mitgliedschaft in einer Gewerkschaft, Religion, Familienstand, Schwangerschaft, sexueller Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität oder einem anderen sachfremden Kriterium nach geltendem Recht. Wir bekennen uns zu dem Grundsatz, alle Bewerberinnen und Bewerber fair zu behandeln und Benachteiligungen zu vermeiden.   Standort:  Leverkusen, St. Louis   Division:  Enabling Functions   Referenzcode:  559912

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d) Bahntechnik- und Signaltechnik
Description: Bei ALTEN entwickeln Sie die Technologien von morgen und vor allem sich selbst! Wir sind strategischer Partner für Unternehmen aus dem Umfeld des Bahn- und Schienenverkehrswesens. Title: Data Engineer
Description: A multicultural Berlin-based mobile games studio creating story driven casual games is now looking to expand their team! As a Data Engineer, you will be an essential part of the Data team, inspiring and sharing your expertise with your colleagues.   You will be working closely with several other teams, including data science, engineering, marketing and game teams, to ensure that they can collect and action the data in the best possible way.   RESPONSIBILITIES:   You will architect, build and maintain our next generation data architecture. You will collaborate closely with our data scientists to productionalize their machine learning models. You will help our game and marketing teams to get their business measured. You will be responsible to develop, scale and run services which are used to personalize the game experience for millions of players every day. You will operate our data infrastructure. We are strong believers in a “DevOps” setup, meaning there is no separation of development and operations. You will build an infrastructure that does not fail, but if it fails you will be able to fix it. You will be a part of a small team that is constantly improving our data platform. Your input matters! You will work closely with business teams.    REQUIREMENTS:   You have 5+ years of experience in engineering and thereof 2+ years in data teams. You have profound knowledge and experience in the programming languages we use: Python or Scala. You have built a stable and scalable data pipeline processing tons of data every day. You know that KAFKA is not just an author. You are familiar with cloud services like AWS, know the benefits of systems like Kubernetes or platforms like Airflow. You love data. You love to dig into stuff, and work on a problem until it is solved. You have a good understanding of basic analytics and machine learning concepts.    WHAT THEY OFFER:   Competitive compensation + quarterly bonus scheme! Generous relocation package and home search support if you are not already located in Berlin Significant education budget and extra days off for self-development Meet-ups, talks, brown bag lunches, internal trainings, workshops and many others German language classes for you and your significant other Equipment    Not your time for a move? Recommend a friend and earn 700 EUR! Contact: jobs@8bitplay.com   IMPORTANT: We will never, absolutely never send your CV and/or personal data to any of our clients without your direct consent. Submitting your CV is not equal to giving us consent to share your details with our external partners- we will always contact you upfront and ask for your agreement.   By submitting this form you give your consent for the information provided on this form to be held on computer or other relevant filing systems belonging to 8Bit Studio one and to be shared with other accredited employees in accordance with the GDPR 2018.   By submitting this form you agree that 8Bit Studio, NIP 9570949266, REGON: 36386962 processes your personal data contained in the recruitment documents supplied by you, including but not limited to your image, for the purposes of the current recruitment processes. 8Bit Studio confirms that your consent may be withdrawn anytime.   For more insight about game jobs and recruitment for game industry visit our homepage

Title: Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Esprit isn’t just an Employer. It is more than a fashion brand, staying true to our core values of sustainability and diversity.   We are looking for real personalities. Smart characters with attitude, corners and edges. We love what we do. And so should you.   You are a team-player loving to take challenges together with your colleagues?   You would like to work in a company whose products are well-known and support such company in its success?   Then apply now as   Software Engineer (m/f/d)  to support our Team. (ID 23602)   Your tasks   You analyze, design, develop, test, deploy and operationalize software products, applications integration and data integration You take on the role of a Full Stack Developer, covering both frontend and backend developments You define, deploy, promote and refine software engineering practices that constantly balance between standard, speed and quality You drive various forms of software construction from no code, low code, scripting, robotic process automation to classic software development You collaborate with the product owners regarding the requirements and technical implementations of change requests You handle 2nd and 3rd support level You identify and solve problems and incidents to enable smooth running operations You establish test frameworks and implemente a test automation process You initiate measures to promote and build a continuous deployment & delivery pipeline You participate in IT projects and take on project tasks You build and train communities of citizen developers through internal workshops and participation in external hackathons   Your skills   You have a degree in computer science, business informatics, mathematics or natural sciences combined with several years of professional experience in a comparable position Professional certifications on related platform/tools would be highly advantageous You have excellent communication skills in English, additional languages such as German would be a benefit You have very good knowledge in software design patterns and implementation You are familiar with agile and DevOps practices and tools You have experience in application integration, data integration and middleware technologies You have knowledge in application development and software construction in common programming languages You are well-trained in script-based programming languages such as Python or Javascript and Microsoft ecosystems such as Azure Integration Services, SQL Server, Power Platform, Microsoft 365 If you have experience with robotic process automation SAP-based RPA and/or Microsoft PowerAutomate, this would be an advantage You have an analytical mindset, a structured and concept-based way of working and a hands-on mentality You have an intercultural competence and a solution-oriented way of working   Our Benefits   We have a flexible mobile office arrangement that allows you to choose your work location at least two days a week, plus we have every second Friday off We are a team that places a lot of value on collegial and open cooperation, open feedback is always appreciated With us you get 40% staff discount on our entire product range We don't have a dresscode, you can wear whatever you feel comfortable in. Get inspired https //to.esprit.com/shop We offer you of course a subsidy for public transport or you can park on one of our free parking spaces We have an award-winning canteen that provides you with really tasty and healthy food every day   Are you a good match for this Job?   Then please submit an application with your salary expectations and an indication of your earliest starting date. Please feel free to contact Julia Cleef if you have any questions.

Title: Deutsche Bahn AG: Data Engineer (w/m/d)
Description: Wenn es darum geht, zukünftig Millionen Fahrgäste und tausende Züge auch digital auf den Weg zu bringen, braucht es die besten IT-Experten. 8.000 haben wir schon, aber längst nicht genug. Als Projektleiter, Berater, Entwickler oder IT-Architekt ist jetzt die spannendste Zeit einzusteigen und in einem starken Team wegweisende Lösungen und Großprojekte in den Bereichen Mobilität, Infrastruktur und Logistik umzusetzen.   Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir Dich als Senior Data Engineer Produktion für die DB Cargo am Standort Mainz.   Deine Aufgaben:   Deine Hauptaufgabe ist die Weiterentwicklung von Analyseverfahren und -Modellen basierend auf den technischen Möglichkeiten sowie kontinuierliche Steigerung der Datenverfügbarkeit und Qualität Du baust ETL-Strecken auf, automatisierst diese und entwickelst die Datenbankarchitektur in unserer Modular Cloud Du bist Ansprechpartner für Data Scientists und Analysten bei technischen Fragen sowie der Weiterentwicklung der Datensysteme Du beschäftigst Dich mit dem Zusammentragen, Aufbereiten und Prüfen von Daten in der Modular Cloud in der Produktion von DB Cargo und stellst die Daten zur Verfügung Du modellierst und skalierst Datenbanken und stellst so den Datenfluss innerhalb der Produktion von DB Cargo sicher Du bildest die Grundlage für Analyseprojekte im Kontext von Data Science Projekten und beim Umgang mit Big Data  Dein Profil:   Du hast ein Studium als Informatiker, Wirtschaftsinformatiker, Mathematiker, Physiker oder mit vergleichbarer Fachrichtung erfolgreich abgeschlossen und bringst weitreichende Erfahrungen im Bereich Data Engineering mit Du verfügst über Kenntnisse in AWS Cloud, Python, SSIS, MS SQL, Dremio Du entwickelst IT-Architekturen und verantwortest gemeinsam mit dem Team Stabilität und hohe Verfügbarkeit der Daten Du bringst eine hohe Zahlen- und Datenaffinität mit, um Zusammenhänge zwischen unterschiedlichen Datenquellen zu verstehen und für deren sinnvolle Verknüpfung zu sorgen Erste Erfahrungen mit Künstlicher Intelligenz, Zeitreihenanalysen und Process Mining sind wünschenswert Deine Begeisterung und Dein Wissen teilst Du gerne mit dem Team und darüber hinaus bist Du gleichermaßen bereit, Dich stetig über neue Entwicklungen im Bereich Data Engineer auf dem Laufenden zu halten und übernimmst für den Erfolg und die Weiterentwicklung des Teams entsprechend Verantwortung Dein Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Deine Kommunikationsfähigkeiten zeichnen Dich aus   Benefits:   Du schaffst Großes und bekommst nicht weniger zurück: ein marktübliches Gehaltspaket mit i.d.R. unbefristeten Arbeitsverträgen und Beschäftigungssicherung sowie vielfältige Nebenleistungen und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge. Faszinierende Projekte und Aufgaben – von spannenden regionalen Infrastrukturmaßnahmen bis hin zu den größten Baustellen Europas – fordern Dein Können und warten auf Deine Handschrift. Gezielte und individuelle Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten auf Fach-, Projekt- oder Führungsebene geben Dir eine langfristige Perspektive.   Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte Bewerber bei gleicher Eignung bei bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Job Description    At Machine Learning Reply Germany  we strive to work on leading-edge data science projects with our clients for which we are seeking engineering consultants to work on Machine Learning products.   Machine Learning Reply, with its sister company in Italy and over 8500 employees at Reply globally, is a fast-growing consultancy focused on solving problems with Data Science and the right organizational frameworks as their backbone. We are a tight knit, laid back, but seriously motivated unit that aims to be involved at conferences and in community of practice with our tech partners.   We offer tailor-made end-to-end solutions in the Data Science area that cover the entire project life cycle - from initial strategy consulting to data architecture and infrastructure issues to data processing and modeling using machine learning algorithms.   We have extensive expertise in the broad Data Science spectrum in all key industries of the German HDAX-companies. With focus on open source and cloud technologies we enable our customers to successfully introduce and implement new data-driven solutions and to optimize already existing processes and products.   Tasks:   You will support the successful implementation of customer products related to Big Data, Data Engineering, and/or Data Warehouses. Build and maintain scalable Data Platforms and ML Platforms on Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) or on-premise, considering DevOps paradigms. You enjoy brainstorming, conceptualization and final implementation. You therefore love to accompany the complete LifeCycle by creating specifications, code and presentations for your solutions. As part of the Reply network, you join communities of practice, participate in hackathons and use all available learning resources   What we offer you:   Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc. ) Very active group social program - including conference funding, team building, group events, Reply Exchange Recognition for Innovation to foster your personal development Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge sharing network (more than 90 autonomous Reply groups across 8 countries) Office space in downtown Munich with access to Stammstrecke Training and certification encouraged Home-office contracts State of the art work equipment Award winning office spaces for an excellent work experience Public transport ticket within Munich Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice Company car scheme   (r2)    Requirements    We are happy to see that you have a university degree in (business) computer science, mathematics, statistics or similar. You have experience with cloud services from AWS or Azure, alternatively you have substantial knowledge with on-premise solutions, and/or Kubernetes. You have interest in ETL, and workflow orchestration tools such as Airflow, Luigi.. Good Knowledge of databases, and have had some experience with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop or Kafka. You are familiar with a programming language such as Python, Scala, shell scripting or even Perl. Fluent German and English skills round out your profile

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: Spark Networks SE is a global dating company with an ever-growing portfolio of premium and freemium apps. Zoosk, our biggest brand, welcomes 40 million singles to its platform and is available in 80+ countries and translated into 25 languages. Our other brands focus on age or religious beliefs – like Silver Singles for the over 50s, and Christian Mingle and Jdate for Christian and Jewish communities.   We have multiple brands and target audiences, but our mission remains the same – to help singles all around the world find love and have fun along the way. To us, the journey is just as important as the destination, so we pride ourselves on making sure our users remain engaged, happy and satisfied throughout their Spark experience.   As we continue to grow, we are now looking for a talented and self-driven Data Engineer who can help us explore, build and transform our data lakes and rivers. Sitting within the Data Management team, you will help us deal with complex ingestion, transformation and storage of data coming from all different kinds of sources: web/mobile clients, servers and live databases. Are you interested in event-driven systems and doing data engineering that supports behavioral science? Then online dating is the right place for you. Our well-established position in the market and billions of data points provide unique and endless opportunities to develop in this role and deliver valuable improvements in our goal to democratize data corporate-wide.   Your mission:   You will conceptualize, build, test and maintain data architectures at Spark Networks You will own end-to-end and improve the entire OLAP Data Pipeline: from the source to the production table You will develop and maintain a modern event-driven data environment mounted primarily on AWS, and leverage from synchronizing workloads along AWS storage and computing services, namely S3, EMR, Glue, Kinesis and EC2 You will maintain and improve performance of Snowflake, Redshift and PostgreSQL clusters by optimal data modeling You will develop, optimize and maintain Data Connectors, Workflows and APIs You will have the chance to test open-source components    Competencies:   You are not afraid of understanding legacy systems and proposing ways of optimizing them You always look for long-term stable solution, even if it takes extra effort You have attention to detail You are self-driven, always trying to pick up new tasks yourself You like cloud technologies You speak fluent English    Requirements   At least 5 years of experience as Data Engineer or Software Developer At least 3 years of experience in Cloud Data Engineering (big plus if it is primarily AWS) Experience parsing events from Customer Data Platforms such as Segment or mParticle Experience with Event Streaming Platforms and services such as AWS Kinesis Experience working with big data processing workloads and wrangling frameworks like AWS Glue (Apache Spark) You have worked with analytical data warehouses like Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery and PostgreSQL You have worked with workflow orchestration frameworks like MWAA (Apache Airflow) You have worked with CI/CD, unit tests, Docker You have solved business issues through Data Visualization using tools like Metabase, Data Studio or Superset You have work experience and knowledge of AWS services (S3, EC2, EMR, RDS, SNS, SQS, Lambda, etc.) You are fluent in Python and SQL, any other languages are added benefits    Benefits  HYBRID APPROACH TO WORK  We believe in the magic of human interaction – not only when it comes to finding the love of your life but also when it comes to finding the team or colleague of your life. We hence have employees coming to our vibrant Berlin office space twice a week to network, enjoy social events, collaborate with other teams, brainstorm, innovate, and feel the magic of Spark. No Zoom Call can replace a whiteboard full of ideas or a drink with colleagues, right? For the remainder of the week, employees are free to choose where they would like to work from and what space caters best to their strengths and needs.   HEALTH & WELLBEING   27 holidays p.a. Flexi-time (where possible) In-house massages Urban Sports Club (subsidized membership) Weekly online Yoga, Zumba classes and Back course Calm App & Mindful Movement    TRAINING & DEVELOPMENT   Online German language class (A1) or Babbel subscription for all other levels (6 months) Free access to Blinkist library Learning & Development programs with external and internal trainers, and digital offers Leadership training via the ‘Leadership Circle’ series Career development plans    LIFE & LOVE   Relocation support (visa and registration) Company pension (15% company contribution) Cooperation with Berlin nursery (“Kita”) chain (no guarantee for free spot) BVG ticket discount (5% discount for annual BVG public transport ticket) Free account on our dating platforms Employee discount program in collaboration with hundreds of brands    A friendly working atmosphere with free drinks, lots of food, company parties, team events, and great colleagues from all over the world – check out our Career Video to meet your future colleagues!   Spark Networks is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our employees. Any hiring decision is based on qualification, skills, abilities, and the specific needs of Spark Networks with regard to a given position.   See why Spark Networks employees love where they work: check out our Glassdoor reviews and kununu reviews!   Let Spark Networks be part of your success story!   Dear applicants,   We are closely monitoring the development of Covid-19 and adapt our hiring process accordingly (incl. moving all interview stages to a digital format). We continue to be dedicated to hiring the best staff and providing a safe and efficient hiring process. We are happy to share more details with you during our 1st interview call and are looking forward to receiving your application.

Title: Data Engineer (w/m/d)
Description: Vibracoustic ist Teil der Freudenberg Gruppe. Das Unternehmen sorgt für ein ruhiges und leises Fahrerlebnis in jedem Fahrzeug. Wir möchten Mobilität komfortabler machen und die perfekte Lösung für NVH-Herausforderungen unserer Automobilkunden bieten. Als führender Anbieter ist Vibracoustic der richtige Ort für offene, ehrgeizige Teamplayer mit einer praktischen Herangehensweise. Unsere innovative, sichere und dynamische Arbeitsatmosphäre bietet viele Chancen für Ihr persönliches Wachstum und Ihre Entwicklung in einem globalen Netzwerk. Möchten Sie in unser Team kommen?   Hamburg   Vibracoustic SE & Co. KG   Sie unterstützen unser Team als   Data Engineer (w/m/d)   Ihre Aufgaben   Sie kümmern sich um das Programmieren von Bildverarbeitungs- und KI-basierten Lösungen Sie sorgen für die Standardisierung und Weiterentwicklung von Technologien Sie treiben die Industrialisierung von Neuprojekten im Produktentstehungsprozess voran Sie verantworten die Vernetzung von Produktionsanlagen Sie übernehmen das Datenbankmanagement und die Datenmodellierung    Ihr Profil   Sie verfügen über ein Studium der Ingenieurswissenschaften, Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung Sie bringen eine mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in dem Umfeld mit Sie haben sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Programmierung mit C# .Net, ASP .Net Sie verfügen über einen sicheren Umgang mit Visual Studio, GIT, SVN o.ä. Sie haben Erfahrungen im Umgang mit MVTec Halcon, OpenCV o.ä. Sie haben Erfahrungen mit Datenbanksystemen wie PostgreSQL o.ä. Sie sprechen Deutsch und Englisch verhandlungssicher    Ihre Vorteile   Aus- und Weiterbildungen / Laufbahnentwicklung:  Programme zur Erweiterung von Fachwissen und Qualifikationen.   Flexible Arbeitsmodelle:  Flexible Arbeitsmöglichkeiten für den persönlichen Erfolg und Zufriedenheit   Cafeteria/Kantine:  Vor Ort werden frische, warme und kalte Speisen angeboten.   Betriebliche Altersvorsorge:  Mit Hilfe des Unternehmens für den Ruhestand vorsorgen.   Fahrtkostenzuschuss für öffentliche Verkehrsmittel:  Kostengünstiger pendeln durch Zuschuss für öffentliche Verkehrsmittel   Hier gelangen Sie direkt zu unserer Karriereseite. Drive your career!   Die Freudenberg Gruppe zeichnet sich durch Offenheit und Chancengleichheit aus. Wir begrüßen daher Bewerbungen von allen Menschen unabhängig von Alter, Geschlecht, Herkunft und Abstammung, einer Behinderung oder anderer gesetzlich geschützter Gründe.

Title: Data Engineer - Steuergeräteentwicklung (w/m/x)
Description: DATEN VERSTEHEN. DER ZUKUNFT DEN WEG WEISEN.  TEILE DEINE LEIDENSCHAFT.  Wenn man sie kreativ zu nutzen weiß, können Daten Berge versetzen. Unsere Big-Data-Experten übersetzen täglich Unmengen von Fahrzeug-, Fahrverhalten- und Produktionsdaten in innovative Lösungen und wegweisende Technologien. In kleinen Teams mit agilen Prozessen und Forschungsfreiheit denken sie Themen wie Mobilität der Zukunft und Industrie 4.0 völlig neu.   Die Zentralsteuergeräte integrieren eine Vielzahl an Funktionen aus den Fahrzeugsystemen, von denen ein Großteil in anderen Fachbereichen funktionsverantwortet wird. Diese Funktionen generieren von Generation zu Generation mehr Daten. Du hilfst mit, unsere Steuergeräte mit diesen Daten fehlerfrei und besser zu machen sowie Auffälligkeiten früher zu erkennen.   Was erwartet dich?   Du bist zuständig für die Definition und den Aufbau einer Analyseplattform für die Funktionen der Zentralsteuergeräte über die BMW Flotte (Kunde, kundennaher Test, Fahrzeugintensivtest, Werke) und Kundenfahrzeuge. Dabei hilfst du bei der Identifizierung von potenziellen Problemen (Resets, Bauteilwarnungen wie Überhitzung). Die Steigerung der Früherkennung von Qualitätsproblemen liegt in deinem Verantwortungsbereich. Der Aufbau sowie die Auswertung von Lastmessungen in der BMW-Testflotte und Kundenfahrzeugen gehören zu deinem Aufgabenumfang. In dem übergreifenden Netzwerk der E/E Systemintegration führst du die Abstimmung mit den notwendigen Schnittstellenpartnern durch, um den größtmöglichen Effekt der Analysen zu ermöglichen. Du präsentierst die Analyse-Ergebnisse und unterstützt damit die Steuergeräte-Entwickler bei einer zielgerichteten Maßnahmensteuerung.    Was bringst du mit?   Studienabschluss in Informatik, Ingenieurwissenschaft, Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation. Kenntnisse in objektorientierten Programmiersprachen (z.B. aus Open Source Projekten, C++). Kenntnisse im Bereich Datenbanken, Data Mining und Big Data sowie in Machine Learning. Erfahrungen im Bereich Fahrzeug-Kommunikation, Fahrzeug-Bussysteme (CAN, Flexray, AutomotiveEthernet, DLT) sowie Fahrzeugdiagnosen sind von Vorteil. Erfahrungen im Bereich Softwareentwicklung, Programmierung (CI/CD, Software-Architektur). Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse.    Du bist stark als Teamplayer, hast Lust auf die Arbeit in einem innovativen Umfeld und bringst Begeisterung für Prozesse und neue Technologien mit? - Bewirb dich jetzt!   Hinweis:  Bitte bewirb dich ausschließlich online über unser Karriereportal. Bewerbungen auf anderen Kanälen (insb. auch Email) können nicht berücksichtigt werden.   Was bieten wir dir?   30 Urlaubstage. Attraktive Vergütung. BMW & MINI Angebote. Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung. Hohe Work-Life Balance. Karriereentwicklung. Mobilitätsangebote. Und vieles mehr siehe bmw.jobs/waswirbieten    Startdatum: ab sofort   Anstellungsart: unbefristet   Arbeitszeit: FULLTIME   Ansprechpartner:   Franziska Obermaier   BMW Group Recruiting Team   +49 89 382-17001

Title: IEG Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Bei Bayer sind wir Visionäre und entschlossen, die größten Herausforderungen unseres Planeten zu überwinden und zu einer Welt beizutragen, in der genug Nahrung und ausreichende medizinische Versorgung für alle Menschen keine unerreichbaren Ziele mehr darstellen. Wir tun dies mit Energie, Neugier und purer Hingabe, lernen stets von den Menschen um uns herum, erweitern unsere Denkweise, verbessern unsere Fähigkeiten und definieren das „Unmögliche“ neu. Es gibt viele Gründe, sich uns anzuschließen: Wenn Sie nach einer abwechslungsreichen und bedeutungsvollen beruflichen Zukunft streben, in der Sie gemeinsam mit anderen brillanten Köpfen wirklich etwas bewegen können, möchten wir Sie in unserem Team haben.  IEG Data Engineer (m/w/d)  IHRE AUFGABEN UND VERANTWORTLICHKEITEN   Durchführung von Data Mining, Engineering und Analysen von RWD-Quellen, um unsere strategische IEG-Planung zu informieren und deren Ausführung zu unterstützen Zusammenarbeit mit Forschungsteams, einschließlich interner und externer Stakeholder, bei der Umsetzung von Geschäfts- und Forschungsfragen in Beobachtungsstudien mit statistischen und analytischen Plänen Aufrechterhaltung der Effizienz und Zuverlässigkeit der Produktion kritischer Datensätze und Zusammenarbeit mit Data Scientists bei der Datenvorbereitung und der Aufbereitung zusätzlicher Daten und Verbindungen Durchführung von Qualitätskontrollmaßnahmen zur Gewährleistung der Integrität von Daten und Programmdesign Aufbau von Verbindungen zu anderen Data Engineers und Data Scientists bei Bayer, um eine Lerngemeinschaft zu bilden Entwicklung neuer sowie Bewertung und Verbesserung bestehender Lösungen zur Unterstützung der IEG in allen Bereichen der beobachtenden Forschung   WAS SIE MITBRINGEN   PhD, MSc oder BSc in Data Science, Ingenieurwesen, Computational Science, (Bio-) Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik, Physik, Ingenieurwesen, Ökonometrie, Machine Learning und/oder andere verwandte Gebiete Gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python/R/Scala und gute SQL-Kenntnisse sowie Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit großen Datenmengen, vorzugsweise Gesundheitsdaten Praktische Erfahrung mit ETL-Operationen mit SQL/Pyspark sowie Erfahrung mit Big-Data-Plattformen, z. B. Spark, Hadoop, Kafka und Cloud-basierte Dienste (AWS S3, EMR, Glue) und Container (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS) Kenntnisse von Workflow-Management-Tools wie Airflow/Prefect/Dagster und von Paketen für maschinelles Lernen (Scikit Learn, Tensorflow, Pytorch) sind ein Vorteil Kenntnisse im Aufbau von ML Pipelines oder MLOps Ausgezeichnete zwischenmenschliche und kommunikative Fähigkeiten Fähigkeit, Probleme zu lösen und komplexe Aufgaben zu strukturieren, zu vereinfachen, zu erklären und zu kommunizieren Verhandlungssicheres Englisch in Wort und Schrift   IHRE BEWERBUNG  Dies ist Ihre Chance, sich mit uns gemeinsam den größten globalen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit zu stellen: die Gesundheit der Menschen zu erhalten, die wachsende Weltbevölkerung zu ernähren und den Klimawandel zu verlangsamen. Sie haben eine Stimme, Ideen und Perspektiven, die wir hören möchten. Denn unser Erfolg beginnt mit Ihnen. Seien Sie dabei!   Bayer begrüßt Bewerbungen aller Menschen ungeachtet von ethnischer Herkunft, nationaler Herkunft, Geschlecht, Alter, körperlichen Merkmalen, sozialer Herkunft, Behinderung, Mitgliedschaft in einer Gewerkschaft, Religion, Familienstand, Schwangerschaft, sexueller Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität oder einem anderen sachfremden Kriterium nach geltendem Recht. Wir bekennen uns zu dem Grundsatz, alle Bewerberinnen und Bewerber fair zu behandeln und Benachteiligungen zu vermeiden.   Standort:  Deutschland : Berlin : Berlin   Division:  Pharmaceuticals   Referenzcode:  407943

Title: IT-System Engineer (w/m/d) Remote Support in Englisch und Französisch
Description: Wollen Sie die Zukunft des Gesundheitswesens mitgestalten? Wir bei Siemens Healthineers setzen auf Menschen, die ihre Energie und Leidenschaft diesem Ziel widmen – das sagt schon unser Unternehmensname. Siemens Healthineers steht für Pioniergeist unserer Mitarbeitenden, gepaart mit unserer langen Tradition als weltweit führender Technologiekonzern in der stets dynamischen Gesundheitsbranche.   Wir bieten ein flexibles und dynamisches Umfeld voller Gelegenheiten, über sich hinaus zu wachsen, um sich persönlich und beruflich weiterzuentwickeln. Klingt das interessant für Sie?   Dann werden Sie Teil unseres globalen Teams als IT-System Engineer (w/m/d) Remote Support in Englisch und Französisch, um unsere klinischen Kund*innen bezüglich ihres ausgezeichneten IT Know-hows zu unterstützen, besonders in der EMEA (Europe, Middle East, Africa) Region.  Wählen Sie den besten Ort für Ihre Arbeit  - im Rahmen dieser Stelle ist es in Abstimmung mit Ihrer Führungskraft möglich, bis zu einem durchschnittlichen Volumen von 60% der jeweiligen Arbeitszeit mobil (innerhalb Deutschlands) zu arbeiten.   Ab 15.03.2022 bis einschließlich 31.12.2022 müssen gemäß    20a IfSG (Infektionsschutzgesetz) Personen, die in medizinischen Einrichtungen tätig sind, einen COVID-19 Immunitätsnachweis vorlegen können. Hiervon ausgenommen sind Personen, die auf Grund einer medizinischen Kontraindikation nicht gegen das Coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 geimpft werden können. Voraussetzung für die Aufnahme des Arbeitsverhältnisses ist ein entsprechender Nachweis gemäß 20a IfSG.    Ihre Aufgaben und Verantwortlichkeiten:   Sie stellen internationalen remote IT-Support für die klinische Bildgebungssoftware diverser Abteilungen von Siemens Healthineers bereit, um Kund*innen zügige und hochqualitative Unterstützung zu bieten Sie koordinieren und organisieren Aktivitäten (einschließlich Updates und Upgrades) mit internen und externen Partner*innen, um die Aufrechterhaltung des klinischen Betriebs auf Kund*innenseite sicherzustellen Sie teilen Ihr Know-how mit neuen Teammitgliedern und tragen dadurch zum Kompetenzaufbau bei    Mehr über dieses Geschäftsfeld erfahren Sie unter https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/de/products-services   Ihre Qualifikationen und Erfahrung:   Sie haben einen erfolgreichen Bachelorabschluss in Elektrotechnik, Computerwissenschaften, Physik oder Medizin, mit einer Affinität für IT; alternativ sind Sie IT-Spezialist*in (z.B. Fachinformatiker*in) und können mehrere Jahre einschlägiger Arbeitserfahrung in der IT vorweisen Sie besitzen erste Erfahrung im Kunden-IT-Support, idealerweise mit Bildgebungsgeräten sowie klinischer Software und Arbeitsabläufen Darüber hinaus haben Sie erste Erfahrung mit virtualisierten IT-Systemen, Skripterstellung und Server-Hardware Erfahrung in der Implementierung von Schnittstellen für Drittanwendungen, vorzugsweise in einer klinischen Umgebung, sind ein klarer Vorteil Idealerweise kennen Sie die Software syngo.via und sind in der Lage diese zu supporten    Ihr Profil und Ihre Fähigkeiten:   Sie verfolgen einen strukturierten Ansatz bei der Lösung von Kundenproblematiken und sind in der Lage, mehrere Supportanfragen gleichzeitig zu betreuen und die entsprechenden Prioritäten zu setzen; gleichzeitig verlieren Sie die Kundenzufriedenheit sowie den Qualitätsanspruch an Ihre technischen Lösungen niemals aus den Augen Wir sind für unsere Kund*innen in EMEA zwischen 7.00 Uhr morgens und 18.00 Uhr abends erreichbar. Ihre Arbeitszeiten sind überwiegend flexibel; nichtsdestotrotz wird eine Woche Früh- bzw. Spätschicht alle drei Wochen vorausgesetzt (innerhalb des oben genannten Rahmens); zweimal pro Jahr stehen Sie für einen Wochenenddienst zu Verfügung Ihre englische Sprachkompetenz ermöglicht es Ihnen, Kunden in ganz EMEA im direkten Telefonkontakt zu unterstützen, Probleme zu dokumentieren, intern mühelos mit Ihren Kolleg*innen zu kommunizieren und den in englischer Sprache abgehaltenen Schulungskursen zu folgen. Idealerweise besitzen Sie bereits Erfahrung in der interkulturellen Zusammenarbeit Darüber hinaus sprechen Sie Französisch fließend. Sie setzen diese Kenntnisse ein, um Kund*innen dieses Sprachraums mit den gleichen qualitativ hochwertigen Leistungen zu unterstützen, wie dies auch auf Englisch der Fall wäre Dank Ihrer hervorragenden Kommunikationsfähigkeiten gelingt Ihnen die nahtlose Integration in unser internationales Team    Unser globales Team:  Siemens Healthineers ist ein weltweit führendes Medizintechnikunternehmen. Mit mehr als 66.000 engagierten Mitarbeitenden in über 70 Ländern gestalten wir die Zukunft des Gesundheitswesens. Jeden Tag profitieren etwa fünf Millionen Patient*innen weltweit von unseren innovativen Technologien und Dienstleistungen aus den Bereichen Diagnostik und therapeutische Bildgebung, Labordiagnostik und molekulare Medizin sowie von unseren digitalen Gesundheits- und Unternehmensdienstleistungen.   Unsere Kultur:  Unsere Unternehmenskultur schätzt verschiedene Blickwinkel, offene Diskussionen und den Willen, Konventionen in Frage zu stellen. Ständiger Wandel gehört zu unserem Arbeitsalltag. Wir wollen in unserer Branche Veränderungen vorantreiben, statt nur darauf zu reagieren. Deswegen laden wir Sie ein, sich neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen, eigene Ideen auszutesten und Erfolge zu feiern.Besuchen Sie auch unsere Karriere-Seite unter https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/de/careers   Wir legen Wert auf Diversität und Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen mit vielfältigen Hintergründen und insbesondere von Menschen mit Behinderung.   Sie möchten mehr erfahren und erste Fragen gern persönlich klären – Sprechen Sie uns an: +49 (9131) / 17 – 1717. Kontaktperson dieser Stellenausschreibung ist Simone Morgenstern.   Wir nehmen den Schutz Ihrer Daten und die Einhaltung der DSGVO und anderer Datenschutzgesetze ernst. Deshalb bitten wir Sie, uns Ihren Lebenslauf nicht per E-Mail zu schicken. Bitte legen Sie ein Profil in unserer Talent Community an, um Ihren Lebenslauf hochzuladen. Daran erkennen wir, dass Sie an Karrieremöglichkeiten bei uns interessiert sind und können Sie zu relevanten Stellen benachrichtigen. Klicken Sie hier, um ein Profil anzulegen.   Siemens Healthineers Deutschland wurde mit dem Zertifikat Great Place to Work® ausgezeichnet.   Organisation:  Siemens Healthineers   Unternehmen:  Siemens Healthcare GmbH   Erfahrungsniveau:  Early Professional   Jobtyp:  Vollzeit

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Our digital energy data platform offers metering services, real estate and energy companies maximum transparency and efficiency and in the future will accompany them on the path to lower CO2 emissions from their buildings and properties in compliance with ESG. The technology enables CO2 savings of up to 20 percent.   We collect large amounts of measurement data and prepare it within our platform for different users. Since our platform is developing very quickly, the amount of data is increasing rapidly, and we are increasingly using smart algorithms, we are looking for a Data Engineer (m/f/d) for our Tech Team in Berlin!   Tasks   You ensure that all data is processed correctly within the ETL process You support the automation of our existing data pipeline You proactively help develop our system architecture You prepare our existing systems for scaling You support the provision of data for analysis and further processing    Requirements    5+ years of experience in Python 2+ years of experience working with time series databases You are able to think your way into complex issues You are a team player and actively support your team with their problem   You should be familiar with our tech stack:   Python Ansible Nginx MySQL Influx Microsoft Azure APIs, Microservices Linux    Benefits    Flexible working hours and the option of a home office Nice office in Prenzlauer Berg with very good transport connections Free drinks & snacks Option on our KUGU Benefit Program & a company pension plan Career / promotion opportunities with a flat hierarchy First-hand insights and co-design options when building a start-up We stand up for our values, which shape our everyday life, our interaction with each other as well as with our customers and partner companies. These are sustainability, reliability, credibility, efficiency, openness and team spirit.   We are looking forward to your application!

Title: IT-System Engineer (f/m/d) remote support in English and French
Description: Do you want to help create the future of healthcare? Our name, Siemens Healthineers, was selected to honor our people who dedicate their energy and passion to this cause. It reflects their pioneering spirit combined with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry.   We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting?   Then come and join our global team as  IT-System Engineer (f/m/d) remote support in English and French  to assist our clinical customers regarding their excellent IT Know-how, especially in the EMEA (Europe, Middle East, Africa) region  Choose the best place for your work –  Within the scope of this position, it is possible, in consultation with your manager, to work mobile (within Germany) up to an average volume of 60% of the respective working hours.   Effective from March 15, 2022 to December 31, 2022 inclusive, individuals working in medical facilities must be able to present a certificate of COVID-19 immunity in accordance with Section 20a of the German Law on Protection against Infection (IfSG – Infektionsschutzgesetz). This does not apply to individuals who cannot be vaccinated against coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 on account of a medical contraindication. A corresponding certificate in accordance with Section 20a IfSG is a prerequisite for the commencement of employment.   Your tasks and responsibilities:   You provide international remote IT support for the clinical imaging software of several Siemens Healthineers departments to provide a fast and high-quality support for the customer You coordinate and organize activities (incl. updates and upgrades) with internal and external partners, in order to ensure clinical operation for customers You share your know-how with new team members and hereby build up their competencies    To find out more about the specific business, have a look at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/products-services   Your qualifications and experience:   You have a bachelor’s degree in the field of electronics engineering, computer science, physics, or medicine, with an affinity for IT; alternatively, you are an IT Specialist and have several years of substantial work experience in the IT field You have first experience in customer IT support, ideally with imaging devices and clinical software and workflow You also gained first experience with virtualized IT systems, scripting and server hardware Having experience in implementing interfaces for 3rd party applications, ideally in a clinical setting, would be a great advantage You ideally know the software syngo.via and have experience in supporting it    Your attributes and skills:   You have a structured approach to our customers' problem cases and are able to keep track of several support requests and set the corresponding priorities; at the same time, you always have customer satisfaction and the quality of your technical solution in mind We serve our customers between 7 a.m. and 6 p.m. Your working hours are mainly flexible, nevertheless, one week early or late shift every three weeks is required (within the above mentioned timeframe); twice a year you will be available for a weekend service With your business fluency in English, you support customers all over EMEA in direct telephone contact, can document problems, easily communicate internally with your colleagues and understand the trainings, most of which are held in English. Ideally, you have already gained experience in intercultural cooperation Additionally, you are fluent in French. You are able to support the customer in French and English at a native level With your strong communication skills, you integrate effortlessly into our international team    Our global team:  Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company. 66,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services.   Our culture:  Our culture embraces different perspectives, open debate, and the will to challenge convention. Change is a constant aspect of our work. We aspire to lead the change in our industry rather than just react to it. That’s why we invite you to take on new challenges, test your ideas, and celebrate success.   Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/de/careers   As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals with disabilities.   Wish to find out more before applying? Contact us: +49 (9131) / 17 – 1717, if you wish to discuss any initial questions with our recruitment team. The contact person handling this job ad is   Simone Morgenstern.   We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. We ask instead that you create a profile in our talent community where you can upload your CV. Setting up a profile lets us know you are interested in career opportunities with us and makes it easy for us to send you an alert when relevant positions become open. Click here to get started.   Siemens Healthineers Germany was awarded the Great Place to Work® certificate.   Organization:  Siemens Healthineers   Company:  Siemens Healthcare GmbH   Experience Level:  Early Professional   Job Type:  Full-time

Title: Software Engineer Digital Payment (m/f/d)
Description: In our office in Frankfurt, our technology addresses changes of the payment world. We provide reliable, secure and modern banking solutions and many more. To strengthen our team, we are looking for an experienced Software Engineer Digital Payment (m/f/d)  to start as soon as possible!   You are responsible for the development of innovative services in the payment and banking environment in direct coordination with our technical analysts, product managers and other stakeholders. Key tasks include the development of web-based front-end applications as well as the real-time integration of customer and Worldline services in international projects.   Your Tasks   You will assist in the validation of internal and external requirements. You will maintain a close and constructive collaboration with technical analysts and product managers. You will play a key role in the analysis, design and implementation of innovative software solutions in a service-oriented architecture. You will be central part of the local and global "Issuing Assets" department and responsible for the development and enhancement of the services and products you manage. You will support internal stakeholders with problems and advise on appropriate solutions.    Your Profile   You have a university degree in computer science, business information technology or close equivalent, or comparable vocational training with equivalent professional experience. Your quick comprehension, analytical thinking and structured approach will give you a good understanding of cross-system processes and their integration. You have experience developing object-oriented software systems on the Java EE platform and of the software development lifecycle. You have experience in the technologies Java EE, Web Services (Soap and Restful) and persistence frameworks and in conveying your solutions using UML. You have experience in responsive web UI development with Angular, Vu.js or equivalent frameworks. You have experience working service integration patterns and frameworks, for example Apache Camel. Thanks to your high sense of responsibility and motivation, you can meet your own very high quality standards. For you, working in a team is an important aspect of your working environment and essential aspect for learning new topics. You should have very good English and good German skills, both spoken and written.    What we offer:   A diversified and challenging job in exciting international projects A proactive interdisciplinary exchange with colleagues from other areas Numerous opportunities for further education and training programs Flexible working hours and remote work 30 days of vacation A friendly and welcoming work environment    Join us on the ride to the digital future!   Do you have any questions? Please feel free to contact Denis Götze under +49-151-44-161-295

Title: Data Engineer – (w/m/d) – Berlin
Description: Hi! We are Billie, the leading provider of “Buy Now, Pay Later” (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are here to transform and upgrade the operating system of B2B Payments. Thus, we enable businesses to pay and get paid on their own terms, having the same frictionless and flexible experience as consumers are used to nowadays. To do so, our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability. Our vision to create new freedom through innovation has attracted exciting strategic partners and highly experienced investors, making us join forces with Klarna and securing an outstanding $100 million Series C funding round nearly quadrupling our previous valuation. Our investors include VCs such as Dawn Capital, Creandum, Picus and SpeedInvest.   Join us to create the future of B2B payments!    About The Role    We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data Platform Engineering  team at Billie. In this team, you will help design and shape the data infrastructure and processes that interconnect our systems.   This will help us to spot fraudsters in real-time while the order is still being placed; it will allow our engineering teams to work independently while still maintaining reliable data interfaces across product domains; it will allow us to operate the data warehouse that enables data scientists and product analysts.   If we do our job well, everyone at Billie is able to use data with confidence.    As Part Of This Role, You Will    Design and develop real-time event pipelines, batch processing capabilities or a low-latency data store that serves features to ML models running in production. Work with software engineers, data scientists and business domain experts to continuously balance flexibility and reliability. As well as establishing best practices, making it easy for teams to pick the right tool for the right task. Make sure we are ready to scale - the volume of data, but also the number of contributors, releases, consumers and overall size of our systems architecture. Ensure that all data systems are operating as expected through test coverage, QA processes and monitoring, quickly detecting system failures, data outages or sudden anomalies.    Who We Are Looking For    You understand that data infrastructure can be a huge enabler for a business - but can just as well become a blocker. You're excited by the opportunity to apply your experience to a complex, quickly growing business. You understand microservice architectures and the challenges they can provide for the data domain. You have experience in processing batch and real-time data sets using cloud technologies, ideally using AWS. You have worked with columnar databases (e.g. Snowflake) and event-driven technologies (e.g Kafka, Segment). You want to apply principles of modern software development and systems architecture to the data domain. You care about reliability and data quality, and get pleasure out of a well-running system. You have experience with scheduling tools (e.g. Airflow), container technologies (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes), CI pipelines (e.g. GitHub Actions, Jenkins) and delivering Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform) For you, working with humans is just as important as operating machines. You enjoy collaborating with others and are willing to question use-cases and hold people accountable to agreed standards and commitments. You have the interest to learn new technologies and methods, but also find joy in sharing your knowledge and experience with others.    What We Offer You    Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance. Up to 6 weeks per year of “Workation”. One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success. Freedom to balance working from home and the office according to you and your team’s needs. No restrictions, only guidelines and a flexibility-first approach. Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program gives you a big discount on the Monthly Public Transport pass in Berlin. A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons. We also offer free German group classes with your colleagues. An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 35 nationalities from all continents represented in our staff. A one-time relocation bonus if you join us in Berlin. A great office space near Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, healthy snacks and cereals, fruit, coffee, soda, and beer.   Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.   Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.   Are you ready to join Billie?

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: Are you a passionate, experienced Data Analyst that wants to contribute to the evolution of the Internet?  We are a small team with big ambitions to improve Internet performance by improving how traffic behaves on Internet Provider Networks. If you are a creative problem-solver who wants to work with a world-class team, and enjoys learning new skills regularly, then we are interested in you!   Aufgaben   You will be responsible for prototyping, developing and maintaining scalable data pipelines You optimize and integrate code to correlate and process multiple data streams in real-time You debug, adapt and abstract network setups of customers to build scalable and generic solutions You improve current testing processes and create new testing automation practices You automate data loading procedures   Our TECH STACK:  Languages: C++, Perl, Python, Bash   Operating System: Linux   Tools & Frameworks: BENOCS sync, ClickHouse (SQL-based DBMS), Docker, GitLab (+CI/CD), git   Monitoring, Reporting & Alerting: Graylog, Kibana, bonefire   Qualifikation   You have 3+ years of professional experience in implementing and running data-intensive distributed systems You are proficient with scripting and object-oriented programming languages You are comfortable with analyzing complex data from varying sources You are fluent with SQL-based DBMS You are familiar with GNU/Linux Dev-Ops tool chain   NICE-TO-HAVE:   You have knowledge of carrier-grade network structures & routing protocols You have knowledge on Internet Control and Data plane measurement correlation    Benefits    Learning Opportunities:  Lifelong learning is essential for us. We offer the opportunity to develop not only software, but also yourself!   Flexible Working Hours:  We know you have a life outside of work, which is why we allow you work whenever it suits you as long as you are available during our core working hours.   Health Offers:  Your health is important to us. We offer free health checks, regular preventive medical checkups, seasonal flu vaccines, free beverages and fruits.   Company Pension Scheme:  Be well positioned for the future - we offer a company pension scheme and pay monthly contributions.   Virtual Stock Options:  Be part of a success story and benefit from the company’s growth.   JobRad:  Join our bike leasing program to get a new bicycle at a reduced cost.   Shopping Discounts:  Products and services at a discount from numerous providers and partners.   We are committed to a diverse workforce and strongly welcome all applications regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, disability or age.

Title: Data Engineer in Business Intelligence Infrastructure Team (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
Description: About Agoda  Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.   Get to Know Our Team  The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.   The Opportunity  We’re managing data over 500TB and BI Software services on top of it with over 100 servers, to help our colleagues build great dashboards and reports that help people make smart decisions based on our data. Improve our customer booking experiences through technology.   As Data Engineer in BI Infrastructure Team, you will learn a lot of technologies such as MSSQL Database, Vertica, Tableau, Metabase, Superset, GitLab, Automation, etc. and manage them by your own hands and provide good services to our users (BI Developers and Other Developers). You will work with BI Infra DBA team to improve availability/performance/visibility/automation using variety of tools for our services and give consult to our users.   In This Role, You’ll Get to   Administrating, Proactive and re-active monitoring of services in order to provide 24 x 7 uptime and availability Troubleshooting and Performance tuning Communicating with Infrastructure Team, Hadoop Team and BI Developers to ensure Scalability, Integrity, Security and Performance Support our BI Developer to designs and develops BI Solutions, Data Warehouse & Data Model on Big Data platform (Hadoop/Vertica) using ETL Tools (SSIS or in-house developed ETL), OLAP and Dashboard (Tableau, Metabase, Superset) Always stay on latest BI Technology and always looking for something new Create automation tasks / self-services / documentations to reduce manual operation tasks List of Services Tableau, Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services, Metabase, Superset  SQL Server Analysis Services  SQL Server Integration Services  SQL Server Database  Vertica   What You’ll Need To Succeed   Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Computer science or any related fields At least 3 years experiences in Database Administration/System Administration/System Engineer/Data Engineer Experience in Linux environment Experience with Database High Availability technology Experience in Business Intelligence area will be advantage Experience with Database Monitoring, Proactive and re-active is a plus Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new environments well Be able to work under pressure and to deadlines Be the team player with good interpersonal and communication skills Be able to attend on-call rotation Good English communication skill Good time management and multitasking skills An ability to work well independently and as part of a team    It’s Great If You Have   Vertica Administrator, SQL Server Database Administrator, Power BI Report Server, SSAS, SSIS, Tableau Administrator Linux/Windows System Administration SQL Performance Tuning Grafana, Elasticsearch, JobScheduler, HAProxy, Metricbeat, Ansible Proficient knowledge of SQL and Relational Database: able to write, execute and interpret queries Coding Skill. Python is a plus    #sydney #kyiv #melbourne #london #tokyo #dhaka #edinburgh #amsterdam #munich #moscow #dublin #seoul #hcmc #telaviv #moscow #taipei #manila   Equal Opportunity Employer  At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.   We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .   To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: There is no planet B.  Humans must reduce greenhouse gas emissions. We take action together with our clients in the chemical sector which by itself contributes up to 40% of global industrial GHG emissions. Join us on our mission to lead the way to a zero-carbon economy and boost innovation to make chemical companies climate neutral.   Our solution is   Industry-specific: Handling the complexity of chemical value chains is our daily business Business-focused: We make sustainability data available to a broad range of users and empower them to take action Data-driven: We offer a fast and cost-effective calculation of sustainability metrics   Are you keen on joining our team, building a great product, and growing with us? Get in touch!   Tasks   Work closely with our customers and other developers to build and continuously extend our data pipeline Give and receive constructive feedback to teammates through code reviews You challenge the status quo and proactively identify product areas that require attention You have a passion to write clean, testable, and documented code and a “never-stop-learning” attitude Improve engineering standards, tools, and processes    Requirements    Residence and work permit in Germany German or English language, at least C1 level 1-3 years of experience in data engineering Experience in larger software development projects is a plus Strong Python background and in-depth knowledge of common databases (SQL, PostgreSQL) Knowledge of standard ETL tools Experience with cloud computing (AWS, Azure) is a plus    Benefits    Almost unlimited growth opportunities Exposure to renowned clients and relevant business problems Competitive compensation and benefits package   Equal Opportunities for Everyone  We are open to all groups of people without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristics.   Work mode  To enable our remote work mode, we work with:   MS Teams for synchronous communication GitLab for project management Daily project standup meetings, one engineering meeting each week Bi-monthly face-to-face meetings of our team

Title: System Engineer Hybrid Cloud Infrastructure (m|f|d)
Description: The Sartorius Group is a leading international partner of life science research and the biopharmaceutical industry. Our technologies help making the development and production of new drugs faster and more efficient, so that more people have access to better medicine. As one of the fastest-growing global life science companies, we are looking for people who share our ambition and want to make a contribution in a vibrant environment.    In the following link you will find further information about Sartorius candidate-guide-data.pdf (sartorius.com).  For our Information Technology division within Sartorius Corporate Administration GmbH we are looking for a System Engineer Hybrid Cloud Infrastructure (m|f|d) for our headquarters in Goettingen or Berlin as soon as possible. In this role you will be responsible for the global infrastructure on-premises and in the cloud. In addition to the day-to-day business, you will be responsible for the continuous development and improvement of the infrastructure. Furthermore, you will be involved in exciting projects and actively drive the cloud strategy.   What you will accomplish together with us     You will be responsible for supporting our complex, enterprise-wide hybrid infrastructure (cloud and on-premise) in terms of utilization, performance and security This includes the development and implementation of new solutions and the continuous improvement of the current environment As part of a global team, you will be responsible for the operation, maintenance, monitoring and automation of the hybrid infrastructure You will advise internal customers on cloud and on-premise IT infrastructure solutions and participate in international IT projects Creating and updating the documentation of IT systems and services as well as the associated operating processes rounds off your area of responsibility     What will convince us     Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, comparable qualifications as well as experience in the life sciences or pharmaceutical industry are desirable Several years of relevant professional experience with hybrid infrastructures and cloud services (SaaS, IaaS) from various providers, especially Microsoft (M365 and Azure) Extensive knowledge of Azure AD as a standard identity platform and security technologies such as SSO, IAM, MFA, IDP, Conditional Access in a hybrid cloud infrastructure environment using AD, AAD and Azure. Experience with infrastructure topics such as virtual servers (Windows, Linux), Active Directory as well as backup, containerization (e.g. Kubernetes), patch management and monitoring Familiar with scripting in Powershell and automation such as Infrastructure as Code using Terraform First completed certificates (ITIL Foundation, MCSE) are desirable Fluent English is a prerequisite, German or French language skills enhance your profile and an occasional willingness to travel to our worldwide locations round this off Identification with our core values: Sustainability, Openness, Enjoyment     What we offer Our ambition is to simplify progress in life science research and the biopharmaceutical industry to help translate scientific findings into new therapeutics faster and more efficiently. So that more people can obtain access to better medicine. More than 14,000 employees at more than 60 production and sales locations worldwide are committed to this vision.   Opportunity for international career development: a global network offering seminars and training sessions, expert and manager career paths Open and highly collaborative culture: mutual support within teams and working as equals, team spirit and international collaboration Work-life balance: Working from home at many sites Intelligent working environment: working in smart buildings with the latest technology and equipment Ambitious goals: Sartorius plans to double its sales revenue approximately every five years and expects to grow its global team to approximately 15,000 people in 2025

Title: Data Engineer (Golang) - Berlin, Cologne, Remote
Description: Get to know us  eyeo is an open source software company whose market-leading ad-filtering technology powers products like Adblock Plus, Adblock and Adblock Browser, and whose privacy-first products like Crumbs promote transparency and an improved browsing experience. eyeo is dedicated to giving users control of their online experience while fostering a sustainable online value exchange to offer creators, publishers and advertisers more ways to earn money for the content they provide.   In combining our reach of distribution partnerships and our own products, our technology runs on over 225 million devices.   At eyeo, we’re passionate about user agency, personal privacy, sustainability and keeping the web an open, fair resource for everyone.   How We Work  eyeo has colleagues based all over the world. We practice agile and work in distributed, cross-functional teams that span nearly every timezone. Many of our tech teams prefer to work asynchronously.   What We're Looking For  We’re now looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join eyeo and our Data team, which plays a significant role in supporting all teams across the company, as part of eyeo’s platforms and infrastructure department. In this role you will have a direct impact on the technical direction for eyeo’s central data platform; you will establish solid engineering practices and engage in active knowledge sharing with other data engineers, and you will help ensure that our team has a technology strategy that supports the entire organization and allows all teams across eyeo to make data driven decision and deliver on their business goals.   What You'll Do   Develop and maintain eyeo’s central large scale, high-performance data platform and data processing pipelines Integrate new data sources Automate anything and everything to support and speed up the work data and BI analysts Support other teams with their data related engineering tasks Review the code of other engineers and analysts Contribute to building a sustainable engineering and team culture that is collaborative, inclusive, respectful and in line with eyeo’s core values    What you bring to the table...   A solid foundation in data engineering and software engineering in general Experience with containers (Kubernetes) Strong foundation with Golang for data processing Proficient with the Unix/Linux command line and shell scripting Professional experience with cloud computing applied to data engineering (e.g. with GCP, AWS or Azure) Understanding of continuous improvement and agile software development processes and practices Very good English, especially in writing Within CET±3 hours or willing to relocate into CET±3 hours    It's awesome, but not required, if you know have:   Experience with GCP (Google Cloud Platform) in particular Experience working remotely Thorough understanding how browsers and web servers work Experience with Ansible, Terraform, and/or Airflow Experience with Data visualization tools and monitoring Understanding of User Privacy Topics, and handling sensitive data, e.g. anonymizing PII    What we offer   Work from home or one of our offices —we trust you to find what works best for you Stipend for the following: home office and/or relocation Flexible working hours 28 days paid vacation + Volunteer day Your choice of hardware and setup Personal and professional development budget Monthly child care stipend for children under 6 Offsite team days and the annual summer company retreat in Cologne Company-sponsored hackathons    Privacy Notice  When you apply, you’ll be automatically forwarded to our recruitment platform operated by an external service provider called Greenhouse (seated in the US). Greenhouse collects some information on its website, such as anonymous usage statistics, by using cookies, server logs, and other similar technology. For more information, please refer to Greenhouse’s Privacy Policy. All documents and information provided by you are stored with Greenhouse. In order to ensure an adequate level of data protection, eyeo and Greenhouse have entered into the EU Standard Contractual Clauses (“processors”) - Commission Decision C(2010)593. You can request a copy of this by contacting us at privacy[at]eyeo.com. If you don’t want your data forwarded to Greenhouse, please do not apply. For detailed and further information, please refer to our Privacy Policy at https://eyeo.com/en/privacy.

Description: Location: Nürnberg, DE, 90411   Job Requisition ID: 6297   Schaeffler is a dynamic global technology company and its success has been a result of its entrepreneurial spirit and long history of private ownership. Does that sound interesting to you? As a partner to all of the major automobile manufacturers, as well as key players in the aerospace and industrial sectors, we offer you many development opportunities.
