Title: Data Center Engineer (w/m/d)
Description: Freudenberg ist ein globales Technologieunternehmen, das seine Kunden und die Gesellschaft durch wegweisende Innovationen nachhaltig stärkt. Gemeinsam mit Partnern, Kunden und der Wissenschaft entwickeln wir seit Jahren technisch führende Produkte, exzellente Lösungen und Services für rund 40 Marktsegmente. Die Freudenberg Gruppe beschäftigt weltweit rund 50.000 Mitarbeitende in 60 Ländern und erzielt einen Jahresumsatz von nahezu 9 Milliarden Euro.   EagleBurgmann ist ein international führender Spezialist für industrielle Dichtungstechnik. Wir kombinieren innovative Technologien, digitale Lösungen und unsere Leidenschaft zu anspruchsvollen Dichtungssystemen. Unsere Produkte helfen dabei, ganze Industriezweige sicherer und nachhaltiger zu machen. Rund 5.000 Mitarbeitende schaffen mit ihrer Begeisterung und Kompetenz weltweit Mehrwert für unsere Kunden. EagleBurgmann ist ein Joint Venture der deutschen Freudenberg Gruppe und der japanischen Eagle Industry Gruppe.   Wolfratshausen   EagleBurgmann Germany GmbH & Co. KG   Sie unterstützen unser Team als   Data Center Engineer (w/m/d)   Ihre Aufgaben   Betrieb und Wartung der Server- und DataCenter Infrastruktur des Unternehmens inklusive Administration der Anwendungs- und Desktop Virtualisierung sowie Virtualisierungslösungen für Server in unserem Enterprise (hochverfügbarer) Architektur Support der Server/Systeme in 2nd und 3rd Level Durchführen von Projekten im eigenen Fachbereich bzw. Mitarbeit in Team übergreifenden Projekten lokal und global Problembearbeitung und Fehleranalyse bei Ausfällen und Technischen Störungen sowie Wiederherstellen des Betriebs Weiterentwicklung unserer bestehenden IT-Systemlandschaft und Umsetzung der IT-Roadmap inklusive Konzeptionierung, Implementierung (verteilter) hochverfügbarer Enterprise IT-Architekturen sowie zugehöriger Dokumentation    Ihr Profil   Erfolgreich abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung im Bereich IT oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung Mehrjährige Erfahrung als Systemadministrator im internationalen Umfeld inklusive umfassendes Wissen zu State of the Art Technologien und „Best-Practise“ Konzepten Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Microsoft Server Betriebssystemen, Active Directory, Exchange Server (On-Prem und M365), Microsoft SQL-Server, in Basis-Diensten (DNS, SMTP, SNMP, etc.) sowie Cloud Services (AZURE) Gute Kenntnisse in Backupsystemen und DR-Strategien sowie Erfahrung mit Informationssicherheits-Anforderungen Hohes Maß an Eigenverantwortung, Teamfähigkeit, Risikobewusstsein, Proaktivität und selbständige Priorisierung der täglichen Aufgaben Bereitschaft zur Übernahme von 18x6 On-Call Support am Standort Wolfratshausen/Eurasburg Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse    Ihre Vorteile   Cafeteria/Kantine:  Vor Ort werden frische, warme und kalte Speisen angeboten.   Vielfalt & Integration:  Betreten Sie eine von Vielfalt geprägte Welt der Innovation.   Nachhaltigkeit / Soziales Engagement:  Mit Engagement, Nachhaltigkeit und sozialem Engagement etwas bewirken.   Mitarbeiterrabatte:  Vergünstigte Angebote auf Produkte und Dienstleistungen.   Internationale Tätigkeitsbereiche:  Internationale Karriere mit globaler Ausrichtung und Vernetzungen.   Die Freudenberg Gruppe zeichnet sich durch Offenheit und Chancengleichheit aus. Wir begrüßen daher Bewerbungen von allen Menschen unabhängig von Alter, Geschlecht, Herkunft und Abstammung, einer Behinderung oder anderer gesetzlich geschützter Gründe.

Title: Software Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: ESPRIT ist mehr als ein Arbeitgeber. Neben Modetrends geht es uns auch um Nachhaltigkeit und Diversität. Genau das macht Esprit zu der großartigen Fashion- und Lifestyle-Brand, die sie ist.   Wir suchen echte Persönlichkeiten. Charakterköpfe, die was auf dem Kasten, aber auch Ecken und Kanten haben. Wir lieben, was wir tun. Und das solltest du auch.   Du bist ein Teamplayer und liebst es mit Kolleg innen gemeinsam Herausforderungen anzugehen?   Du möchtest für eine Fashion Brand arbeiten, die jeder kennt und deinen Beitrag zum Erfolg des Unternehmens leisten?   Dann bewirb dich jetzt als   Software Engineer (m/w/d)  um unser Team zu unterstützen. (ID 23602)   Das sind deine Aufgaben   Du analysierst, konzipierst, entwickelst, testest, implementierst und operationalisierst Softwareprodukte, Anwendungsintegration und Datenintegration Du übernimmst die Rolle eines Full Stack Developer, der sowohl Frontend- als auch Backend-Entwicklungen abdeckt Du definierst, implementierst, förderst und verfeinerst Software-Engineering-Praktiken, die stets ein Gleichgewicht zwischen Standard, Geschwindigkeit und Qualität herstellen Du treibst verschiedene Formen der Softwareentwicklung voran von No Code, Low Code, Scripting, Robotic Process Automation bis hin zur klassischen Softwareentwicklung Du arbeitest mit den Produktverantwortlichen hinsichtlich der Anforderungen und der technischen Umsetzung von Änderungswünschen zusammen Du bearbeitest das 2. und 3. Support-Level Du identifizierst und löst Probleme und Vorfälle, um einen reibungslosen Betrieb zu ermöglichen Du etablierst Testframeworks und implementierst einen Testautomatisierungsprozess Du initiierst Maßnahmen zur Förderung und zum Aufbau einer Continuous Deployment & Delivery Pipeline Du beteiligst dich an IT-Projekten und übernimmst Projektaufgaben Du baust Communities von Citizen Developers auf und schulst diese durch interne Workshops und die Teilnahme an externen Hackathons   Das bringst du mit   Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik oder Naturwissenschaften kombiniert mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Position Professionelle Zertifizierungen auf verwandten Plattformen/Tools wären von großem Vorteil Du verfügst über ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Englisch, weitere Sprachen wie Deutsch wären von Vorteil Du verfügst über sehr gute Kenntnisse in Software Design Patterns und deren Umsetzung Du bist vertraut mit agilen und DevOps-Praktiken und -Tools Du hast Erfahrung in den Bereichen Anwendungsintegration, Datenintegration und Middleware-Technologien Du verfügst über Kenntnisse in der Anwendungsentwicklung und Softwareerstellung in gängigen Programmiersprachen Du bist vertraut mit skriptbasierten Programmiersprachen wie Python oder Javascript und Microsoft-Ökosystemen wie Azure Integration Services, SQL Server, Power Platform und Microsoft 365 Erfahrung mit Robotic Process Automation SAP-basierte RPA und/oder Microsoft PowerAutomate wären von Vorteil Du verfügst über eine analytische Denkweise, eine strukturierte und konzeptbasierte Arbeitsweise und eine Hands-on-Mentalität Du besitzt eine interkulturelle Kompetenz und eine lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise   Unsere Benefits   Wir haben eine flexible Mobile Office Regelung, die es dir erlaubt, deinen Arbeitsort an mindestens zwei Tagen die Woche selbst zu wählen. Wir sind ein Team, welches viel Wert auf ein kollegiales und offenes Miteinander legt, offenes Feedback wird stets geschätzt Wir haben keinen Dresscode, bei uns kannst du tragen worin du dich wohlfühlst. Lass dich inspirieren https //to.esprit.com/shop Bei uns bekommst du 40% Personalrabatt auf unser gesamtes Sortiment Wir bieten dir selbstverständlich einen Zuschuss zum ÖPNV oder du kannst auf einem unserer kostenlosen Parkplätze parken Wir haben eine preisgekrönte Kantine, die dich jeden Tag mit wirklich leckerem und gesundem Essen versorgt   Das ist die richtige Position für dich?   Dann bewirb dich unter Angabe deiner Gehaltsvorstellungen und deines frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins. Du kannst dich bei Rückfragen gerne an Julia Cleef wenden.

Title: Software Engineer - (Fullstack)
Description: Our story:  Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.   Spread across Berlin and Madrid, Team Taxfix is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with 500+ professionals from 45+ different nationalities, we're rich in ideas and voices. In five years, we've raised over 300 million euros in funding and helped people reclaim more than one billion euros.   Your team:  We believe in Internal Open Source because it cultivates a strong spirit of collaboration and fast evolution while maintaining a high standard of quality. This way of working is made possible by using the universal language JavaScript, specifically, React, React Native and NodeJS. We also utilise Elixir in the reasoning engine used to write our tax logic. Everything runs in Docker—orchestrated by Kubernetes and powered by Google Cloud Platform.   Our cross-functional team structure gives developers a broad scope of our stack. We're passionate about decentralised, end-to-end ownership and deep collaboration. We live our development values by learning from one another through internal meetups, hackathons, and close collaboration.   Your responsibilities:   Collaborating with the team and taking direction from the PM, continue the design and redesign of the Taxfix product with a user-centric focus. Contribute to technical decisions and strategy to further the long-term product vision. Work full-stack with minimal supervision, offering support/mentorship to more junior members of the team. Be part of the cross functional product team, working with React/ React Native and Node.JS. Be involved in key product decisions and work closely with the whole team to create intuitive and reliable apps. Collaborating with different teams across the business.   Your profile:   +3 years experience with JavaScript (NodeJS + React) Experience building solid backend services and well structured front-end applications Experience with integrating with diverse APIs Familiarity with Docker is a plus Passionate about writing maintainable and elegant code. Been working with Git, GitHub/Gitlab, and TDD. A pragmatic person with a strong positive attitude. Somebody who can work autonomously and overcome challenges with passion. Demonstrate curiosity and passion to continue learning.   Why Taxfix?   A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals. Holistic wellbeing with mental health coaching sessions, a discounted membership to Urban Sports Club, and supplemental child care support. Employee stock options for all employees—because everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create. The freedom to work from home or our modern office—plus healthy drinks and snacks when you do come in. 30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours. Plenty of opportunities to socialise as a team. In addition to internal tech meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethers—virtually and in person when possible. Have a four-legged friend in your life? We’re happy to have dogs join us in the office.   Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture below:   At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.   Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyways. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't previously considered.

Title: PHP Software Engineer (f/m/x)
Description: Work location: FULLY REMOTE  within Germany   (with a possibility to use our office in Berlin)   FULL-TIME   What You Will Do    Your main goal as Software Engineer in our Product Data Catalogue Management Team  will be the development and maintenance of our systems that are responsible for the creation and distribution of product information & content across all our sales channels used by customers all over Europe.   What you can expect:   Development of the systems supporting data product distribution across our technology landscape Creating new (micro)services in PHP Participation in the architecture design of the system Reviewing and giving constructive feedback on others' code Learning new technologies, keeping abreast of existing technologies and helping to introduce them where appropriate Supporting us to be more cloud-centric     What You Bring In    Having at least 2-3 years of experience as PHP Software Engineer Knowing at least one of the PHP frameworks (Symfony required) Having practical knowledge of object-oriented programming Experiences with software architecture definition, REST APIs, unit testing and AMQP Working experience with automated integration tests and CI/CD approach Experience with GIT & Atlassian tools Knowledge of relational databases (MySQL) A business-oriented approach towards software requirements and development Very good command of English in speaking and writing    Would be an asset Good practical knowledge of JavaScript  Hands-on experience in using Docker  Understanding of Domain-Driven Design  Experience with Azure (Terraform) and "monitoring first" approach  Knowledge of NoSQL databases (Elasticsearch, MongoDB)  What We Provide  The DEVELOPMENT  of each exponDOer is of the upmost importance to us:  You will be assigned to a buddy, who will support, advise and simply be there during there for you during the first 4 to 6 weeks of the onboarding.  Your opinion makes a difference, and you will help us to shape with us expondo's future.  We provide free user accounts for both Udemy for Business and Babbel to promote your constant development.  We offer all our employees the FREEDOM  to work how it is best suited to their needs:  Whether it will be remote, from the office or a hybrid of both, we will support any decision made and provide the needed hardware to work in comfort.  If you decide to work at one our locations, all the recommended protective measures are in place for a safe working environment.  We provide flexible working hours, work-free weekends, and there are no nightshifts.  In our CULTURE  we respect our employees' needs and care for each other:  We care about everyone's physical and mental health, and that is why we provide the best possible conditions for a sustainable work-life balance.  We also grant expondo sponsored psychological support for all our employees around the clock.  You will be a part of a diverse team in which good humour, mutual support and respect are highly valued. We offer a competitive pay based on your experience and an excellent benefits package (the specific offer depends on certain location and evaluated skill level; for Germany the salary oscillates between 50k and 70k EUR gross/year).The expondo group is an international e-commerce company with more than 400 employees. We are a renowned manufacturer and online retailer of niche products created by experts for experts, operating in Europe and having locations in Germany, Poland, Hong Kong and China. Our focus is to provide our customers with an appropriate and scalable service.To be a part of the extended expondo family is to be a part of an ambitious and dynamic global company. What lies ahead in terms of future is in the hands of our employees. It is their ideas, vision, skills, and talents which allow for us to succeed in this fast paced, globalizing world. It is the trust, partnership, and commitmentthat we have for each other which is the key to achieving further success, as we move forward together by owning our actions.It's time to get it donewith expondo and the time is now.

Title: Data & Domain Engineer (m/w/d) Car Configurator
Description: Du übernimmst gerne Verantwortung und magst es, Prozesse nach Optimierungspotenzialen zu durchsuchen? Dann suchen wir Dich als Data & Domain Engineer (m/w/d) zur Unterstützung bei der Weiterentwicklung eines Car Configurators!   Bei unserem Kunden handelt es sich um eine Tochtergesellschaft eines Automobilgroßkonzerns. Neben einer zunehmend internationalen Ausrichtung bietet das Unternehmen flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Home-Office Möglichkeit sowie umfangreiche Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten an. Bewirb Dich noch heute!   Das erwartet Dich bei uns   Betreuung der fachlichen Domäne der Bildbereitstellung für den Car Configurator Implementierung und Durchführung von Qualitätssicherungsmaßnahmen Anpassung der fachlichen Applikationslogik Design und Entwicklung von Business Rules Analyse der Prozesse zur Datenbereitstellung- und pflege sowie Ableitung und Implementierung von Verbesserungsmöglichkeiten  Das bieten wir Dir   Rückmeldung innerhalb kürzester Zeit Corporate Shopping und Rabatte für ausgewählte Fitnessstudios Langfristige Einsatzmöglichkeit mit Option auf unbefristete Festanstellung Betreuung durch einen persönlichen Talent Coach  Deine Qualifikationen   Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, des Informationsmanagements oder vergleichbar Gutes technisches Verständnis für IT-Systeme und Prozesse Erfahrung in der Bereitstellung und Pflege von Content Idealerweise Erfahrung im Softwareentwicklungsumfeld Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse

Title: Software Engineer (DevOps - Developer Experience) - remote friendly
Description: Our mission  ? Creating the finance solution that energizes SMEs and freelancers, so they can achieve more. We simplify everything from everyday banking to bookkeeping and spend management. At Qonto, we’re passionate about creating the best product - with both impact and a great user experience. So if you’re looking for an ambitious team that’s revolutionizing a rather old-fashioned industry, get in touch. You can find out more about the Qonto Way  here .   Alexandre and Steve launched Qonto in July 2017. Since then, the team has made great strides:   Becoming market leader for online SME banking in Europe with 250,000 SME clients Getting recognized as one of the Top 10 startups to work for ( LinkedIn | Glassdoor ) Opening offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, and Barcelona 600+ happy Qontoers building a finance solution businesses love to use.    Our values:  Ambition  | We tackle big challenges. No matter what   Teamwork  | We create momentum by working together, at the same speed   Mastery  | We pursue excellence through continuous learning. We face challenges with humility. Every day   Integrity  | We're open. We're honest. And we earn the trust of our clients and each other   As a DevOps Engineer  , you will join a group of 12 talented people  organized into two teams:   T he SRE Platform Reliability team builds and operates efficient, reliable, safe, and scalable environments for customers and Qontoers T he Engineering Efficiency team design and crafts tools that increase engineers’ velocity while providing a world-class developer experience    While each team is responsible for solving a specific set of problems, they often work hand-in-hand on cross-functional topics.   👩‍💻🧑‍💻 As a DevOps Engineer in the Engineering Efficiency team, you will:   Design, craft and maintain tools & frameworks that allow our engineers to ship fast and smoothly at scale Engage and work with other Qontoers to understand their needs and create high-quality solutions with top-notch developer experience Foster a DevOps culture by advocating and sharing your knowledge among all cross-functional teams Reduce the burden of human toil with tooling and automation Continuously improve our stack by challenging the status quo and staying on the edge of technology by attending internal & external conferences    🛠 The Engineering Efficiency team is using:   Go, Python, and bash to craft our internal toolings AWS for most of our infrastructure Terraform to manage our infrastructure as code Docker & Kubernetes to build, run and operate containers Gitlab-CI to orchestrate our CI pipelines ArgoCD to deploy and manage our applications’ lifecycle    🧠 What You Can Expect   Learn to master the Qonto way and problem-solving methodologies Sharpen your technical skills on cloud infrastructure concepts, containerization, and software delivery automation Invest time designing robust and sustainable solutions Work with experts on modern stacks & challenge technical status-quo Collaborate with other teams on tech challenges, spec reviews, brainstorming & problem-solving sessions    🤝 Your future manager  Stéphane , Lead SRE, will work with you every day and help you learn & grow at Qonto.   His Background? Coming from a Software Engineering background, Stephane started to nurture the DevOps practices +12 years ago. Over the last five years, he helped improve the DX of some London-based startups before joining Qonto as a freelancer. After a year in the SRE Platform Reliability team, he seized the opportunity to build and Lead the Engineering Efficiency team. What does he bring to the team? Stephane promotes a healthy work environment and continuously improves the team’s organization. He thrives when helping all team members develop their technical expertise while sharpening their soft skills.    🏅About You  We are more curious about your aptitude and mindset than a specific experience or qualifications. If you enjoy finding elegant solutions to challenging problems, we would love to hear from you.   We currently have open roles for mid-level to senior candidates.   Mastery: You are a software engineer at heart, and you’re taking pride in writing well-designed, robust, and maintainable code to solve problems Make an impact: You want to build a product that makes hundreds of engineers’ life easier and enable them to be more efficient Curious: You have an interest (but not necessarily experience) in everything from infrastructure to front-end Resourceful: You’re comfortable working with unfamiliar codebases, including internal, open-source, and 3rd party code we depend on Problem solver: You have a systematic and logical approach, taking incremental steps toward solving big problems Team player: You’re equally eager to receive and share feedback, thriving in an environment where everyone can grow Experience: 3+ years of software development, bonus points if you have a particular interest in engineering productivity and developer experience Languages: You can speak both YAML and English fluently    🌟 Preferred But Not Required   Experience with Kubernetes (k8s) General knowledge of cloud platforms, containerization, and software delivery automation Familiar with Infrastructure as Code and Immutability principles    If you read this far and feel like this could be a great opportunity for you, don’t let the imposter syndrome prevent you from applying and hit the button “Apply”, we’d really love to hear from you!  🎁 Perks  A laptop. An inclusive work environment. A tailor-made career track. And so much more to help you succeed…   Office & Team Life   A central fully-renovated building in Berlin with WeWork services The latest equipment from Apple Monthly team events Free coffee and snacks in the kitchen    Qonto’s Benefits   A competitive salary package Tailor-made Remote Policy 28 days of paid leave Moka Care to take care of your mental health and gym access with Urban Sports Club Meal vouchers 50% public transportation reimbursement An inclusive environment with a focus on parity: 40% of our teams are women Relocation package and visa sponsorship for international talents (we have 50+ nationalities) including access to Busuu to improve your language skills Career tracks and mobility opportunities that can match all expectations    💪 Our hiring process:   A 60 min video call with one of our Talent Acquisition Managers, to better understand your career plan and answer any questions you may have A 60 min video call with your future manager, to be aligned on expectations on both sides and to talk about how you would work together A remote exercise to evaluate your skills and give you a taste of what working Qonto could be like Video calls or onsite interviews with future team members (optional) to help you understand what working at Qonto is like A final video call or onsite interview with the manager of your future Department    Check this article to learn more about the hiring process  and we will send you an interview guide  so you can best prepare yourself.   On average our process lasts 20 working days  and offers usually follow within 48 hours  🤞   Thank you for considering joining Qonto. We cannot wait to learn more about you!   If you want to learn more about us: Handelsblatt | Qonto's Blog | FintechMagazine | TechCrunch

Description: Referenz 16-120498  Im Auftrag unseres namhaften Kundenunternehmens  mit Sitz im Raum Waiblingen  suchen wir im Rahmen der Personalvermittlung in Festanstellung  einen System Engineer (m/w/d) 38 Stunden Woche.    Ihre Benefits    Eine unbefristete und langfristige Festanstellung in einer wachstumsstarken Branche Jahresgehalt in Höhe von 55.000 Euro bis 80.000 Euro 30 Tage Urlaub Regelmäßige Teilnahme an aktuellen Weiterbildungen sowie Zertifizierungsmöglichkeiten Kostenlose Getränke (Mineralwasser, Säfte und Bionade) und Kaffeespezialitäten Eigene Kantine mit günstigen und abwechslungsreichen Gerichten Zuschuss zum VVS-Jobticket oder zu den Fahrtkosten    Ihre Aufgaben    Unterstützung und Kontrolle der Nutzer in Abstimmung mit dem IT-Betrieb und Dienstleistern Bestimmung, Organisation und Überwachung von erforderlichen Anpassungen Erstellung und Verwaltung für neue Anwendungen und Zuständigkeit für den gesamten Lebenszyklus der Software Pflege, Ausbau und Prüfung der Applikationen und von deren Umsysteme Prüfung von Fehlern sowie deren Analyse und Behebung Funktionsdokumentation und Gestaltung von Bedienungsanleitungen    Ihr Profil    Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich der IT oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation Berufserfahrungen in der Einführung von Anwendungssystemen ist von Vorteil Idealerweise Erfahrung im Umgang mit Java Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind Voraussetzung Eigenständige und zielorientierte Arbeitsweise Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit Hohe Qualitätsbewusstsein und Leistungsbereitschaft   Die Amadeus FiRe AG bringt als spezialisierter Personaldienstleister jeden Tag Fach- und Führungskräfte aus dem kaufmännischen und IT-Bereich mit nationalen und internationalen Unternehmen zusammen. Nutzen Sie unsere persönlichen Kontakte zu Arbeitgebern bundesweit!  Wir empfehlen Sie an unsere Kunden weiter und erleichtern Ihnen damit den Einstieg ins Unternehmen!   Für einen ersten vertraulichen Kontakt steht Ihnen Frau Anna Laufenberg  (Tel +49 (0) 711 16240-56 ) gerne zur Verfügung. Interessiert an der Stelle als System Engineer (m/w/d) 38 Stunden Woche  ? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (max. 5 MB) unter Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und des frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins bevorzugt per Online-Bewerbungsformular oder per E-Mail unter Nennung der Referenznummer 16-120498  an: it.stuttgart@amadeus-fire.de   Amadeus FiRe AG  Niederlassung Stuttgart  Vordernbergstraße 6   70191 Stuttgart

Title: Junior Cloud Software Engineer | GCP, Kotlin, Java, Spring | Team Humpback (f/m/d)
Description: Unternehmenstext  OTTO is the largest online furniture retailer on the German market. Furniture and other large items - such as washing machines or televisions - are an essential part of the OTTO marketplace.   As part of the fulfillment chain for large item logistics, Team Humpback helps ensure that our customers can order their favorite products and have them delivered quickly and conveniently.   Become part of the team and drive the further development of large item logistics with your future colleagues. On the way to the OTTO platform, we are redefining IT processing. We work independently and based on agile principles in our cross-functional team.   The software we develop is supported throughout its entire life cycle according to the "You build it, you run it" principle. If you enjoy mapping complex business processes in software and would like to contribute your creativity to a team with many friendly and humorous colleagues, then you've come to the right place.   Our team consists of a product owner and an agile master, three analysts and six software developers and the language we use is German.    Our Tech Stack    GCP Cloud | Kotlin/Java (Spring Boot) | Node.js | Event-driven Architecture | Github Actions | Terraform   Your role   You design and develop high-quality systems in pair or mob according to TDD. You will contribute to the further development of the team-internal and cross-team technical architectures and will be able to draw on the service catalog of the Google Cloud Platform. You will work closely with the business analysts and the product owner. As a junior developer, you will be part of an experienced team of developers in which we will work with you to further develop our software.   You're not sure if the position suits you? - We will be happy to put you in touch with Moritz Wörle  from the department. Would you like to experience your future team and your workplace live? - You will have the opportunity to do so at a later date as part of your application process.   Your profile   Must-have    You have first experiences with Java or Kotlin. You want to learn new things and expand your horizons. You enjoy working in pair programming. You know Scrum and Kanban not only from the textbook - you bring an agile mindset. You have first experiences with automated tests. You are fluent in written and spoken English.    Nice-to-have    You have initial experience in the cloud such as GCP or AWS, ideally with Terraform. You have first experiences in frameworks like Spring Boot.    Benefits For You    Our tech stack is state of the art and you have the opportunity to actively shape it. An appreciative working environment, expert know-how and numerous opportunities for your professional and personal development - all this distinguishes us! Flexible working hours, working time recording as well as the possibilities for mobile working and flexitime - you shape your working day. Become part of our culture, discover something new every day and get to know a working world with even more benefits for you!

Title: Software Engineer - Leipzig, Germany
Description: Software Engineer is required for a European leading computer software company based in Leipzig,   Germany. My client is one of the world’s leading providers of telematics solutions for fleet   management, vehicle telematics and connected car services. Their software engineers design for   quality and reuse, componentization, resilience, and multithreading, and at the same time you   should be hands-on and able to dive deep into any kind of problem that comes your way.   Responsibilities   Create solution designs and deliver complete sets of functionalities from back-end to front-    end; the key technical focus of the role will be more on the back end but depending on   Project Requirements You Also Step Into Other Technical Areas.   Work in a technically complex and sensitive environment, which will require you to build    relevant functional knowledge about the products, technical knowledge about the   platform’s stack and architecture.   Keep a keen eye on application performance, operability, robustness, monitoring and failure    resilience, data privacy and the security of individual services and the whole system.   Agree on the technical implementation with involved component owners and estimate its    work effort   Implement, test, and demonstrate new product features in an agile process Develop complete sets of functionalities including the back end and user interface    Requirements  You will get in contact with a range of different technologies, starting from Java, Spring, Spring Boot,   Hibernate and Kafka in the backend, up to relational, non-relational and in memory data bases. But   don’t worry if you are not experienced in all of them. Your passion for software development and   willingness to learn is much more important!   If you are interested in taking over frontend tasks as well, you are welcome to do so as part of a   cross-functional team. Their frontend stack includes HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, React, Redux and   SASS.   What can you expect   The chance to work in a fast moving, innovative and international team, dealing with different   countries and cultures.   Decisive actions. They don’t like to wait. It’s in their DNA to move forward. So, it only makes sense   that they don’t jam the company with lots of layers. They make things happen. Quickly   This is and exciting opportunity for a Software Engineer to join a European leading computer   software company based in Germany. Please apply with your CV if interested.

Title: Software Engineer PHP
Description: Role/Department Description:  The successful candidate will be responsible for the technical design and implementation in the middleware of a web application for a large German client in the financial industry. You will also support our team in the maintenance and further development of the customer application and solution.   We use modern software development tools and principles as well as cloud-hosted environments.   Solution-oriented engineering based on market standards and teamwork in a professional environment are a matter of course for us.   Responsibilities:   Design and development of new components for the middleware based on PHP Leading and participating in the creation and maintenance of software and architecture designs for customer solutions Preparation of cost estimates for customer-specific solutions Technical specification and documentation Ensuring compliance with development and quality standards    Required Skills:   Academic education in the field of computer science or comparable education At least 2 years professional experience Knowledge of PHP 7.4/8 Knowledge of Symfony Framework Database knowledge (Postgresql preferable) Knowledge of Github, Github Actions and Sonarqube preferable REST API knowledge preferable Nginx (Server Configuration, Buildpacks) preferable Heroku preferable Experience with Docker and WSL2 desirable German and English language skills are mandatory

Title: System Engineer
Description: OVERALL PURPOSE OF ROLE  To take care of cable systems design and engineering. This includes the definition of technical solutions, in compliance with Customer requirements and with environment/ambient constraints and their optimization from both competitiveness and feasibility point of view. Activities involve the production of technical documentation for Customer and specifications for internal or sub-contractor’s use.    Key Duties & Responsibilities    Preparation of technical documentation for Customer and specifications for internal or sub-contractor’s use. Participation to meetings with Customers’ representatives at all stages of the enquiry and contract to ensure compliance with Customers’ requirements, and Customer’s satisfaction Production of detailed costing of all materials and services and production of the technical content to be submitted to Customers. Support in the preparation of formal documentation and design information for the manufacture of cable, accessories, and for cable installation activities. Occasionally, work on details of specific aspects which are typically not completely defined at offer stage e.g. design of special parts, definition/coordination of qualification testing, design of prototypes, etc. This part includes the optimization of cable and system design, to reduce project costs. Participation to technical presentations to Customers, to technical conferences, seminars and workshops. Development of new calculation procedures and computer methods for determining product and system technical proposals and ensure that all calculation and working procedures comply with the necessary technical and quality standards and procedures.    Minimum Qualifications    QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE   Master Degree in Electrical Engineering (Thermal or Mechanical as second options) Full proficiency in both written and spoken English and German    Minimum Experience    2year specific experience in HVDC cable business. Experience in design and engineering of High Voltage cables and systems and basic knowledge of the cable installation process. Knowledge of design calculation methods and computer solutions and ability to develop and improve these through mathematics and computer programming (preference for knowledge of calculation tools based on Finite Elements Method) Detailed understanding of relevant national and international standards Ability to combine technical knowledge with communications and liaisons skills, both internally and with Customers representatives (both technical and commercial)   Prysmian Group, as an Equal Opportunity Employer, aims to attract and recruit individuals with diverse backgrounds, skills and abilities, who will enhance the quality of service and contribute to the Group’s success. Prysmian Group is committed to the development of an organization that prioritizes talent, where people feel respected, appreciated and free to fully express their human potential. Prysmian Group strongly believes that diversity drives meritocracy and brings significant value at all levels of the organization, increases the possibility of capturing market opportunities and maximizing value for our customers and shareholders. Prysmian Group bases its decisions on principles of equality, with evaluations based on the type of position and with a focus on best practices so individuals succeed based on their efforts and skills and their alignment with applicable job requirements.Line Managers, Hiring Managers, HR Corporate and HR Local are responsible for ensuring that diversity and inclusion are respected during the recruiting process. Unconscious bias and stereotypes must not influence our selection processes. We look for the best candidates and for the real value they can bring into the organization. We value meritocracy. We value diversity. We turn off our bias. All persons shall have the opportunity to be considered for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, military service and veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. Prysmian will endeavor to make a reasonable accommodation to the known physical or mental limitations of a qualified applicant with a disability unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.  Your application data will be treated according to our Data Protection Policy. If you believe you require assistance to complete this form or to participate in an interview, please let us know.

Title: Data Engineer* / Data Scientist* Digitalisierung im Produktionsumfeld
Description: Das sind wir: Zusammen arbeiten, zusammen wachsen, zusammen Neues schaffen: EDAG verbindet Mensch und Zukunft – hier teilen Unternehmen und Mitarbeiter die gleiche Vision. Auf hohem Niveau gehen Sie bei uns Ihren eigenen Karriereweg, national oder international.   Mit Innovationskraft und starker Expertise meistert unser Bereich Production Solutions anspruchsvolle Herausforderungen im Engineering-Umfeld. Nehmen Sie die Zukunft der Mobilität in Ihre Hände und verstärken Sie unser Team.   Data Engineer* / Data Scientist* Digitalisierung im Produktionsumfeld   Daran werden Sie wachsen:   Wir bieten Ihnen spannende und vielseitige Projekte im Bereich Data Science und Machine Learning im produktionsnahen Umfeld Sie erstellen, analysieren und verifizieren Datenpipelines und verantworten deren Qualität Dabei bringen Sie Ihre Erfahrung in Big Data-Architekturen sowie Cloud-Systemen ein Sie nutzen hierfür gängige Methoden im Bereich Analytics und Machine Learning sowie aktuelle Software-Entwicklungsmethoden, um die Prozesse voranzutreiben    Damit bringen Sie uns voran:   Erfolgreich abgeschlossener Hochschulabschluss im Bereich (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Data Analytics oder vergleichbar sowie mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in agilen Projekten, idealerweise in der Produktion oder im produktionsnahen Umfeld Fundierte Kenntnisse in objektorientierten Programmiersprachen wie JAVA, C#, Phyton, R, Kafka oder SQL-Datenbanken Data Science Kenntnisse und Anwendungserfahrung bestimmter Techniken aus der Statistik und Modellierung unter Verwendung großer Datenmengen sowie der Darstellung mithilfe von Visualisierungsoftwares wie Tableau, Power BI, Qlik o.ä. Kenntnisse im Bereich Forecast, Optimierung, predictive maintenance, anomaly detection oder image und object-recognition sind wünschenswert Idealerweise Erfahrungen in weiteren Technologien wie: Clouddiensten (AWS und Azure), Kubernetes, Docker, Kafka, HIVE, Hadoop oder Kibana, Spark, Jupyter oder TensorFlow Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift. Geschlecht, Alter, Nationalität und Religion sind für uns nicht relevant – was zählt, sind Sie.    Jetzt bewerben!   Kontakt:   Rebecca Kapfer   +49 (661) 6000-25051   Benefits:  Weiterentwicklung   Mobiles Arbeiten*   Ticket Plus Karte   Gesundheitsmanagement   Flexible Arbeitszeiten   Betriebliche Altersvorsorge   Diese Benefits sind abhängig von der jeweiligen Tätigkeit, dem Standort oder der Infrastruktur.    weitere Benefits   Das klingt nach Ihrer nächsten Herausforderung? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!   Jetzt bewerben!   Bei Fragen können Sie sich jederzeit gerne telefonisch bei uns melden. Wir weisen Sie darauf hin, dass der E-Mail-Kanal nicht verschlüsselt ist. Daher bitten wir Sie, uns keine personenbezogenen Daten per Mail zu schicken.

Title: Junior Cloud Software Engineer | GCP, Java, Spring | Team Beluga (f/m/d)
Description: Unternehmenstext  The Beluga logistics team ensures that furniture and other large items offered on the OTTO marketplace are delivered to the required location and assembled on request, for example. On the way to the OTTO platform, we are redefining the IT processing of forwarded goods in a Greenfield approach. As OTTO is the largest online furniture retailer on the German market, we have a lot to do and are therefore looking for reinforcement for our cross-functional team. If you enjoy IT project and product management in a team with many nice and humorous colleagues and an agile way of working is important to you, then we are the right place for you.   Our team consists of a product owner, an agile master, three analysts and eight software developers, four of whom are based in India. Our team language is English.    Our Tech Stack    GCP | Java | GITHub Action | Springboot | Python | IntelliJ | Splunk | Terraform | Docker | Asynchronous Microservices    What To Expect    You will work in two-week sprints in an international team. You will design and develop high quality software in pair or mob according to TDD and with CD you will bring your changes live on a daily basis. You work closely with the business analysts and the product owner to bring in the technical perspective at an early stage.   You're not sure if the position suits you? - We will be happy to put you in touch with Nidal Osman from the technical department. Would you like to experience your future team and your workplace live? - As part of your application process, you will have the opportunity to do so at a later date.   Your profile   Must-have    You have experience in development, preferably in Java. You are inquisitive and open to learning or exploring new things. You know Scrum and Kanban not only from the textbook - you bring a distinct agile mindset. You have already gained initial experience with GIT. You have a good command of written and spoken English.    Nice-to-have    You have experience with AWS or GCP, ideally with Terraform. You are familiar with Python.    Benefits For You    Our tech stack is state of the art and you have the opportunity to actively shape it. An appreciative working environment, expert know-how as well as numerous opportunities for your professional and personal development - all this distinguishes us! Flexible working hours, working time recording as well as opportunities for mobile working and flexitime - you shape your working day. Become part of our culture, discover something new every day and get to know a working world with even more benefits for you!

Title: Junior Quantum Computing Software Engineer (all genders)
Description: In Accentures Technology Innovation Quantum Computing Group schlagen wir in Leuchtturmprojekten die Brücke von der Wissenschaft zur Anwendung -- gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden und Partnern.   Du möchtest in Europa und darüber hinaus mit uns und unseren Partnern aus Forschung und den Quantum-Technolgien an konkreten Quantum Computing-Lösungen für unsere Kunden arbeiten? Du kannst Dir vorstellen, Dich in führende Konsortien einzubringen? Du möchtest Deine Leidenschaft für die Implementierung komplexer Systeme mit Deinem Interesse an modernster Technologie kombinieren? Du möchtest das Team verstärken, dass u.a. die globale BMW und Amazon Quantum Computing Challenge 2021 (im Use Case „Sensor Positioning“) gewonnen hat?   Dann werde Teil unseres jungen Teams aus Betriebs-/Wirtschaftswissenschaftlern, Physikern, Informatikern und Ingenieuren und leiste deinen Beitrag zur Verbreitung und Verwertung der Quantentechnologien.   Das erwartet Dich  Du setzt Geschäftssinn, Begeisterung und Dein Verständnis für neue (Quantum-) Informationstechnologien ein, um unsere Kunden auf ihrem Weg zum erfolgreichen Anwender von Quantentechnologien zu unterstützen.  Du erweiterst Deine Implementierungskenntnisse in den Bereichen des Maschinellen Lernens und besonders des Quantum Computings, um so modernste Technologie und praktischen Nutzen für unseren Kunden zu verbinden.  Du erweiterst Deine Kenntnisse im Bereich Quantencomputer, -sensorik, -kommunikation, sowie Post-Quanten-Kryptographie, um gemeinsam mit unseren Experten Pionierarbeit in diesem Bereich der Beratung zu leisten.  Als zuverlässiger Ratgeber und Botschafter identifizierst du mit unseren Kundenaccountteams Industrie- und Kundenbedarfe, evaluierst Umsetzbarkeit und Wertversprechen der Technologien für unternehmensrelevante Anwendungsfälle und unterstützt uns wichtige Erkenntnisse einem breiten Anwender und Expertenpublikum zu vermitteln.  Du erweiterst dein Netzwerk und unterstützt den Ausbau unserer Partnerschaften mit Technologieanbietern, Start-ups und Forschungseinrichtungen, um in Konsortien und Verbänden die digitale Souveränität in Quantentechnologien auszubauen.  Darauf freuen wir uns  Aus Deinem MINT Hintergund (Master, Universität, z.B. Informatik) bringst Du solide akademische Kenntnisse mit, wünschenswerterweise im Bereich der Programmierung und klassischen Algorithmik, sowie den mathematischen Grundlagen (Lineare Algebra, Analysis, Stochastik), idealerweise zusätzlich aus der Komplexitätstheorie und den Anwendungsbereichen der Künstlichen Intelligenz, des Maschinellen Lernens oder der Datenwissenschaft. Ergänzenderweise verfügst Du über praktische Erfahrungen im Software Development / Engineering (z.B. Python, DevOps, Cloud), im Maschinellen Lernen (z.B. PyTorch, Tensorflow) und idealerweise bereits in Quanten-Frameworks (z.B. Qiskit, Cirq, PennyLane, Tensorflow Quantum).  Erste Projekterfahrungen aus der Softwareentwicklung ermöglichen Dir bereits, Dich unter Anleitung und in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Technologieexperten aktiv in die Erstellung von Proof-of-Concept und produktiven Lösungen einzubringen.  Du teilst unsere Lernbereitschaft und Begeisterung für Quantentechnologien (Quantencomputer, -sensorik, -kommunikation) oder Post-Quanten-Kryptographie und traust Dir zu, Dich (unter Anleitung) in wissenschaftliche Literatur einzuarbeiten.  Mit Deinem unternehmerischem, kommunikativem Charakter überzeugst Du mit unserem Expertenteam in Kundengesprächen vor Ort und auf Business-Veranstaltungen  Deine Vorteile in der Technology Innovation Quantum Computing Group von Accenture  Du als Mensch bist uns wichtig. Das wirst du täglich spüren und erleben, denn unsere Arbeitswelt ist auf dich ausgerichtet. Freu dich auf   die Möglichkeit, täglich technologische Pionierarbeit leisten zu können  die Begleitung durch erfahrene Mentor:innen und Coaches  Top-Teamevents  den Zugriff auf den Wissens- und Erfahrungsschatz im globalen Accenture-Netzwerk  Die immerwährende Möglichkeit, sich weiterzubilden und voranzukommen  die attraktiven Benefits eines großen, verantwortungsvollen Arbeitgebers  flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Homeoffice  Als Teil von Accenture, dem weltweit tätigen Management- und Technologieberatungsunternehmen, haben wir Zugriff auf das grenzenlose Know-how und die Erfahrungswerte von über 620.000 Mitarbeitenden in mehr als 120 Ländern. Vielfältige Persönlichkeiten, die täglich Technologie und menschliche Kreativität miteinander verbinden und so den digitalen Wandel gestalten. Gerne mit dir!   Dein Kontakt  Du hast Fragen? Dann wende dich an unser Recruiting Team per E-Mail an recruiting.germany.accenture.com oder telefonisch unter 00800 45045045. Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung über unser Online-Formular.

Title: Remote SQL Big Data Developer (eCommerce) (m/f/d)
Description: The company Trading EU, based in Bockhorn near Erding, is an owner-managed, medium-sized and globally active eCommerce company with attached warehouse and logistics centre, which has been in existence since 2005.   As a specialist supplier of high-quality industrial products, consumables and operating materials, we see ourselves as a reliable partner for lifting and pulling technology, labels as well as monitor and TV mounts.   We offer our commercial as well as private customers well-founded technical know-how, highest quality and quality standards, uncomplicated and fast order processing as well as an exemplary understanding for service and consulting.   As our company is constantly growing, we are looking for enthusiastic and motivated new employees who will contribute with an innovative spirit to accompany this process and continue to offer our partners the high quality of service they are used to.   Tasks  We are constantly growing and so are the amounts of data in our company: facing this challenge, we want to gradually open up new ways of processing and analyzing all data streams.   Are you looking for a role as Data Engineer to support our successful journey? We want to meet you!   Who are we?   "Lift and move" - that is our mission: we are a young and owner-managed eCommerce company fully dedicated to transportation and warehousing products. Our Business Intelligence team currently consists of two colleagues who process, prepare, analyze and transform data into relevant information - mainly using MS SQL and visualizing it in Tableau. All our teams are committed to a mindset that is characterized by continuous learning and are hungry for new ideas and personal development. Our shared corporate values "Own it - Do it - Stay hungry - Take part" are no empty words - we do live them!    Your Responsibilities    You are responsible for setting up data import processes and turning vast amounts of data into insightful and easy-to-use reports with continuous high quality of our data. This contains: Development, design and optimization of data models Automation of data interfaces Implementation of data pipelines to transfer to a data warehouse You identify and resolve bottlenecks in existing data pipelines and SQL queries to improve performance and reduce processing delays You work closely with our Data Analyst, who will provide you with data from the Product Services, Marketplaces and Shop teams and hand it to you in an analyzed and cleansed formThe continuous optimization of our system and data performance are as much part of your daily tasks as the improvement of the data infrastructure. Still with us? Great! If you can imagine yourself doing all this in a challenging environment with a hands-on mentality, you might just be the one who’s right for a key role in the heart of our company.    Requirements    You have a degree with a focus on computer science, business informatics, data engineering, data analytics or a comparable qualification You have at least three years of professional experience as a data engineer with focus on business intelligence/analytics, data analytics and (cloud) data warehousing You already have practical experience and sound knowledge in the following areas: Building and operating data pipelines/Big Data frameworks and using relevant tools and concepts in this area Software development in one or more modern programming and scripting languages (especially SQL, Python) You’re fluent in English, German language skills are a plus. An essential requirement, however, is to work within the same time zone (CET +/- two hours).    Benefits    WHY US?   We are big fans of good communication and a good team spirit. Regular feedback sessions are therefore important to us. Remote work is possible. But that doesn't mean you're on your own. Regular dailies and communication tools make sure to always be in contact with your team. Work in an agile and dynamic work environment with SCRUM A collaborative and supportive team. No one's an island - we're all here to help each other when we need to. Hopefully, we can teach you some stuff and we're excited to find out what you can teach us too.   Does that sound like an opportunity you don’t want to miss? We are very looking forward to receiving your CV and motivation letter!

Title: Database Reliability Engineer
Description: A Brief Overview Of The Storage Hub Team    Our main mission is to power PayFit’s growth by providing a trusted platform (reliable and efficient) allowing event-sourcing thanks to an event-store and a data bus, the future standard of PayFit.   This involves building core tools used throughout the whole engineering organization and collaborating closely with teams to take the best out of the platform.   💡 The team's top priority is focused on enabling the different teams of payfit to consume this platform in self-service so that they can focus on the business aspects.   💡 The team is also responsible for providing services that increase security, reliability, data ownership, ease of use, scalability, and many other aspects of data usage at Payfit.    A Brief Overview Of Our Day-to-day Stack    Technical stack: Node.js , TypeScript, Golang, Python, React, AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, SAM, CloudFormation, Helm, Dynamodb, serverless, … Code collaboration: GitHub, CircleCI Project management and knowledge: JIRA, Notion, Whimsical, Miro, Google Docs Communication: Slack, Zoom   What will be your role?  Get onboard of the PayFit rocket by joining our Storage Hub team as a Database Reliability Engineer.   Your mission will be to contribute to build this platform and scale our technical vision up while always bringing more value to our product.    You Will Be Responsible For    Making technical and functional choices. Help us build a stable, scalable, easy-to-use platform for our developers. Ensuring data security, governance and reliability, Accompany the future users of this platform in order to guarantee maximum ease of use, to help them implement their project on it and to pass on the message of data know-how. Be the referent of the Storage-Hub infrastructure and its deployment on AWS after the team and external requesters Be in constant contact with the future users of this platform to ensure maximum ease of use, and you will have an interest in Architecture, be familiar with Event-Sourcing and understand the capabilities, advantages and disadvantages of this type of architecture. Mentoring fellow engineers   This job has been tailored for you if you have the following qualities   You have a solid understanding of Kubernetes and AWS (SAM, Cloudformation, …) or want to learn more about it. You love automating infrastructure and workloads deployments. You enjoy sharing and collaborating with other teams to promote best practices and build reliable and resilient services.    We Would Be Even More Impressed If You Have    You are experienced designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting distributed systems You have a systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with strong communication skills and a sense of ownership and drive You master kafka in an event-sourcing context (distributed PubSub messaging, Replay, KSQL, ...)   Hiring process  1️⃣ HR Telephone interview - 30 minutes   2️⃣ Meet Stephen, Team Leader: (Introductions to the project, Systems Design Interview) - 1 hour   3️⃣ Meet Platform Team: Technical interview (introductions, coding, questions) - 45 minutes   4️⃣ Meet Future Colleagues: Formal interview (introductions, questions) - 45 minutes   5️⃣ Meet Damian, Tribe Director - 30 minutes   6️⃣ Background check to verify your identity, diploma and past professional experience in the context of your ISO27001 certification

Title: System Engineer (m/f/d) for next gen predictive safety functions
Description: YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES   Development of software systems and functions for driver assistance systems and automated driving Derive/create system requirements from concepts and customer requirements Functional application and validation in virtual environments and vehicles Professionally coordinate technical topics Coordination with internal and external partners and customers    YOUR PROFILE   Academic degree in engineering or comparable qualification First experience with software or in requirements management desired Good team and communication skills, as well as confident appearance in German and English Experience with common development tools e.g. DOORS, Codebeamer, CANoe/CANape, Matlab/Simulink or CarMaker, as well as knowledge of development processes according to automotive SPICE are an advantage Experience with agile development methodology is an advantage Driving licence category B    Interested in becoming a member of our team? Then send us your application (resume and other supporting documents) along with the reference code and indicate your salary preferences and earliest possible start date.    We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: System Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: As a system engineer (m/f/d), you will support the entire life cycle of coordinated Viessmann customer solutions. You will work closely with the respective product owners, developers, testers and other internal and external customers. Together in the team, your goal is not only to fulfill the wishes and requirements of our customers but to exceed them.   Your impact   Developing concepts for efficient and custom-fit customer solutions consisting of the efficient combination of different products such as heat pumps, electricity storage, ventilation and digital tools Gathering requirements and the architecture of balanced customer solutions in coordination with the product managers involved Planning and documentation of the compatibilities between the products to be combined Checking existing requirements for their reusability, so that the variance can be kept low and uniform functions can be guaranteed for our customers.     Who You Are    You have developed skills in proactively communicating with various departments and customers and are willing to take ownership. You also bring the following:   Completed studies in engineering, IT or similar. Initial professional experience in a technical environment (development/methods/processes) is desirable - ideally in the area of heating, air conditioning and energy solutions Experience in the area of system engineering processes (system requirements management or system architectural design) is advantageous, e.g. with Polarion Good German and English skills    Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press "Apply" anyway. We love your spirit!    What Makes Us Special    Our employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, we've created a range of perks for our employees, or as we like to call them, Viessmann family members:   You can expect a permanent position in a successful family business where new technologies meet a modern workplace culture. Our flexible working hours allow you to balance work and private life. Christmas bonus and vacation pay? Of course, and even more than legally required! At Viessmann, you get 30 days of paid vacation per year. Enjoy our great best-in-class discounts on selected Viessmann products and services. In our employee restaurant, we offer you a selection of healthy and affordable meals, prepared from regional foods. Free e-charging station - Because we believe about the environment and about you. Whether with Job Bike, Sixt or Europcar - our partnerships protect the environment and your wallet at the same time.     Who We Are    With more than 12,000 employees in 74 countries and a turnover of over 2 billion euros, Viessmann is a leading manufacturer of air conditioning and energy solutions. Through our energy-efficient products, we are helping to solve one of the greatest challenges of our time: the generation of sustainable energy. Viessmann is setting the best example here: we have reduced our CO₂ consumption by 70% at our headquarters in Allendorf since 2005, while doubling our efficiency. But how do we manage all this? Together with our employees, partners and customers. Every voice is important in continuously driving our innovative strength. And we thrive on the dedicated commitment of our teams to work together toward our goal: Creating living spaces for generations to come.   We look forward to hearing from you!
