Title: IT System Engineer (m/w/d) Microsoft Exchange
Description: Sie sind auf der Suche nach einem attraktiven Projektumfeld, in einem schnell wachsenden Team aus regional verwurzelten Wissensträger*innen und Expert*innen in verschiedensten Fachgebieten? Sie setzen gerne Ihr Wissen in der Planung und Administration von Exchange Lösungen ein? Design und Sizing gehört für Sie genauso dazu, wie das praktische Hands-On am System?   Dann bewerben Sie sich bei uns! Wir bieten Ihnen die Chance zur Ihrer ganz persönlichen Karriereentwicklung bei einem der weltweit führenden IT-Dienstleister.   CGI sucht Sie als IT System Engineer (m/w/d), Schwerpunkt MS Exchange, der als Teil eines Teams für die Bereitstellung von Mail-Services im Umfeld öffentlicher Auftraggeber agiert. Sie werden für die Konzeption, Planung und Implementierung von Hochverfügbarkeitsservern für E-Mail, Instant Messaging, Voicemail und anderen Kommunikationssystemen zuständig sein. Dabei führen Sie regelmäßige Hardware- und Software-Updates durch und bieten Fehlerbehebung sowie technischen Support für Workstations und Anwendungen. Sie pflegen und unterstützen die Exchange Server-Infrastruktur unserer Kunden und arbeiten an Architekturen für Projekte, die diese Services umsetzen.   Aufgaben   Installation und Konzeption von neuen Exchange Server Umgebungen Beratung der Fach- und Führungskräfte als technische*r Ansprechpartner*in Bearbeitung von Incidents sowie Service Requests Analyse und Behebung von komplexen Störungen Proaktive Überwachung der Microsoft Exchange Server Umgebungen Anpassung von Systemkonfigurationen auf Basis von Changes und Erstellung entsprechender Dokumentationen    Qualifikation   Sie verfügen über eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung als Fachinformatiker oder über ein Studium im Bereich der Informatik und haben mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Systemadministrator im Kontext MS Exchange.   Darüber hinaus zählen zu Ihren Kompetenzen:   DNS Administration Active Directory Konzeption und Umsetzung Sehr sicherer Umgang mit PowerShell (Exchange Management Shell) MCSE Messaging / Productivity (min. 2013) MCSA Windows Server (mind. 2012) Umsetzungskonsequenz, Eigeninitiative und Kundenorientierung Eine selbstständige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise    Sollten Sie zusätzlich über folgende Kenntnisse verfügen, so wäre dies von Vorteil:   3rd Party Solutions im Messaging Umfeld Konzeption und Umsetzung von Certificate Authority (Internal/External)    Außer dem fachlichen Know-how zeichnet Sie soziale Kompetenz aus. Sie sind fähig, aktiv zuzuhören und Kundenanforderungen fundiert zu analysieren. Ein überzeugendes Auftreten, Spaß an teamorientiertem Arbeiten sowie geistige Flexibilität zeichnen Sie aus.   WAS WIR BIETEN   Bei uns finden Sie Kolleg*innen, mit denen die Zusammenarbeit Spaß macht. Wir begegnen uns offen, duzen uns über alle Positionen hinweg und denken nicht in Hierarchien oder Silos. Dank unseres „Metro Market“-Modells können Sie meist dort arbeiten, wo Sie leben. Sie profitieren von flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und haben je nach Kundensituation die Möglichkeit, von zuhause zu arbeiten. Einen Teil Ihres Bruttogehalts können Sie in CGI-Aktien investieren – bis maximal 3 % des Monatsgehalts geben wir für jeden Euro einen weiteren hinzu. Außerdem beteiligen wir Sie am Unternehmenserfolg: Sie erhalten eine Gewinnbeteiligung, die sich nach deiner individuellen Leistung richtet sowie danach, wie wir als Unternehmen unsere finanziellen Ziele erreichen konnten. Wir bieten verschiedene Modelle, damit Sie mobil sein können: z. B. Bahncard, Dienstfahrrad Sabbatical oder Elternzeit werden unterstützt. Sie sind bei uns kein Karriere-Stopper! Wir unterstützen Sie, auch wenn es einmal nicht so gut läuft: Sie können Sonderurlaub nehmen, und unsere Beratungshotline steht Ihnen mit Rat und Tat zur Seite. Eine Vielzahl an Events und Freizeitaktivitäten stärkt Ihre Verbundenheit mit Ihren Kolleg*innen.    Insights you can act on  Der Motor für die digitale Transformation unserer Kunden ist die Technologie – der Antrieb für den Erfolg unseres Unternehmens sind die Menschen.   Als Berater:in bei CGI genießt du das Vertrauen deiner Kolleg:innen und Kunden. In der Zusammenarbeit gewinnst du Erkenntnisse, die zu wertvollen und nachhaltigen Lösungen führen. Unsere Mitarbeitenden heißen „Member“, weil sie am Erfolg beteiligt werden und gemeinsam ein Unternehmen gestalten, auf das wir alle stolz sind. Diesen Traum haben wir seit 1976, und er hat uns dorthin geführt, wo wir heute stehen: Wir sind einer der weltgrößten unabhängigen Dienstleister für IT und Business Consulting.   Bei CGI erkennen wir den Mehrwert von Vielfalt. Wir wollen ein Arbeitsumfeld schaffen, dem sich alle zugehörig fühlen, und fördern zusammen mit unseren Kunden die Inklusion. Bei uns haben alle die gleichen Chancen, erfolgreich zu sein und sich weiterzuentwickeln. Solltest du im Recruiting-Prozess Unterstützung benötigen, sind wir für dich da.   Bist du bereit, Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte zu werden? Komm zu CGI – wo du mit deinen Ideen und deinem Engagement etwas bewirkst.

Title: Software Engineer / Full Stack Developer (m/f/d) PHP
Description: Location Ihringen, Germany   THE HELLA GUTMANN PROMISE  Curiosity is our driving force. We do know and understand the vehicle like no other. Our vast store of knowledge is neither limited to brands and models nor to technology. We are interconnecting this knowledge intelligently so that our customers worldwide are able to use it in combination with practicable products and services.   Our main product range features professional equipment for automotive workshops, car dealerships and automotive testing agencies. With about 500 employees and our head office in Ihringen near Freiburg im Breisgau we belong to the Hella Gutmann Group which is a corporation of the HELLA KGaA Hueck & Co.   Hella Gutmann is the birthplace of a whole host of good ideas that bring that little bit of extra success to vehicle workshops across the globe every single day. Getting this innovative strength on the road requires a strong team – and you can be part of it. Find out more about us and fast-track your career with Hella Gutmann.   DEMONSTRATE YOUR POTENTIAL AND JOIN US TO SHAPE THE FUTURE OF THE DIGITAL WORKSHOP   You will develop and design web applications and micro services for our workshop products You will conduct feasibility studies using the latest technologies and create concepts and architectures for sophisticated web projects You will be part of an interdisciplinary team made up of IT specialists, embedded and web developers as well as data mining specialists You will roll out your work in on-premises systems and cloud environments using container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes You will ensure the quality and functionality of the software components using unit tests and integration tests You will actively contribute to requirements management and will take over the technical management of subprojects   THE REASONS WHY YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT FOR OUR COMPANY   You have several years of work experience in software and web development You integrate your practical experience in the field of software architecture into your everyday work You have experience of working with micro services concepts as well as their distribution and operation in on-premises systems and cloud environments You have outstanding PHP knowledge, ideally in combination with the Symfony Framework You are experienced in working with relational and document-based databases Your command of German and English is excellent and you are happy to work with experts and teams at different locations Your profile is rounded off with a knowledge of requirements management and Node.js.   WHAT WE ARE OFFERING TO MAKE YOUR EVERYDAY WORK EVEN MORE ENJOYABLE   Interesting tasks, innovative products and great colleagues An open and cooperative business culture with direct and friendly communication and cooperation Attractive remuneration in a company subject to a collective agreement, along with holiday pay and a Christmas bonus A safe workplace in a continuously growing company Development measures and further education that is tailored to you personally Modern infrastructure at the workplace A modern company restaurant - subsidized by our company Company pension scheme with subsidy "Fit with HGS": Free fruit and water, running events "Eldercare": care program for relatives The option to charge your electric vehicle for free during working hours An attractive location where the borders of three countries meet with good connection to public transport network Employee discounts and much more   Take the opportunity to reveal your potential within a global, family-run company that offers you the best possible conditions for progressing in your career.   HELLA Gutmann Solutions GmbH  Arkadius Birkner   Am Krebsbach 2   79241 Ihringen   +49 (0) 7668/9900-1995

Title: Software Engineer / Software Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Overview    As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker covers a broad spectrum of advanced solutions in all fields of research and development. All our systems and instruments are designed to improve safety of products, accelerate time-to-market and support industries in successfully enhancing quality of life. We’ve been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years now. Today, worldwide more than 7,200 employees are working on this permanent challenge, at over 70 locations on all continents.   the job holder has the responsibility to develop and maintain the Control Software that is used to collect data from our surface plasmon resonance (SPR) devices. The software processes images from an optical detector and communicates to several additional hardware components. It also allows to create and run batch jobs on those devices. You will work relatively independently in a small team that is located partially in Hamburg and partially in Santiago de Compostela.    Responsibilities    Maintenance and further development of the Control Software that is used to run our instruments Integrating a new device platform into our existing code base Developing a web client application to execute basic funcionalities of the Control Software using an API Supporting our technical service team Specifying software subcomponents and implementing them Writing unit tests Documenting your work Supporting customers and our technical service team in case of urgent problems    Qualifications    University degree or PhD (informatics, engineering disciplines, or natural science) Experience with hardware-related programming Some years experience in an object-oriented programming language. We mainly develop in C# using WPF and Windows Forms for the front end Nice to have: experience with any kind of web development You are enthusiastic not only about coding but also technology in general Logical and scientific thinking and a deep understanding of the idea of object oriented programming Interest in natural science. It is important to get a comprehensive understanding about what our instruments are used for in pharmaceutical research Good English skills since you will also work with colleagues in other countries

Title: Software Engineer (d/f/m)
Description: Job Description    A vacancy for a Software Engineer (d/f/m)  has arisen within Airbus Defence and Space in Manching  .   If you are looking for a challenging task in a development team at Airbus Defence and Space in Manching and if you are interested in systems & software design around military aircrafts, you’re welcomed to our department.   We develop and maintain Electronic Warfare Ground Support Systems for our Tornado, A400M and Eurofighter platforms at the Airbus-sites in Manching.   Our systems enable Electronic Warfare mission data preparation, provide the interfaces to the flying platforms, and support the evaluation of the mission or flight.    Your Main Tasks And Responsibilities Will Include     Analysis of the use cases and needs in close cooperation with the various stakeholders of system engineering team Definition and realization of software architectures and the ability to evaluate different architectural solutions and choose the best solution Understand user workflows and define SW and Graphical User Interface (GUI) solutions using specific technologies to support and enhance different steps throughout the mission data production. Design and implementation of mission data preparation and validation solutions with the support of state-of-the-art technologies such as Eclipse, OSGI and Java. Preparation and execution of software tests to satisfy the different levels of verification and validation Integration of activities in the Software Development Lifecycle Develop according to Software Development Plan and accompanied standards     We are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:     Bachelor degree in computer science or equivalent qualification Graduates and young professionals are welcome to apply Experience with Eclipse, OSGI and Java Good written and spoken German Good written and spoken English A proactive mindset and high teamwork Motivation for agile SW development processes and methods    Disabled applicants with equal qualifications will be given special consideration.    We Offer     Challenging tasks for/with unique services and products Pleasant working atmosphere in a professional and international work environment Exciting development opportunities and perspectives Extensive company training offers (eLearning and Classroom Trainings) Flexible working hours Compatibility of work and family life Attractive remuneration Company Pension Scheme Good connections to public transport and local parking facilities Catering facilities on site    This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.    Company    Airbus Defence and Space GmbH    Contract Type    Permanent Contract / CDI / Unbefristet / Contrato indefinido    Experience Level    Entry Level / Débutant / Anfänger / Recién titulado    Job Family    Software Engineering   By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.   Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.   Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.   At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: System Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Job description:   Within the S&A System Engineering group, your responsibilities as a System Engineer (m/f/d) would be:     Foster system approach for beyond powertrain topics (vehicle access systems, brake systems, weight monitoring, passenger monitoring and wellbeing, enhance interior HMI, …) Understand system drivers including legislation, security and safety requirements, OEM expectations, end consumer experience and system constraints Define system requirements and derive component requirements (performance, integration, target price) Define new use cases, identify USPs and added value of different S&A product Align and coordinate cross product line / cross BU development Support decision making for market approach Representing the customer interface, including the presentation Vitesco Technologies solutions at customers, highlight VT USPs, challenge customer requirements and promote VT strategy  Profile description:    Academic degree in mechanical, electrical engineering, natural science or similar Long-term work experience in System Engineering Several years of work experience in Requirements Engineering Knowledge in cyber security and safety is an asset Innovation driven, international mindset, team spirit Fluent English language skills (written and spoken) Willingness to travel around 10-20 percent internationally (Europe, NA, Asia)    Applications from severely handicapped people are welcome.  Karen Fieser

Title: Backend Developer (Python)
Description: The time is now to start your next career step at Process&, one of the most innovative global data science and tech companies.  At Processand, we are building a market  leading product  that defines the new category of Data Intelligence Platforms  (DIP).   We give data-driven & AI technologies  context and let them speak in a wholly new way based on our innovative intelligence graph technology,  which is powered by our in-house developed Real-Time  Parsing Engine  . The Processand Data Intelligence Platform can be placed right on top of any existing IT landscape to automatically extract, manage, and distribute critical data knowhow to data workers who need it the most. In addition, our Intelligence Graph is deeply integrated with a set of instruments and applications that help companies drastically increase efficiency in every facet of data engineering, from data transformation and documentation, to governance, and automations.   Our technology helps bring immediate value  to the biggest enterprises around the globe, and makes a direct impact  on how people work day-to-day. For Global 2000 companies, transforming to an intelligent enterprise has become a key strategic priority. Processand has many global customers including BMW, Swisscom, DB, Sabic, Eon, R+V, or Rational. All of them rely on Processand knowhow and technology to unlock their full analytics capacity and drive change to business processes.   Processand has grown massively in 4 years with over 200% in the past year. We are continuously expanding, especially in Europe, US and Asia, to be able to serve local markets. We have offices in Prague (Czech Republic), Austin (Texas), and Taipei (Taiwan) as Centers of Excellence for international tech talent. Our current headquarters are in Munich, Germany.   At each and every Processand office, we get things done quickly  by cultivating an open-minded culture with creative, collaborative, autonomous teams  in which the best ideas win. As part of Product & Engineering you will have the opportunity to grow  with a steep learning curve,  being equipped with responsibility  from day 1.   At Processand, we believe that every company can unlock their full data intelligence - and for that we need you as a Backend Engineer  .   Be ready to participate & join a multicultural family at Process&!  You are passionate about data analytics & developing web applications? Read on!  Tasks  As BE Engineer at Processand, you are responsible for optimizing & implementing existing product features  & winning our users through your brilliant applications. You will work with Python, SQL and various micro-services  creating innovative and intelligent data solutions. You will further work on our in-house developed components library that is being used by multiple teams & applications.   You will be working in a cross-functional team closely with our UX designer, Product Manager and Frontend Engineers. You will also get a chance to improve and share your skills among our backend guild.    Requirements    have 2+ years of experience in building Python applications professionally write clear, understandable and testable code with continuous focus on maintainability have strong algorithmic and problem-solving skills with a good understanding of complex data structures (optionally) have experience with graph theory and machine learning libraries such as Pytorch, Tensorflow or Scikit-learn show a high level of motivation and commitment have excellent English skills (German optional)    Benefits    Benefits (at) Process&:   A highly ambitious and skilled team of international talents Chance to become one of the first employees in a fast-growing venture-backed tech startup Opportunities to actively shape and accelerate your professional and personal development Very fast decision-making processes and flat hierarchies cutting-edge tech stack: Docker, Node.js, React+Redux, Redis, GraphQL, Cypress, Kafka, AWS/GCP/Azure and many more training from experts in the field of data science and intelligence applications Flexible working hours, work from home and a top-equipped workplace in the middle of Munich An attractive compensation package and multiple career development paths fresh fruit, drinks, water, and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) A multicultural, open-minded team with start-up spirit, company retreats & events   Processand is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.   Apply today! We are happy to receive your CV & application documents and learn more about you.

Title: System Engineer (all genders) Rechenzentrum IT-Betrieb
Description: Wir gehören zu den Top-Adressen in der IT-Welt und fokussieren uns auf die Optimierung der Kerngeschäftsprozesse unserer Kunden. Unseren Erfolg aber erreichen wir nur durch eins: die Menschen bei adesso! Lass dich von uns überzeugen. Vielfalt entdecken - unsere Zentralbereiche unterstützen aktiv das Wachstum von adesso. Als interne Dienstleister bieten sie dir zahlreiche Tätigkeitsfelder - egal ob Standortverwaltung im Back-Office, IT-Versorgung- und Betreuung im IT-Betrieb, kennzahlen- bzw. ergebnisorientierte Unternehmenssteuerung im Finanzbereich, das Finden, Binden und Entwickeln der richtigen Mitarbeitenden für adesso im Personalmanagement oder die aktive formale und inhaltliche Gestaltung von Kommunikationsmaßnahmen als Teil des Corporate Communications Teams. Unsere zentralen Bereiche bieten dir spannende Karrieremöglichkeiten und sind dein Chancengeber für einen Einstieg bei adesso.   DEINE ROLLE - DAS WARTET AUF DICH  Der Betrieb von Rechenzentren sowie Aufbau und Betrieb von Enterprise Servern und Storagesystemen ist dein zu Hause? Du suchst nach einem Arbeitsumfeld, in dem Teamwork zählt und du dich fachlich wie persönlich weiterentwickeln kannst? Dann bist du bei uns im Team Infrastructure & Facilities innerhalb des IT-Betriebs bei adesso genau richtig!   Wir sind zuständig für den Rechenzentrumsbetrieb, Netzwerkinfrastrukturen und den Geschäftsstellenbetrieb für mehr als 6.000 Mitarbeitende innerhalb der adesso Group und suchen Verstärkung. Du kannst uns nun ergänzen und betreust in Zukunft unsere Rechenzentrumsinfrastruktur in mehreren Rechenzentren und unterstützt Mitarbeitende somit bei dem Betrieb von über 2.000 virtuellen Maschinen. Mit deinem Fachwissen stellst du nicht nur den Betrieb, sondern auch die Weiterentwicklung unserer Systeme sicher, dokumentierst diese und stehst als fachliche Ansprechperson zur Verfügung.   Du bist dabei keineswegs auf dich alleine gestellt, sondern arbeitest zusammen mit uns, deinem Team, und kannst so auf die fachkundige Expertise weiterer Expertinnen und Experten zurückgreifen.   Innerhalb der adesso Group übernimmst du folgende Aufgaben:    Administration der zentralen und dezentralen Serverhardware, der SAN-Infrastruktur und der darauf betriebenen VMware-Umgebung Einrichtung und Überwachung des zentralen Monitorings sowie Analyse und Störungsbeseitigung bei Software- und Hardware-Problemen Entwicklung von Standardisierungen und Automatisierungsprozessen Kontinuierliche Aktualisierung und Erstellung von Betriebs-, Prozess- und Systemdokumentationen Fachliche Unterstützung zu diesen Themen im Rahmen eines 3rd-Level Supports    Wir wissen, dass sich diese Aufgaben nur mit offenem Erfahrungsaustausch, gegenseitiger Unterstützung, kontinuierlicher Weiterbildung und gut ausgestattet erfüllen lassen. Neben einer offenen Atmosphäre in flachen Hierarchien gehören regelmäßige Fort- und Weiterbildungen bei uns zur Firmenkultur. Auch ein aktueller Laptop und ein Smartphone warten ab Tag 1 auf dich.   Deine Skills - Das Bringst Du Mit   Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung im Bereich Informatik bzw. Studium der Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation Mindestens vier Jahre Berufserfahrung im Rechenzentrumsbetrieb mit folgenden Schwerpunkten: Aufbau und Betrieb von Enterprise Servern und Storagesystemen (z.B. der Hersteller Dell oder Huawei) Erfahrung in der physikalischen und logischen Anbindung von hochverfügbaren virtuellen Umgebungen (z.B. Glasfaserverkabelung, CWDM oder DWDM) Fundierte Kenntnisse in Virtualisierungssoftware (z.B. VMware vSphere) Erfahrungen mit Netzwerkinfrastrukturen im Rechenzentrumsbereich Strukturierte Analyse und Debugging im Rechenzentrumsumfeld Know-how in der Administration von Microsoft- und Linux-Betriebssystemen   Folgende Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil – aber kein „Must have“:    Betrieb hochverfügbarer Storagesysteme (z.B. Huawei HyperMetro) Erfahrungen mit Backuptechnologien (z.B. Veeam) Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen (z.B PowerShell, Python, Perl, Ansible)   Persönlich solltest Du folgendes bieten:    Sehr gute Ausdrucksweise in Wort und Schrift (deutsch, englisch) Engagement, Qualitätsbewusstsein, Hands-On Mentalität und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise Analytische Arbeitsweise zur Behebung von Störungen Team- und serviceorientierte Arbeitsweise sowie offenes und verbindliches Auftreten     CHANCENGEBER - WAS ADESSO AUSMACHT    Unser Versprechen: Du wirst dich bei uns wohlfühlen! Kollegial, familiär und auf Augenhöhe – wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das und viel mehr steht für unser ganz besonderes Wir-Gefühl. Für das es sogar ein Wort gibt: adessi. Denn wir sind alle adessi ab Tag Eins und bei uns bist du von Anfang an Teil des Teams. Unsere Kultur und das Zusammenarbeiten sind geprägt von gegenseitiger Wertschätzung, Anerkennung und Unterstützung. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So belegen wir zum wiederholten Mal den 1. Platz beim Wettbewerb „Deutschlands Beste Arbeitgeber in der ITK“!   Jeder und jedem adessi stehen alle Möglichkeiten zur persönlichen und beruflichen Entwicklung offen. Unser umfangreiches Trainings- und Weiterbildungsangebot sorgt dafür, dass deine Entwicklung bei uns nicht stillsteht. Denn Chancengeber zu sein, das liegt in unserer DNA.    Welcome Days - Zwei Tage zum Reinkommen und Netzwerken Bis zu drei Tage mobiles Arbeiten – keine Frage von Pandemien, sondern von Überzeugung Deine Entwicklung - über 260 Lern- und Trainingsthemen Choose your own device - freie Wahl deiner Arbeitswerkzeuge Events - fachlich und mit Spaßfaktor Hemden-/Blusenreinigung - zweimal die Woche frisch aufgebügelt Sportförderung - Zuschuss zum Fitnessstudio und mehr über qualitrain sowie Übernahme der Platzmiete für die Sporthalle adesso Mind - Das adesso-Programm rund um Mindfulness Prämien für Mitarbeitende - eine Vielzahl an Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement Auszeitprogramm - Raum für deine persönliche Lebensplanung    KONTAKT  /Du bist offen für neue und anspruchsvolle Aufgaben? Dann sende uns deine Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. deines CV, deiner Arbeits- und Studienzeugnisse sowie deiner Gehaltsvorstellungen und dem frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermin) vorzugsweise über unser Webformular.    Vanessa Speight Recruiting +49 231 7000-7100

Title: Library Software Engineer - C++
Description: About Datadog:   We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—providing always-on alerting, metrics visualization, logs, and application tracing for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way.   The Opportunity:   Datadog is building a world-class APM product that traces requests as they flow across complex systems. We are looking for an expert C++ developer who can help push our tracing tools to the next level. Come and join us to build amazing open source software.   You Will:   Write open source code that traces thousands of distributed applications written in C++ around the world Drive our open source C++ projects and engage with the community to find and address the most important challenges Join a great team building software the right way    Requirements:   You’re a master C++ programmer. You’ve written high-performance and concurrent applications, and know your way around modern C++ . You don’t reinvent the wheel but you prefer keeping your code concise and efficient You are a great community ambassador and can drive hard technical conversations towards a good solution You want to work in a fast, high growth startup environment You have a BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field    Bonus Points:   You have significant experience with Go, Python, Java, JavaScript, Ruby or PHP You have have experience with code telemetry and introspection You have experience with distributed systems    This is a remote position   Equal Opportunity at Datadog:  Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.   Your Privacy:  Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

Title: Software Engineer - Backend (d/f/m)
Description: At Stylight, we’re on a mission to build the world’s best search platform for Fashion, Beauty and Design. We're always looking for talent to join our engineering team, and help connect millions of users with their favorite products across 16 countries.  You’ll get to work with systems that handle thousands of requests per second, from custom analytics solutions to multi-regional search and ranking pipelines. We operate at a scale of billions of data points per month, which means you'll never run out of fun challenges waiting to be solved. Sounds exciting? Read on!     Your Responsibilities   Build, deploy, and monitor our live systems across four global regions. Implement, deploy and AB test new features for millions of website visitors. Foster technical excellence within the team, and contribute engineering best practices. Help us grow our engineering culture, from knowledge sharing sessions to hackathons.     Your Profile   At least 4 years of relevant experience in a software development role. Proficient with Python, Scala or Java. Willingness to learn new languages. Demonstrated experience with one or more of the following topics: Search Infrastructure, Distributed Systems, Machine Learning or Batch Processing (Terabyte-scale). Big plus: working knowledge of Docker, Elasticsearch, Kubernetes, Spark or BigQuery.     Our Tech Stack   Most of our services are written in either Python or Scala. We run our systems on AWS, and Google Cloud Platform. We use CircleCI to test, package, and deploy Docker containers to Kubernetes. We monitor our services with Datadog, Kibana, Sentry, Cloudwatch, and PagerDuty.     Your future team   We’re an international team with different backgrounds: Machine Learning, Data Science, Engineering. We love solving problems with a pragmatic approach - good enough is better than perfect. We work in two-week sprints, value autonomy, open communication and having few meetings. We love Slack. Besides sharing bad jokes and memes, it’s also where our alerts show up.     Why join Stylight?    📈 Shape the way Stylight grows!With 160m yearly shoppers in 16 countries and >1,500 shops we are the world's leading online search platform for Fashion, Beauty, and Design.   🌎 Worldwide vibes! Our team is made up of individuals from over 25 countries, who speak 41 languages, and represent many different backgrounds. You will be inspired by talented colleagues from around the world.   🤓 Curiosity is our compass!We support you in achieving your goals by providing you with an annual personal development budget and days as well as regular feedback sessions with your peers and manager.   🚀 Always one step ahead!Bi-monthly Innovation Days foster knowledge sharing throughout the whole company.   💻 Hybrid Working Model:Balance is the key to our success! Through a mix of office, remote and semi-remote opportunities, we give you the ability to manage your own work and personal life.   🤙 You are not alone!You will be assigned a buddy who will help you navigate through your first weeks of onboarding.   🍺 Prost, Cheers, Salute !We celebrate our success in every language!     ﻿Want to know more? Check out:about.stylight.com andblog.stylight.com.    Up for the challenge?  If you want to work in a fun, exciting, challenging and dedicated environment, then don't hesitate and apply today via https://about.stylight.com/jobs. We're looking forward to reading your complete application (cover letter, CV, references, certificates, GitHub profile) in English!

Title: Software Engineer Data Integration
Description: ESI Group is seeking an experienced software engineer to perform implementation, multiplication of expertise on PDM/PLM, and enterprise deployment within ESI teams.     Responsibilities include but are not limited to:    · Focus on the design, conceptualization, and implementation of service and integration architectures in the context of Digital Continuity for workflows, processes, and product data.  · Work closely together with product managers and fellow developers to build and integrate highly efficient service solutions in federation and interfacing of multi-vendor, multi-solution PLM / PDM environments with ESI’s portfolio of virtual engineering products.       Required Education, Experience, Skills    · Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.  · In-depth knowledge of data modeling, entity relation handling, and data management practices.  · Deep knowledge of PLM data handling (BOP/*BOM handling, data and process semantics).  · Expertise in interfacing with PDM/PLM systems for data exchange with other applications.  Fluent in English; German is a plus.

Title: Library Software Engineer - Ruby
Description: About Datadog:  We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way.   The Team:  The APM Team at Datadog provides mission critical application health and performance monitoring for customers of all sizes and industries. We’re taking a new approach to APM with distributed tracing and seamless integration with Datadog’s Infrastructure and Logs products.   The Opportunity:  We are looking for an expert Ruby engineer experienced with Ruby language internals who can help push our tracing tools to the next level. Come and join us to build amazing open source software!   You Will:   Write code that instruments thousands of Ruby applications around the world. You’ll help drive our open source Ruby projects and engage with the community to find and address the most important challenges. Join a great team building software the right way    You Are:   You’re a master Ruby programmer. You think in blocks, faced the GIL limitations many times and you know there is more to Ruby than Rails. You’ve written piles of clean, correct, well-tested, performant, idiomatic Ruby code. You are a great community ambassador and can drive hard technical conversations towards a good solution. You have solid experience with widely used frameworks and libraries like Rails, Sinatra, Grape, Sidekiq or ActiveRecord. You want to work in a fast, high growth startup environment. You have a BS/MS/PhD in a STEM field or equivalent experience.    Bonus Points:   You have experience with JRuby and how it works in the JVM. You’ve played with eventmachine. You have significant experience with Python, Go, Java, JavaScript or Ruby. You have experience with code telemetry and introspection.    This is a remote position   Equal Opportunity at Datadog:  Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.   Your Privacy:  Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

Title: Video Streaming: Software Engineer (Javascript / Node.JS) for API, frontend and backend development
Description: nanocosmos is hiring software developers!    Are you interested in working for a company that offers a cutting edge live streaming solution for global business customers? At nanocosmos our mission is to bridge the gap between presenters and audiences worldwide with our ultra-low-latency live streaming platform nanoStream Cloud, enabling real interaction and creating high quality video experiences. We are a creative team in Berlin, offering a unique live streaming platform with clients all over the world with a drive for continuous innovation and excellence.     Software Engineer (Javascript / Node.JS) for API, frontend and backend development  (permanent, full-time or part-time)    You will work with our web-based video tools, nanoStream Player, nanoMeet, Jitsi and others to design and implement live video-based communication and streaming applications.    This is a great opportunity to make a big impact on the design, architecture, and implementation of cutting edge products that are used every day, by people you know. The role is ideal for a passionate, dedicated, and talented Software Engineer who has experience building innovative, critical, high volume applications that are customer oriented.    Our main office is in Berlin, Germany. Remote work, full-time or part time or contract is a possibility.    Responsibilities   Test, development and maintenance of key system features and new innovations Work on HTML5 video playback and streaming in the browser Work with meeting applications like Zoom and Jitsi Work with other team members to investigate design approaches, prototype new technology and evaluate technical feasibility. Work in an Agile environment to deliver high quality software with short iterations.    Qualifications   2+ years of experience (education, self-study or work). Writing HTML, JS and CSS cross-browser compatible code JavaScript (Vanilla and Node.js), incl. debugging REST API Design and Implementation Agile workflows, git, ticket based team work, instant messaging Interest in working with interactive video-based communication software    Additional Skills   Good English, German is a plus, but not required Agile, iterative development approach: Interest to work with an international team and customers within short release cycles    Preferred skills & qualifications   Experience developing and deploying software services Experience with video based applications (Players, but also low level video highly appreciated) Excellence in technical communication with peers and non-technical cohorts. Drive and strong sense of ownership, urgency. Interest and/or experience in video communication, interactive VR, AR, 360 live streaming, Drone video. Optional: Experience with video player technology, videojs, hls, dash, mp4, h264, etc.    What we offer   Flexibility: Flexible hours, work from home and/or in our modern office located in Berlin-Tegel Responsibility: Agile processes, dynamic projects with challenges that provide space for creativity and demand ownership Opportunity: Employees have the chance to be part of a growing industry, new technology trends and make a significant difference with their contributions Insight: Flexible and transparent structure that provides insights regarding live video, product/services end-to-end, from the camera to the viewer, internally or regarding user interface Stability: Our technology is innovative yet established and based on longtime expertise. We are a profitable and reliable company. Perks & benefits: Free choice of the brands and technical equipment - you let us know what you can work best with. Plus: social events, superb coffee, water, refreshments and fruits. Technology: unique developments based on cloud and video APIs, backend and frontends, based on several tech stacks, like Javascript, React, NodeJS, REST APIs, Video Encoding, Communication, Streaming and Playback components, cross-platform HTML5 applications, WebRTC, Websockets, HLS, H264, data metrics and analytics, and more     Who we are    We’re not sitting around wondering what the product is and burning other people’s money while expecting everyone to work ridiculous hours for little reward. We’re profitable, organized, and, with nanoStream Cloud, we are already providing a unique solution that delivers huge value to our partners and customers.    We support diversity, equality and inclusion and encourage everyone who is qualified to apply.    Are you up for a challenge?    If you are excellent at what you do and genuinely aim to apply your skills to solve challenges and innovate together with a great team, we would love to hear from you! Take the next step, try out our live streaming platform (https://www.nanocosmos.de/blog/freetrial) and feel free to share your findings at jobs@nanocosmos.de.    Please submit your application via email to jobs@nanocosmos.de including a cover letter, resume and references, salary expectations and earliest starting date.    We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: System Engineer (m/f/d) for Directional Tool Development
Description: Do you enjoy being part of a successful team?   Would you like to work on industry leading systems?   Join our engineering team  As a leader in the oilfield services industry, Baker Hughes offers opportunities for qualified people who want to grow in our high-performance organization. Our leading technologies and our ability to apply them safely and effectively create value for our customers and shareholders.   Partner with the best  As a Systems Engineer, you are responsible for the development of directional tools. You are driving new product development of customer requests including consideration of functionality. You are working in an international environment with cross-functional departments.   As a System Engineer, you will be responsible for:    Deriving customer needs in collaboration with Product Line management and other stakeholders Collecting, elaborating, and managing service-, system-, and component requirements Analyzing requirements and their impact on system architecture and design Identifying and defining user journeys and deriving detailed user stories Elaborating high-level system architecture (functional and logical), use cases, and test cases Driving communication among engineering disciplines and end users Supporting system integration and system test activities through the full cycle of the product development process Promoting Systems Engineering and establishing best practices    Fuel your passion  To be successful in this role you will:    Have significant experience in Systems Engineering and Requirements Engineering in a mechatronic environment, preferably in the automotive or aerospace industry Have deep interdisciplinary technical interests and an understanding of mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, and software development Be fluent in English Have good presentation and writing skills Be self-contained, self-motivated, and have a structured approach to work Have preferably some experiences in project management Have preferably prior experience in software- or function development using model-based design, e.g., with Matlab/Simulink Have preferably experience with test methods, procedures, and related equipment Tools    Work in a way that works for you  We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:    Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive    Working with us  Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.   Working for you  Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we must push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:    Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities Safety net of life insurance and disability programs Tailored financial programs Additional elected or voluntary benefits    About Us:  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.   Join Us:  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.   Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.   R56531

Title: Software Engineer Azure (m/w/d)
Description: Microsoft, Azure , DevOPS, ANGULAR, Softwarentwicklung   Wir gestalten die Digitalisierung für eine bessere Welt   Als Digitaldienstleister für den Mittelstand und Konzerne realisiert die T-Systems Multimedia Solutions GmbH jährlich rund 3000 Projekte verschiedenster Größe und Komplexität in den unterschiedlichsten Branchen. Gemeinsam mit unseren Kund*innen gestalten wir die digitale Welt sicher, nutzerorientiert und für alle zugänglich. Title: Software- und Data-Engineer (m/w/d) - FESTANSTELLUNG
Description: OC Recruitment – Ihr Personalberater in den Life Sciences. Ihr Partner in Sachen Personalberatung in den Bereichen Pharma, Biotechnologie sowie Medizintechnik.  Wir vermitteln Fachkräfte auf Zeit und in Festanstellung/Direktvermittlung, d.h. die Einstellung erfolgt direkt beim Kunden. KEINE Zeitarbeit. In Deutschland. In Österreich. In der Schweiz.  Aufgaben  Für unseren Kunden im Raum Freiburg suchen wir einen Software- und Data-Engineer (m/w/d) mit den nachfolgenden Aufgaben:   Übernahme bereits bestehender implementierter Softwarelösungen sowohl im Bereich Pharma-Produktdaten und Prozesse als auch im Bereich Adressmanagement Betrieb, Anpassung und Weiterentwicklung der Lösungen mit Fokus Integration, Schnittstellen, Datenmodelle und Benutzeroberflächen Unterstützung bei der Konzeption und Implementierung eines unternehmensweiten Data Warehouse für die übergreifende Daten- und Reporting Struktur Identifikation von Prozessoptimierungspotenzialen durch Ergänzung vorhandener Standardprodukte durch individuelle Middleware Funktionen Erarbeitung von Lösungsvorschlägen und Umsetzungsszenarien in Abstimmung mit internen und externen Ansprechpartnern Optimierung der bestehenden Einsatzszenarien Aufwandsschätzungen für Lasten- oder Pflichtenhefte inkl. Pro- & Kontra-Abwägungen von unterschiedlichen Umsetzungsvarianten Erstellen von Software-Design und -Architektur-Dokumenten nach Anforderungsvorgaben Erstellung des Datenbankdesigns Implementierung des Produktiv-Codes (Server und/oder Client-Code) Durchführung von manuellen und automatisierten Tests z. B. auf einem Staging-Server Fehlerbehandlung und –Bereinigung bei Störungen, sowie Code-Optimierungen und/oder –Aktualisierungen Evaluierung neuer technischer Möglichkeiten wie z. B. neue Funktionen von Programmiersprachen, Entwicklerwerkzeugen, Frameworks und Code-Bibliotheken Wartung und Betrieb der Software-Installationen Unterstützung der erforderlichen Validierungsaktivitäten nach GAMP 5 Dokumentation und Unterstützung bei der Erstellung relevanter Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) und Schulungsunterlagen   Qualifikation  Sehr gute Kenntnisse in WebService-Architekturen – im Speziellen:   Entwicklung: C# (.Net-Framework) / Vîsual Studio / .Net Core Datenbank: Kenntnisse in Design und Abfrage (SQLServer) Erfahrungen im Bereich Data-Warehouse und Datenmodelle AppServer: ASP.NET Core MVC und EntityFramework Core UI-Gestaltung: HTML5 Branchenerfahrung im Bereich der Pharmazie, insbesondere hinsichtlich der Prozesse in der Serialisierung, dem Master Data Management und entlang der Supply Chain wünschenswert Erfahrungen bei der Integration von Softwareprodukten, Schnittstellen und Übertragungsformaten vor allem bezogen auf das Microsoft Produkt - Portfolio Kenntnisse über Technologien und Grundlagen mit logistischem Hintergrund, wie z.B. Barcode-Scannern und deren Codierungs-Standards Zielorientierte, eigenverantwortliche und teamorientierte Arbeitsweise Hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein   Gerne erläutere ich Ihnen Näheres zur Stelle. Ich freue mich auf Ihre Nachricht!

Title: Data Engineer im Bereich Data Integration (m/w/d)*
Description: Faszinierendes schaffen: Ihre Aufgaben   Konsolidierung, Aufbereitung und Bereitstellung von Unternehmensdaten für die Integrationsplattform Konzeption und Implementierung der Datenintegrationsschicht Entwicklung, Optimierung und Automatisierung von Data Pipelines Wartung und Administration der Integrationsplattform    Stärken einbringen: Ihre Qualifikationen   Studium im Bereich der Informatik oder alternativ eine Ausbildung im IT-Bereich mit einer mehrjährigen Berufserfahrung im Data Engineering-Umfeld Kenntnisse von Data Engineering-Tools und Data Integration-Technologien Erfahrung mit Instrumenten des Projektmanagements wünschenswert Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse Reisebereitschaft Ausgeprägte Kunden- und Dienstleistungsorientierung Hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative, Teamgeist und Flexibilität sowie eine gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit    Freiraum nutzen: Ihre Vorteile  Als weltweit agierendes Familienunternehmen bieten wir unseren Mitarbeitern langfristige und hervorragende Zukunftsperspektiven in einem innovativen Umfeld. Wir setzen auf die Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf, fördern durch unsere Akademie eine kontinuierliche Aus- und Weiterbildung und leben ein aktives Gesundheitsmanagement. Mit uns - als verlässlicher und unabhängiger Arbeitgeber - erwartet Sie ein sicherer Arbeitsplatz in einer erfolgreichen Firmengruppe mit attraktiver Vergütung, modernen Sozialleistungen und der Möglichkeit zum mobilen Arbeiten.  Gemeinsam schaffen wir Faszinierendes.   In dieser Stellenausschreibung wird aus Gründen der besseren Lesbarkeit und ohne Diskriminierungsabsicht die männliche Form verwendet. Hierin sind alle Geschlechter einbezogen.    Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns über Ihre Online-Bewerbung. Bei Fragen kontaktieren Sie bitte Henrik Schartow unter: +49 381 6006 3703.  Liebherr - One Passion. Many Opportunities.  Das Unternehmen  Die Liebherr-MCCtec Rostock GmbH ist einer der führenden europäischen Hersteller von maritimer Umschlagtechnik. Das Programm umfasst Schiffs-, Hafenmobil- und Offshore-Krane. Außerdem zählen Reachstacker und Komponenten für Containerkrane zum Produktportfolio.   Standort  Liebherr-MCCtec Rostock GmbH  Liebherrstraße 1  18147 Rostock  Deutschland (DE)   Kontakt  Henrik Schartow  +49 381 6006 3703

Title: Software Engineer SCM Applications (m/f/diverse)
Description: Description  Continental’s digital capabilities are growing every day. Our Supply Chain Information Technology Competence Center is the digital backbone of our company’s Tire business – and we want you to join us!   Our multinational, diverse team of technologists, mathematicians and business pros provides technology solutions to ensure that the more than 140 million tires Continental sells globally every year are produced and end up in the right place at the right time.   The team uses artificial intelligence, machine learning and advanced analytics to forecast customer demand and plan our global tire production. We’re ultimately focused on the customer experience and the continuous improvement of our supply chain.   We are currently looking for a dedicated Software Engineer for our supply chain planning team with focus on the following domains:    Continuously optimizing and enhancing master planning, replenishment planning, sales & operations and inventory management Designing and developing supply chain solutions based on standard IT products of Blue Yonder Guiding our internal customers through all project phases from analysis, design, implementation to solution rollout and operations Contributing to strategies and concepts for our future supply chain solution landscape Developing to become a technical IT expert for Blue Yonder (previously JDA) SCM solutions    Qualifications   Academic degree in computer science, business informatics, software engineering or comparable field of studies First working experience in logistics context or supply chain areas beneficial Basic knowledge and practical experience in the following technical domains: Linux / Unix environments, Shell scripting, Database systems and PL/SQL scripting Knowledge of IT solutions (such as i2, Blue Yonder / JDA, SAP) in SCM environments beneficial Personal interests for planning processes as part of business operations especially in the manufacturing industry High affinity for technical problem-solving using IT Business-fluent English language skills (spoken and written) Strong process-orientation and analytical way of thinking Clear and efficient communication skills Goal- and team-oriented working style Ability to independently structure and perform assigned workload Willingness to travel (10-20%)    Applications from severely handicapped people are welcome.   What We Offer  The job in numbers: You are going to work 37.5 hours per week in an international team. We offer 30 days of vacation per year.   Being part of a global IT team of thousands of colleagues working on various innovations and tasks, there is always an opportunity to grow and move into different directions within our corporation.   On top of that you can expect the following benefits:    Individual development planning based on your personal needs and targets (e. g. mentoring, trainings or global internal Software Academy) Work from home up to days per weekdays a week (unless workshops etc. require physical presence) Option to work from other EU countries up to 40 days per year 13 salaries per year Agile and collaborative workstyle Opportunity to make a difference Employee discounts Health insurance Assistance with child-care Parent-child office On-site physicians Sabbatical option    You would like to learn more about our benefits in detail? Click here .   If this sounds like a perfect match for you and if you want to become the next supporter of our core values Trust For One Another, Passion to Win and Freedom to Act, we are looking forward receiving your application.

Title: System Engineer Citrix/VDI (m/w/d)
Description: Ohne Menschen, deren Herz voll und ganz für IT schlägt, geht es nicht. Und darum suchen wir dich als System Engineer Citrix/VDI (m/w/d)  für unseren Standort in Rheda-Wiedenbrück.   Welche Aufgaben erwarten dich   Administration und Weiterentwicklung der Citrix Applikations- und Desktop-Virtualisierungslandschaft 2nd und 3rd Level Support für mittelständische und große Unternehmen im Rahmen der eingesetzten Services Unterstützung bei der Konzeption und Umsetzung von OnPremises- und Cloud-Projekten Beratung unserer Kunden zu IT-Lösungen   Wen wir uns wünschen   Du hast Spaß an IT-Themen Du hast großes Interesse an neuen Lösungen und Technologien Du bringst gute Kenntnisse zu Microsoft Windows und Grundkenntnisse unter Linux mit Du hast mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in der IT-Branche oder bist Berufseinsteiger:in mit einem erfolgreich abgeschlossenem Studium   Was wir dir bieten   Gute Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten für kreative Köpfe Die Möglichkeit der Arbeit aus dem Homeoffice Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten in angesagten IT-Technologien Mitarbeiter-Benefits wie Vertrauensarbeitszeit   Wer wir sind  Mit unseren innovativen IT-Lösungen unterstützen wir die digitale Transformation unserer Kunden weltweit. In ganz unterschiedlichen Branchen – vom globalen Handel über die internationale Medienindustrie bis zur Energie- und Versorgungswirtschaft. Rund 3.000 engagierte Mitarbeiter*innen an mehr als 25 Standorten sind für uns tätig. Unsere Kunden schätzen dabei vor allem unser exzellentes Know-how, das übergreifende technologische Wissen und den gelebten Unternehmergeist. Unsere Mitarbeiter*innen schätzen die partnerschaftliche Unternehmenskultur, die State-of-the-Art-Technologie sowie das Spektrum an Herausforderungen. Wir bieten viele Freiräume, um innovativ zu sein und im Team unternehmerische Verantwortung zu übernehmen.   Interessiert? Dann bewirb dich über unser Online-Bewerbungsformular mit deinen vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen inklusive der Zeugnisse und deiner Gehaltsvorstellung. Wir freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen!   Wie gehen wir mit Daten um? Weitere Hinweise zum Datenschutz auf unserer Homepage.
